loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita T. is 29 years old, married to Gilbert who works as a truck driver. They have two children: Genesis, 5 years old, who is in kindergarten; and Gios, 2 years old. They currently live in Barangay Minante 2, Cauayan City, Isabela. They rent a house at PHP500 monthly.
	
Clarita has had a hog-raising business for quite some time. The income from the business helps with their daily needs at home as well as their monthly expenses such as electricity, rent, etc. She is planning to borrow PHP15,000 as additional working capital to purchase hog feed.  In this way she can ensure that the hogs reach her desired weight and height so they can be sold at a high price. Clarita believes that if someone is patient and hard-working, somehow, that someone will also become successful in return.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Crescelinda

texts.en: Crescelinda G. manages a hog-raising business. She is now 41 years old and married to Carlito who is ten years older. They were blessed with three children: Arvil - 17 years old, a sophomore student in the tertiary level; Franklin - 15 years old; and Christian - 1 year old. They live in Minante 2 in the city of Cauayan. She is glad that she has a happy family in the villages. Crescelinda wants to grow her hog-raising business to improve her family's living and contribute to the education of her children. Crescelinda also looks forward to establishing a simple general store in the future to generate a daily income. Thus, she hopes to borrow PHP25,000 from KIVA as additional working capital for the improvement of her livestock business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
For more than a year, “Balot” vending has been the primary business of Mrs. Elsa S..  (Balot is a fertilized duck egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell). She earns a weekly net income of PHP300. She works patiently in order to generate income for her family. She seeks financial assistance from KIVA to further develop her business and expand into other kinds of business to increase her income. Elsa is hoping to borrow PHP18,000 as additional working capital.

Elsa is 47 years old. She is married to Ariel S., 36 years old. Her husband works as a tricycle operator. They help each other for the progress of their family. Unfortunately, the couple doesn’t have children yet. They are happily living at Barangay Minante 2 of Cauayan City.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.en:
In the city of San Roque G., about 13 kilometers outside of Carapeguá, a group of women of limited resources joined the program Committees of Women Entrepreneurs.  
These women are very active, and the majority of them sell their products on the streets, or participate in other activities.  They are looking for a little more support through credit so they can increase their income and improve their quality of life. 
They need this operation to invest in their respective jobs in order to achieve a sustainable amount of growth that allows them to develop individually and as a group. 

1	Justina A.-	   Small grocery store 
2	Gladys A.-	   Food sales 
3	Juana C.- 	   Undergarment sales 
4	Ana R.-	   Avon cosmetics sales 
5	Anatolia P.-	   Herbal medicine sales 
6	Norma G.-	   Small grocery store 
7	Estela G.-	   Vegetable sales 
8	Selvina B.- 	   Perfume sales 
9	Rosalia C.-	   Hen sales  
10	Andresa G.-	   Clothing sales  
11	Faustina R.-	   Chipa (a local bread) sales  
12	Ma-Norma Z.-	   Clothing sales 
13	Luciana F.-  	   Undergarment sales  
14	Florentina D.-  Vegetable sales 
15	Fidelina G.-	   Vegetable sales 
16	Gricelda D.- 	   Traveling sales 
17	Mirian R.-	   Herbal remedies sales  

There are 18 members of this committee, however one member decided to save her money, rather than take out a loan this cycle.

loans.use: The majority of the participants invest their credit in their respective businesses.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 31-year-old married man with one child. He has owned a beauty salon since 2004. He first started learning the family business fourteen years ago with the help of his father, who stood by him to be able to start a career for his son. Today, George is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy goods needed for his salon.

loans.use: To buy goods needed for his salon

loans.name: Estuista

texts.en:
Estuista is 59 years old and a vendor of different vegetables in their village in Minante 2, Cauayan City. According to her, she was married thrice and had four children with her second husband. Now she is happily living with Atendido, her third husband, though she has not been able to bear a child with him. Their village is around two kilometers away from the national highway.

Estuista believes that having her vending business will further support their daily living and give support to her four children, who are now living separately from her. With her desire to have a progressive vending business, Estuista is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 15,000 to use as additional business capital.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: German

texts.es: La señor German es chofer propietario, y esta inscrito en el sindicato Arco Iris, su negocio es sacrificado porque el tiene que trabajar desde las primeras horas de el dia hasta muy tarde solo asi puede tener una ganancia significativa, su dia de descanso son los dias miercoles, ese dia  no puede entrar al centro de la ciudad. Su esposa se dedica a la costura y la vende en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto en el departamento de La Paz; ellos tienen dos hijos que colaboran a su madre en la elaboracion de ropa y al mismo tiempo estudian, el cliente ya ha trabajado varios años en la institucion por lo cual es considerado un cliente antiguo y puntual, el destino del credito es para la reparacion de la movilidad para que trabaje sin dar ninguna molestia.
texts.en:
Señor German is an independent driver and a member of the Arco Iris trade union. His business requires great sacrifice in order to succeed, which means working very early hours of the day until late in the evening. He takes Wednesdays off, since he is not required to travel to the city center on those days.

His wife is a seamstress and sells her goods at the “16 de Julio” (July 16th) market in the city of El Alto in the La Paz district. He has two children who help with his wife’s clothing business and attend school at the same time. Señor German is a reliable long-time client who has worked with Emprender for several years. His loan will be used to repair his vehicle so that he can continue to work without any hassles.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is blessed with three children: 21-year-old Arnel, 20-year-old Arnold, and 13-year-old Charmaine, who is now the family's only hope to finish college. She is currently a high school sophomore. The family peacefully resides in the village of San Francisco of Cauayan City, where farming is the major source of income for most residents.
 
Herminio is a farmer. He maintains a vegetable (eggplant) farming business. He produces eggplant and other types of vegetables, depending on the season. He is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 as additional farming capital in order to sustain his business and increase his production. He will be purchasing agricultural inputs and allot financial support for the labor needed for vegetable farming business. Herminio is hoping that through KIVA his farming will become successful in the future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Emile

texts.en: Emile is a 65-year-old married man living with his four children, two of whom still attend high school. Thirty years ago, he opened his own grains and cereals shop, where he serviced the neighboring villages. Today, Emile is requesting to borrow $800 to buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila, 48, is married to Fortunato and they have two children: Fortunato Jr. (26 years old, and a medical representative) and Jonalyn (22 years old, single, and a recent college graduate. Prescila's husband works part-time as a laborer in their rural village where farming is their major source of income. 

Prescila has managed a small sari-sari store (typical village store) for seven years now. She earns around PHP 1000 weekly from the business. Prescila is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase a variety of goods like sardines, soft drinks, milk, biscuits, bread, and other basic commodities which are commonly consumed by most residents in her community. Prescila also wants her business to grow and expand into a fish and vegetable vending business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Justino

texts.es: Justino cuenta con 18 años de experiencia en la actividad como transportista, es casado, tiene casa propia, cuenta con dos hijos. Su negocio es de transporte con 18 años de experiencia y la esposa cuenta ingresos por venta de ganado ovino con experiencia de 32 años. La competencia en el mercado es alta. EL destino del crédito es para capital de operación (compra de repuestos). Este es su tercer crédito en la institución, cuenta con créditos en otras entidades financieras, Justino es un cliente antiguo en las otras instituciones y en AgroCapital cuenta con 20 meses de antigüedad.
texts.en:
Justino has 18 years of experience in transportation. He is married, owns his home and has two children. His business is transportation, which he has been doing for 18 years and his wife earns an income raising and selling sheep, which she has been doing for 32 years. Competition in the market is stiff. This loan will be used as working capital to buy spare parts. This is his third loan with our institution. He has loans with other financial institutions. Justino is a long-standing client with other financial institutions and has been a client of AgroCapital for 20 months.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Abdelhady

texts.en: AbdelHady is a 40-year-old married man living with his two children who are still in school. In 2001, AbdelHady decided to open his own roastery, currently named "A. Esaily Roastery," which was a good addition to the surrounding villages. Today, AbdelHady is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn manages a rice farming business in Barangay San Francisco of Cauayan City. Aside from that, she is also managing a livestock business. She is now seeking the assistance of Kiva lenders to support her rice farming in order to generate a higher yield every harvest. She is requesting to borrow PHP 20,000 that she will use in her rice farming and livestock raising businesses. 

Roselyn is 24 years old. When she was very young, she married Rolando D. R., Sr. who is a farmer. They have been blessed with two children: Rose Mae, 7, and Rolando D. R. Jr, 3. Roselyn is good mother to her children and a good wife to her husband. She hopes to overcome the difficulties of life and give her children a better future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invested in their respective businesses

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio es divorciado y vive solo, tiene hijos mayores los cuales son totalmente independientes. Eugenio se dedica a la atención de su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes (tienda de barrio) y un  salón de billar. La competencia es alta, pero cuenta con clientela fija de la misma zona, la cual demanda los productos que oferta. Eugenio surtirá su tienda con conservas de diferentes tipos que son de la canasta básica, así como harina,  arroz, azúcar y fideo (venta al raleo). Cuarto crédito al que accede Eugenio, se ha observado en los anteriores créditos tuvo un muy buen cumplimiento de pago.
texts.en:
Eugenio is divorced and lives alone. He has adult children who are entirely independent. Eugenio has a grocery store (a local convenience store) and a billiard hall. He has a great deal of competition, but he can count on his loyal customers from the neighbourhood who are requesting the products he offers. Eugenio will stock his store with a variety of canned goods as well as staple goods such as flour, sugar, rice and noodles (retail sales). This is Eugenio's fourth loan: he has a good repayment history on his previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: Sabino actualmente tiene 6 hijos pero ninguno de ellos a su cargo ya que son mayores de edad y no dependen de el económicamente , su negocio esta ubicado en su propio domicilio el tiene una pensión y se atiende  de lunes a domingo, acerca de la competencia de su negocio no tiene mucha competencia ya que al rededor de el hay venta de panchitos (hot dogs) y de masitas pero no de una pensión ,el destino del crédito es para la compra de electrodomésticos el cual lo usara en su negocio y le será muy útil. Sabino cuenta con un crédito en otra institución financiera el cual lo paga bien y también es cliente antiguo en agrocapital y tiene un buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en:
Sabino has six children, none of whom are dependent on him as they are adults and financially independent. His business is located in his home: he has a rooming house which he runs seven days a week. There is not much competition for business as nearby there are a hot dog sales business and a cookie-selling business but no other rooming houses. He will use this loan to buy household appliances for his business, which will be very useful. Sabino also has a loan from another financial institution which he has been repaying punctually in addition to being a long-standing client of Agrocapital. He has a good payment record.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy household appliances

loans.name: Rubby

texts.en: Rubby A. is divorced and has seven dependants. She has received schooling through primary school. Rubby sells assorted soap in Abotoase near Hohoe. Rubby, as a divorcee, is finding it difficult to take care of the family with her little income since she is solely responsible for all the financial needs of the seven dependants and other housekeeping expenses. Rubby will use the loan to purchase soap in large quantities to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rubby plans to save.

loans.use: To purchase soap in bulk

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en: Ramota sells provisions, jewelry and cosmetics in her shop. Ramota is 42 years old and married with four children. Ramota is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and jewelry to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and jewelry

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia tiene 44 años de edad , ella es soltera, tiene 2 hijos que le ayudan en el negocio que tiene, ellos viven en una vivienda que le han dado como caseros, desde hace varios años, ella tiene un lote propio , en el que todavía no ha construido, ella tiene su puesto propio de venta de frutas y carbón en el mercado de la localidad, tiene 13 años de experiencia en este negocio, hay competencia en la zona pero pese a ello existe bastante demanda, el crédito fue para invertir en su negocio de venta de frutas y yuca, carbón. Ella ya ha obtenido dos créditos anteriores en agrocapital , que lo ha cancelado puntual, actualmente tiene también crédito en otras entidades financieras, pero que se encuentra canceladas con puntualidad.
texts.en:
Celia, 44, is single, and she has two children who help her in her business. They live in a house she was given to take care of years ago. She has her own lot, but she has not yet constructed anything on it. She has her own place for selling fruit and charcoal in the local market. She has 13 years of experience in this business. There is competition in the zone, but there is also sufficient demand. The loan was to invest in her business of selling fruit, yucca, and charcoal. She has had two previous loans with Agrocapital, which she paid punctually. She currently also has loans in other financial entities, but they are repaid with punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to sell fruit and charcoal

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi B. sells cereals such as beans, rice, millet, groundnut and pepper in Abotoase near Hohoe. Naomi has received a junior high education.  She is married and has four dependants. Her husband is a trader who makes little income for a living. She is responsible for all the financial needs of the children including paying of school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is a mother of seven. She is 40 years old and married. Bola sells provisions and drinks. Bola is a client of LAPO, a Kiva partner. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchasing raw materials to process

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora María del Pilar A. Díaz tiene 27 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Incompleta,   tiene 3  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
María  se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió  en la compra de productos como pantalones jeans, zapatos escolares y de vestir.
El crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de  productos como pantalones jeans, zapatos escolares y de vestir para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria del Pilar A. D. is 27 years old and lives in the district of La Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She has not completed all of secondary school and has 3 children, who depend economically on her. Maria sells shoes and clothes. She runs her business from her house. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she received from New Hope II Community Bank, she invested in the purchase of products, like jeans and school and dressy shoes. With this loan of 500 soles, she will invest in the purchase of products like jeans and school and dressy shoes to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products like jeans and school and dressy shoes to stock her business

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is married with three children.  She is 43 years old and sells notebooks and textbooks in her shop.  Abigail hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more note books and text books to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase more books to sell.

loans.name: Sara María

texts.es:
La señora Sara María A. Díaz tiene 41 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa,   tiene 4  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Sara  se dedica a la venta de comida y cervezas, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 200 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió  en la compra de utencillos para el restaurante como ollas, platos y cerveza.
El crédito de 1500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de  productos como cerveza y gaseosas para implementar su negocio.
Sara tiene como sueño  tener su librería para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Señora Sara María A. S. is 41 years of age and lives in La Esperanza District of Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad. She completed her secondary education. She has four children who are economically dependent on her. Sara works selling prepared food and beer from her business which she operates out of her home. Her first loan of 200 Sols which she received from her Communal Bank, Nueva Esperanza II (the Second New Hope), was used to buy utensils for the restaurant, such as pots, dishes and beer. This loan of 1,500 Sols will be used to buy supplies such as beer and soft drinks in order to stock up her business. Sara has a dream of having her own bookstore in order to grow as the owner of a small business. To view her previous loans click here and here.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rene Mariana

texts.es:
La señora René Mariana Chávez B. tiene 43 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Superior Técnica Completa Secretariado Ejecutivo,   tiene 2 hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
René  se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a la crianza de pollos, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió  en la compra de productos de belleza como cremas, colonias, champús, lápiz labiales.
El crédito de 1200 soles, lo invertirá en la crianza de pollos para implementar su negocio.
René tiene como sueño  tener su granja para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. René Mariana Chávez B. is 43 years old and lives in the La Esperanza province of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru. She completed advanced executive secretarial studies and has two children who are both dependents. René sells beauty products and raises chickens for a living; she also works from home. She invested her first loan of 300 soles received from her communal bank “Nueva Esperanza,” in the purchase of beauty products like: creams, perfumes, shampoos, and lipsticks. This loan of 1,200 soles will be invested in raising chickens so she can get this business going. René has a dream of having her own farm so she can grow as a mirco-business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La crianza de pollos para implementar su negocio.

loans.name: Monicah Achieng

texts.en:
Monicah is 38 years old, the mother of three, and is married to Kennedy Nyabuto who operates a taxi in Eldoret town. Monicah survived the terrible post-election violence of 2007 but she had to temporarily close her business and four of her group members were displaced.

She has had four loans from Kadet and hopes that with this fifth loan she will be able to expand her business operations at her general store and open a wholesale shop in future.

Monicah plans to buy additional stock such as sacks of sugar, cooking fat, soft drinks and household items. To further diversify what her business has to offer customers, she intends to buy more clothing materials for her tailoring work. 

This will give her additional income which will enable her to further her children’s education and, eventually, own a house.

loans.use: To buy additional stock such as sacks of sugar, cooking fat, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Angel cuenta con 49 años de edad, vive en su propia casa ubicada en la zona oeste de la localidad, sus padres viven con él. Sus hijos mayores lo visitan cada fin de semana. Angel se dedica al arreglo de todo tipo de artículos eléctricos, ya que el tiene su propio taller de radio técnica por el mercado central de la localidad, actividad que realiza por muchos años. La verdad que la competencia es baja, ya que el es el único radio técnico por la zona. Por tales motivos; experiencia y ubicación tiene muchos clientes. Angel invirtió todo su crédito en lo que tenia previsto, es decir; repuestos y accesorios para su radio técnica. Este es el primer préstamo de Angel . Tiene un crédito en otra entidad financiera que esta pagando puntualmente.
texts.en:
Angel is 49. He lives in his own house, which is located in the zone to the west of the town. His parents live with him. His grown children visit every week end. Angel fixes all types of electrical items. He has his own radio electronics shop in the town’s central market. He has been doing this for many years. He does not have much competition because he is the only radio electronics technician in the zone. Because of his experience and location, he has a lot of customers. Angel invested all of his loan in what he said he would, replacement parts and accessories for his radio technology. This is Angel’s first loan. He has a loan, which he is repaying punctually, in another financial entity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy radio technology

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa L. Sánchez tiene 42 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Incompleta,   tiene 4  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
María   se dedica a la venta de comida, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió  en la compra de utencillos para el restaurante como ollas, taperes.
El crédito de 1000 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de  productos como verduras, frutas para implementar su negocio.
María tiene como sueño  tener su cafetería  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Teresa L. Sánchez is 42 years old, she lives in the La Esperanza District, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She studied part of her primary education, she has 4 kids who are economically dependent on her. María sells food, she has developed her business out of her home. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from her village bank New Hope II, she invested in the purchase of utensils for her restaurant like pots and tapers. The loan of 1000 soles will be invested in the purchase of products like vegetables and fruits used to implement her business. María has a dream of having her own cafeteria and to grow as a microentrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase such products as vegetables, fruits in order to implement her business.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin, 40, lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells eggs and provisions and is married with eight children. She hopes for a loan of N100, 000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Valeria es viuda, tiene 52 años y 4 hijos, Valeria tiene dos puestos uno propio y otro alquilado en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende zapatillas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Valeria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatillas.
Los sueños de Valeria son tener una tienda, comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Valeria is a member of the Village Bank The Seagulls. Valeria is a widow, she is 52 years old and has 4 kids. She has two booths, one her own and one rented in the market April 12th where she sells shoes, an activity she carries out with the help of her children. Valeria needs a 1000 soles loan that will be invested in the purchase of shoes. Valeria's dream is to have a store, to buy a plot of land and to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of shoes.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es casado, se dedica a prestar sus servicios en el transporte público como taxista con su vehiculo propio, la esposa posee una tienda de abarrotes con un punto de llamadas. Ambos tienen un hijo el mismo que vive con ellos. Poseen una tienda de barrio donde venden productos de la canasta familiar básica, (picadillo, viandadas, sardinas y otros), además de pan, harina, fideos, azúcar, aceite. La competencia es alta, pero cuentan con clientela fija de la misma zona y el barrio, la cual demanda los productos que oferta. Francisco surtirá su tienda con nuevos productos consistentes conservas de diferentes tipos, así como productos básicos de la canasta familiar (venta al raleo). Sexto crédito al que accede Francisco. Ha demostrado permanentemente buen cumplimiento y pago oportuno de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Francisco is married. He is a taxi driver, and he drives his own vehicle. His wife has a grocery store with a call center. They have a son, and he lives with them. They have a neighborhood store selling common products for families (ground meat, delicacies, sardines, and others) in addition to bread, flour, noodles, sugar, and oil. There is a lot of competition, but they have a fixed customer base from the same zone and neighborhood. These customers want the products that they sell. Francisco will stock his store with new products like different canned goods and basic needs items for families (sell at retail). This is Francisco’s sixth loan. He has shown consistently good completion of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria owns a book store where she sells notebooks and textbooks. She is 36 years old and married with four children. She hopes for the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more books to sell.  She says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase more notebooks and textbooks.

loans.name: Félix

texts.fr:
H. Félix est né vers 1980 à Abogomè dans la Commune de Akpro Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Félix réside dans cette Commune depuis son enfance et il y mène comme activité principale la coiffure. Félix a comme activité secondaire l'agriculture.  Félix est père de deux (02) enfants dont un (01) est scolarisé. 

Pour améliorer ses prestations de coiffure dans le but d’accroître ses revenus, Félix a besoin de moyens financiers pour acheter les équipements nécessaires dans son salon de coiffure. C’est la raison pour laquelle Félix sollicite un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Félix was born around 1980 in Abogomè in the township of Akpro Missérété in the Department of the Ouémé. Félix has been living in this township since infancy and he now works here as a hairdresser. Félix has a secondary business: agriculture. He is the father of 2 children, of whom one is enrolled in school.

To improve his services in order to grow his income, Félix needs capital to buy the necessary equipment for his hairdressing salon. This is the reason why Félix is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is married and has two children. She has a junior high school education. Evelyn is a seamstress and also sells fabrics in Abotoase, near Hohoe. Her husband is a teacher in the Ghana Education Service, who lives on a low income.

Evelyn uses her income to help her husband take care of home and parenting expenses. Evelyn will use the loan to buy fabrics to sell and sew for her customers. With the profits Evelyn plans to save.

loans.use: Buy variety of fabrics to sell and sew.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Justina es soltera, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Justina viaja a la ciudad de Lima cada 15 días a donde lleva quesos, tuna, maíz, entre otros productos según la temporada. Además Justina en algunas oportunidades trabaja como operaria en una empresa.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso.
Justina sueña con comprar una mototaxi para que trabajen sus hijos, tener una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Village Bank The Seagulls. Justina is single and has 2 children. Justina travels to the city of Lima every 15 days where she brings cheeses, tuna, corn, amongst other products depending on the season. Further Justina occasionally works as a business operator. Justina needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of cheese. Justina dreams of buying a motorcycle taxi so her children can work, and to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cheese.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Rosalina es separada, tiene 45 años y 6 hijos, Rosalina vende emoliente (bebida caliente preparada con semillas de lino y hierbas, que tiene propiedades curativas) actividad que realiza por las noches de manera ambulatoria. Además Rosalina teje chompas de acuerdo a pedidos.
Rosalina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, cebada y linaza.
Los sueños de Rosalina son construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a member of the Village Bank The Seagulls. Rosalina is seperated, is 45 years old and has six children. Rosalina sells emollient (a hot drink prepared with flax seeds and herbs, that has curative properties) an activity carried out at night on an outpatient basis. Further, Rosalina knits sweaters as requested. Rosalina need an 800 soles loan that will be invested in the purchase of wool, barley and flaxseed. Rosalina's dream is to build a home and to provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool, barley and flaxseed.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta tiene ya sus 50 años de edad, actualmente es separada de su marido desde hace muchos años, tiene varios hijos pero solo 3 dependen de ella. Vive en casa de sus padres. El negocio que tiene Vicenta es el de venta de comida en su domicilio, también tiene 2 equipos de amplificación los cuales prestan sus servicios de amenización de fiestas y también alquila sillas y mesas esto en colaboración de sus hijos. Lleva muchos años en la preparación y  venta de comida. En la zona no tiene competencia para esta actividad ya que sus precios son económicos y sus clientes son principalmente taxistas y vecinos de la zona. El crédito fue destinado para el pago de un dinero a terceras personas ya que su hijo tuvo un accidente en su auto y tuvieron muchos gastos. Vicenta es una buena cliente de agrocapital quien cancela sus cuotas con mucha puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Vicenta is now 50 years old. She has been separated from her husband for many years and has several children, but only three are dependents. They live in her parent’s house. Vicenta sells food from her home to make a living. She also has speakers she rents out for parties along with chairs and tables. Her children help her with this. She has been cooking and selling food for many years and does not have any competition in her area since her prices are low and most of her clients are taxi drivers and people from the neighborhood. The loan is to pay off people since her son had a car accident which incurred many expenses. Vicenta is a good agro-capital client who makes her payments on time. She is a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAGO DE PASIVO A TERCEROS

loans.name: José

texts.es: José tiene 38 años es un padre muy amoroso y cuidadoso, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su hijo menor Cristhian de 13 años. Él desea sobresalir en la vida y darle una buena educación a su hijo. Entre fierros y viejas carrocerías pasa sus días, su trabajo es el planchado y reparación de carros, actividad que ha sabido explotar muy bien y que actualmente le da los ingresos económicos necesarios para velar por la salud, educación y alimentación de su hijo. José es un buen mecánico y siempre tiene trabajos que realizar, debido al gran número de clientes que tiene, le gusta mucho reparar los carros y dejarlos como nuevos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y siente que lo más difícil de su trabajo es conseguir los repuestos necesarios para el arreglo de los autos, espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca más y pueda incrementar la cantidad de clientes que tiene y de esta manera llevar una mejor vida. Este es el primer préstamo de José con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y está dispuesto a realizarlas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es uno de los socios más participativos y solidarios. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos repuestos para la reparación de carros, y así podrá brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old and is a very loving and caring father, he lives in a rented house with his youngest son, 13 year old Cristhian. He wants to excel in life and provide a good education for his son. He spends his days between irons and old coaches, his job is ironing and repairing cars, an activity that has gone very well and now gives him the necessary income to ensure health, education and food for his son. José is a good mechanic and he always has work to do, due to the large number of customers he has. He really likes to repair cars and restore them as new. He has been doing this for 15 years, and he feels that the most difficult thing about his job is finding spare parts to fix the cars. He hopes his business will grow more in the future and that he can increase the number of customers he has, thus leading a better life. This is José's first loan with MFP, he knows he has to make his payments and is ready to make them on time, in his village bank he is one of the most participatory members who shows his solidarity. With the one thousand soles requested he will buy new spare parts to repair cars, this way he can provide better service to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es una mujer de 28 años muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en un cuarto alquilado y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa, la cual trae desde las ciudades de Tacna (sur del Perú) y Desaguadero (frontera con Bolivia). Marina es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de llevarse algo a casa y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre qué prenda les queda mejor. Lleva 5 años en esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder ir a ningún lado, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que realizarlo, espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y pueda tener una tienda de ropa más grande. Este el primer préstamo de Marina con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa y así podrá incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Marina is a 28 year old woman, who is very simple and hard-working. She lives in a rented room and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. Her stand is located in the market of San Jose (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She sells clothes, which she brings to the cities of Tacna (south of Peru) and Desaguadero (on the border with Bolivia). Marina is a very persuasive seller and always convinces her clients to buy something. What she likes most about her work is talking with her clients and advising them about what clothing is best for them. She has spent 5 years in this activity and what she likes least is having to spend all day at her stand without being able to go anywhere, even though she knows that this is her work and she has to do it. She hopes that in the future her business grows and that she can have a bigger clothing store. This is her first loan with MFP and she is ready to pay all of the installments on time, since she wants to take out other loans later. In her community bank, she is a very responsible and is an active member. With the 1000 new soles she has requested, she will buy more clothing and, in this way, she will be able to increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Ebere

texts.en: Ebere sells foodstuffs.  She is 32 years old and is married with three children.  She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.  She says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania de 38 años es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Epifanio de 38 años y su hija Maria de 18 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. Su negocio es la carpintería, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 10 años junto a su esposo, fabrican camas, mesas, sillas, etc, las cuales distribuyen entre los vendedores de muebles del mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Sus trabajos son de muy buena calidad y el acabado que realizan a sus muebles hacen que se vendan muy rápido, lo que más le gusta de su negocio es transformar la madera en cosas que la gente pueda usar, pero lo más difícil para ella es trasladar la madera hasta su casa, ya que le resulta muy cansado, aun así Melania desea continuar con su negocio y anhela poner su propia tienda de muebles donde pueda vender sus propios trabajos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra y contagia. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más madera para fabricar una mayor cantidad de muebles y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Melania, 38, is a happy and hard working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Epifanio, who is 38, and her daughter, Maria, who is 18. Maria wants to give them a good life. Maria’s business is carpentry. She has been in this business with her husband for over ten years. They make beds, tables, and chairs, etc. They distribute them to the furniture sellers in the Tupac Amaru market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Their work is of a very good quality, and the finishings they put on the furniture makes it sell very quickly. What she likes most about her business is transforming the wood into things that people can use. The most difficult thing for her is transporting the wood to her house. This makes her very tired. Even so, Melania wants to continue her business. She strives to set up her own furniture store where she can sell her own work. This is her first loan with MFP. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time. She does not want to cause problems for the members of her community bank, where she is well liked for her contagious joy. With the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for, she will buy more wood to make a greater quantity of furniture to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace B. is married and has five dependants. She has a junior high school education. Peace sells food stuffs such as yams, pepper groundnut in Abotoase, near Hohoe. Her husband is a trader who makes a small income.

Peace uses her income to help her husband keep the house. Peace will use her loan to purchase more of the food stuff to sell. With the new profits she plans to save.

loans.use: Purchase more of the food stuff to sell.

loans.name: Mondoukpè

texts.fr:
H. Mondoukpè est née le 21 Décembre 1963 à Porto Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Mondoukpè est mère de trois (03) enfants dont deux (02) sont scolarisés. Mondoukpè réside avec sa famille  dans la Commune d'Adjarra où elle mène son activité. 

En effet, Mondoukpè est dans le secteur de la bijouterie. Pour acheter le matériel nécessaire pour son activité Mondoukpè a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’elle n’en possède. C’est la raison pour laquelle Mondoukpè s’est tournée vers ALIDé pour avoir de prêt pour équiper son atelier de bijouterie en vue d'une meilleure prestation à sa clientèle.
texts.en:
H. Mondoukpè was born on December 21, 1963 in Porto Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. Mondoukpè is the mother of 3 children, of whom two are enrolled in school. Mondoukpè lives with her family in the Township of Adjarra where she also runs her business.

In fact, Mondoukpè works making jewelry. In order to buy the necessary equipment for her business, Mondoukpè needs financial means that she does not possess. This is the reason why Mondoukpè has come to ALIDé to take out a loan to equip her jewelry workshop so as to better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of material for her jewelry workshop

loans.name: Adim

texts.en: Adim sells provisions and drinks.  She has been in this business for the past 15 years.  She is 45 years old and married with seven children.  She hopes for the loan of N150,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica M. is 38 years old, divorced and the mother of three children, all girls. All are in junior high and primary schools. She lives in a rented apartment in a town called Dwenase, in the Western Region.

She is a food vendor who prepares and sells rice and stew. Veronica sells on a table top each morning. Veronica wants a loan to buy rice and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Veronica has been in business for seven years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To food in bulk.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Ana es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Ana junto a su esposo venden condimentos, especerías como canela, clavo de olor, hongos, productos que son embolsados en pequeñas cantidades, los cuales los venden en las ferias y también reparten a las tiendas.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hongos y canela.
Los sueños de Ana son tener una tienda propia y comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Las Gaviotas Community Bank. She is 23, in a common law marriage, and has one son. Ana and her husband sell condiments and spices like cinnamon, cloves, mushrooms, and products bagged in small packages. They sell these items in the fairs and they also distribute to stores. Ana needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy mushrooms and cinnamon. Ana’s dreams are to have her own store and to buy some land.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mushrooms and cinnamon

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy querida en su familia, vive en la casa que construyó con mucho esfuerzo y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella es una vendedora muy alegre y convincente y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios. Olga trae la ropa desde las ciudades de Tacna y Desaguadero (frontera con Bolivia) y siempre se preocupa por traer las prendas que están de moda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta e informarse sobre las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 20 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar la ropa por autobús, ya que las largas distancias le resultan muy casadas, aun así sabe que tiene que poner todo su esfuerzo por salir adelante. Para un futuro cercano espera tener una gran tienda de ropa, donde pueda vender con más comodidad su mercadería. Este es el primer préstamo de Olga con MFP, está dispuesta a ahorrar todos los días un poco para poder pagar su crédI. por completo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Olga, 46, is a very beloved woman in her family. She lives in the house it took her great effort to construct. Her greatest wish is to improve her quality of life. She sells clothes from her stand in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She is a happy and convincing sales person, and she always greets her customers with a smile on her face. Olga brings the clothes from the cities of Tacna and Desaguadero (on the Bolivian border), and she always takes care to bring clothes that are in style. What she likes most about her work is talking with her neighboring sales women and finding out about what is happening in the market. She has been in this business for 20 years. The hardest part is transporting the clothes by bus. Traveling long distances is very tiring. Even so, she knows that she needs to use all of her strength to get ahead. In the near future she would like to have a big clothing store where she could sell her merchandise more comfortably. This is Olga’s first loan with MFP. She is prepared to save a little every day in order to be able to completely repay her loan. In her community bank she is very responsible, and she is always up to date with the agreements between members. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is asking for to buy clothes to increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita A. is 38 years old, married and has given birth to three children, one boy and two girls. All are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works at a local sawmill.

Rita is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew on a table top by the road each morning. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Rita buys her goods from Kumasi and has been in business for seven years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es socio del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Javier es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Javier vende diferentes productos según la temporada y según la demanda, como gorras y guantes en épocas de frió, en julio sombreros y lentes, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria.
Javier necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gorras y bufandas.
Los sueños de Javier son comprar un terreno en el centro de la ciudad para construir una tienda.
texts.en:
Javier is a member of the “Las Gaviotas” community bank. He is 34, lives with his common-law wife and their 4 children. Javier sells different products depending on the season and the demand, for example he sells hats and gloves when it is cold and in July he sells sunglasses and summer hats as a street vendor. Javier needs a loan for 1,000 soles that he will invest in hats and scarves. Javier dreams of buying some land in the center of the city so he can build a store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: hats and scarves

loans.name: Mma

texts.en: Mma A. is 54 years old.  She is married and has given birth to seven children, three sons and four daughters.  All attend school.  She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase, in the Western Region.  Her husband works at a local sawmill firm while she is a food vendor. Mma prepares and sells porridge in the mornings.  She wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.  Mma buys her goods from nearby communities. Mma has been in business for over ten years.  Mma aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: Buy maize in bulk.

loans.name: Florina

texts.es:
Florina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Florina es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Florina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende gorras variadas, también vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho de manera ambulatoria.
Florina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gorras de diversos colores.
Los sueños de Florina son tener una tienda y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Florina is a member of the “Las Gaviotas” community bank. She is 23, lives with her common-law husband and their 2 children. Florina travels to different markets in the region where she sells a variety of hats. She also sells in Ayacucho city as a street vendor. Florina needs a loan for 600 soles that she will invest in hats of varying colors. Florina dreams of having a store and also that her children will be able to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: hats

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria Y. is 37 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. She is a hard working woman. Victoria runs a provisions store. She sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store on the street. She has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hoping to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon M. sells corn mills and components in Abotoase near Hohoe. Simon did not receive any formal education. He is married and has six dependants. His wife is a petty trader with a small income. He is responsible for all the financial needs of the children. With the high demand for corn mills and components, his loan will be used to buy to more components of the corn mill to sell. He hopes to save the new profits from his business.

loans.use: To buy more components for corn mills

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She cooks and sells fufu (fufu is made from cassava). Ann is 30 years old and married with five children. Ann is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more cassava to make more fufu to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Myrcea Stefhany

texts.es:
Myrcea es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Myrcea es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, estudiante de contabilidad en un instituto, Myrcea tiene un puesto en le mercado 12 de abril en donde vende calzados variados, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama, Myrcea además vende ropa a pedido.
Myrcea necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados.
Los sueños de Myrcea son tener un local amplio y una empresa.
texts.en:
Myrcea is a member of “Las Gaviotas” community bank. She is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She is an accounting student and also has a booth at the 12 de abril market, where she sells a variety of shoes, with her mother’s help. Myrcea also sells custom-order clothing. She needs a loan for 800 soles that she will invest in shoes. Myrcea dreams of having her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: shoes

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet O. is a married mother of seven children, four sons and three daughters, who are all currently still in school – senior high, junior high and primary schools. She is 45 years old. Janet lives with her children and husband in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a professional teacher. She is a baker. She bakes bread in her community. She supplies bread to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks to sell. She buys bags of flour from Kumasi. Janet has been in business for over three years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
Anatolia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Anatolia es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijos, Anatolia viaja a las diferentes ferias D. L. región 3 veces por semana en donD. venD. ropa variada, productos que adquiere en L. ciudad D. Lima.
Anatolia necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. ropa para adultos.
Los sueños D. Anatolia son que su hija sea profesional y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of “Las Gaviotas” community bank. She is 27 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has one child. She travels to different markets in the region three times a week to sell a variety of clothing, which she purchases in the city of Lima. Antonia needs a loan for 800 soles that she will invest in clothing for adults. Antonia dreams of seeing her daughter become a professional and of having her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothing

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina A. is 28 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, one girl and one boy who are both in primary school at the moment. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Angelina’s husband runs a drinking spot. She is a trader. She trades in utensils. She buys her goods, sets of utensils, from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks and treks to other markets to sell as well. Angelina has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy utensils in bulk

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda A. is a food vendor and sells clothes at Melcom in Hohoe. Linda has received a senior high education. She is single and has one child. Linda has been selling food and clothes since 1999. With the high demand for her food and clothes, her loan will be used to buy more clothes to satisfy her customer’s needs. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ruth Constanza

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Ruth es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Ruth vende ropa variada a pedido, sus ventas los realiza a trabajadores de las distintas instituciones y son en mayor parte al crédito, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Ruth necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sacos y blusas.
Los sueños de Ruth son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y brindar todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Hormigas Community Bank. Ruth is 49, married, and she has three children. Ruth sells various clothing by order. She sells to the workers in different institutions. She mostly sells on credit. She gets her products in the city of Lima. Ruth needs a loan for 1,400 PEN to buy jackets and blouses. Ruth’s dreams are to have her children become professionals, to improve her business, and to give her children everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jackets and blouses

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama B. is thirty-three years old. She is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters. Some are currently in the junior high while others are in the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Her husband works with a local sawmill firm while she is a food vendor. Mama prepares and sells porridge. She sells at the lorry station in the mornings. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. Mama buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for ten years. Mama aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas
Mercedes es casada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Mercedes vende frutas en el mercadillo Sr. De Arequipa de manera ambulatoria en una carretilla, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de sus hijos.
Mercedes necesita un préstamo de 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas.
Los sueños de Mercedes son comprar una casa, educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Hormigas Community Bank. Mercedes is 33, married, and she has two children. Mercedes sells fruit on foot from her cart in the Sr. De Arequipa market. She sells every day with some help from her children. Mercedes needs a loan for 400 PEN to buy fruit. Mercedes’ dreams are to buy a house, educate her children, and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience A. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through senior high. Patience sells soft drinks such as Fanta, Sprite Coca-Cola and assorted fruit drinks at Melcom in Hohoe, which she has done since 1998. Patience will use the loan to purchase more of the assorted soft drinks and revive her salon as well. With the new profits from her expanded business, Patience plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To buy drinks for resale and to invest in salon

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Mercedes es casada, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Mercedes venD. comida en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza por las mañanas D. manera ambulatoria, además Mercedes venD. golosinas en L. puerta D. su casa por las tardes y noches.
Mercedes necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. azúcar, arroz y golosinas.
Los sueños D. Mercedes son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Hormigas Community Bank. Mercedes is 48, married, and she has six children. Mercedes sells food in the Nery García market. She sells on foot in the mornings. Mercedes also sells sweets in the doorway to her house in the afternoons and evenings. Mercedes needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy sugar, rice, and sweets. Mercedes’ dreams are for her children to become professionals and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, and sweets

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary F. is fifty-three years old. She is married and has four children, two daughters and two sons. Some are currently in senior high while others are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Her husband is retired. She is a food vendor. She cooks and sells ‘banku’, a local dish from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She sells at the market square in the mornings. Mary wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. She has been in business for over ten years. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Margarita es soltera, tiene 58 años y 1 hijo, Margarita tiene una polleria llamada Margarita, esta ubicada en una avenida concurrida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 2 personales. Además Margarita tiene una farmacia en la ciudad de Lima, negocio que esta administrado por su hijo.
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicinas.
Los sueños de Margarita son mejorar su negocio y ser una empresaria grande.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the communal bank “Hormingas.” She is 58 years old, single, and has a son. Margarita has a poultry store called Margarita that is located on a very busy street. Two people help her in the store. Margarita also has a pharmacy in Lima that her son manages. Margarita needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy medicine with. Margarita’s dream is to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de medicinas.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina B. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters. Some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Augustina’s husband is a commercial driver while she is a trader. She trades in ceramic wares.

Augustina makes ceramic wares such as cups, bowls, earthen wares, etc. herself. She has hired hands that work for her. She fires the wares in a kiln after production. She hawks and treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy clay and firewood. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy clay for making ceramics

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice B. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through senior high. Alice sells a variety of cosmetics and clothing at Melcom in Hohoe, which she has done since 1999. Her husband is a trader who earns little from his trading activities.

With the high demand for Alice’s cosmetics, she will use the loan to buy a variety of cosmetics and clothing to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alice plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cosmetics and clothing to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia B. is thirty-eight years old, married, and has given birth to three children: one boy and two girls. All are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works with a farmer.

Afia is a food vendor, preparing and selling rice balls. She has been in business for three years. She sells on a table by the roadside from morning to evening. She buys her goods from Kumasi and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia K. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: one girl and one boy who are both in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband works with a local sawmill firm.

Afia is a trader. She trades in jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, chains, rings, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es socio del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui que significa Ojos Negros en quechua.
Marcelino es conviviente, tiene 66 años y 10 hijos de los cuales solo 2 viven con el, Marcelino junto a su esposa e hijos se dedican a confeccionar chompas, bufandas, para lo cual tienen maquinas tejedoras, además Marcelino viaja a Puno de donde compra chompas hechas, sus ventas los realiza en las ferias y también en la ciudad de manera ambulatoria.
Marcelino necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas.
Los sueños de Marcelino son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcelino is an associate of the Communal Bank Yana Ñahui which means Dark Eyes in quechua. Marcelino lives with his partner, is 66 years old, and has 10 children, of whom only 2 live with him. Marcelino, together with his wife and children, make jumpers and scarves, for which they have sewing machines. Marcelino also travels to Puno where he buys ready-made jumpers which he sells at fairs and also in the city door to door. Marcelino needs a loan of 2500 soles, money which will be invested in buying jumpers. Marcelino's dream is to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jumpers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret E. is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children: one boy and two girls. All are currently in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is an electrician.

Margaret is a trader. She trades in a local food called gari which is made from cassava flour. It can be eaten on its own or with roasted groundnuts (peanuts). She sells on a table at the market square and also supplies other retailers. Margaret buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina es socia del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui que significa Ojos Negros en quechua.
Rufina es soltera, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Rufina tiene un puesto alquilado en le mercado Carmen Alto en donde vende papa, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija.
Rufina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Los sueños de Rufina son educar a sus hijos y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Rufina is an associate of the Communal Bank Yana Ñahui which means Dark Eyes in quechua. Rufina is single, is 36 years old, and has 3 children. Rufina has a rented stand in the Carmen Alto market where she sells potatoes, an activity she does every day with the help of her daughter. Rufina needs a loan of 900 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of potatoes. Her dreams are to educate her children and to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael S. is twenty-six years old. He is single and independent. Though Michael has no child, he caters for two of his younger siblings. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital and is a commercial and farming town.

Michael is a trader. He trades in a shop selling all kinds of electrical goods such as radios, fans, television sets, etc. His shop is located at the roadside. Michael procures his goods from Kumasi. He has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy more goods to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods to increase his stock

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui que significa Ojos Negros en quechua.
Teofila es casada, tiene 55 años y tubo 12 hijos de los cuales 6 viven con ella, Teofila vende comida típica en una feria de comidas típicas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Teofila necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos.
Los sueños de Teofila son mejorar su negocio, tener una tienda de abarrotes y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Yana Ñahui Village Bank, which means Black Eyes in the Kechua language. She is 55-years-old, married, and has 12 children, 6 of whom still live with her. She sells traditional food on a daily basis at a traditional food street market. She needs a loan of 900 soles, which she'll use to buy rice, sugar, and pasta. Teofila's dreams include improving her business, having a grocery store, and seeing her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and pasta.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia K. is twenty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: a boy and a girl, both of whom are currently in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. She is a hard working woman. Her husband is a carpenter by profession.

Cynthia runs a provision store. She sells groceries such as Milo (a milk beverage), sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store on the street. She has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to expand her business

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola es socia del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui que significa Ojos Negros en quechua.
Lola es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Lola tiene un puesto en el mercado Carmen alto en donde vende verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Lola necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una computadora para sus hijos.
Lola sueña con educar a todos sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lola is a member of the Yana Ñahui Village Bank, which means Black Eyes in the Kechua language. She is 44, and married with 3 children. She sells vegetables from her stall at the Carmen Alto market on a daily basis with the help of her husband. Lola is seeking a loan of 900 soles, which she plans to use as partial payment for a computer for her kids. She dreams of educating all of her children and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: As partial payment on a computer for her kids.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui que significa Ojos Negros en quechua.
Andrea es viuda, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Andrea tiene un puesto en el mercado Carmen alto en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días por las mañanas, Andrea tiene proyectado cambiar de negocio por la venta de cereales.
Andrea necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Andrea son ayudar a su hijo a comprar un terreno y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the Yana Ñahui VIllage Bank. Yana Ñahui means "black eyes" in Quechua. Andrea is 50 years old and is the widowed mother of two children. Andrea has a stand in the Carmen Alto Market, where she sells prepared meals each morning. Andrea plans to switch businesses and start selling grains instead. Andrea needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy more grians. Andrea's dreams are to help her son buy a plot of land and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret K. is thirty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children: one boy and two girls. All are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Margaret is a food vendor dealing in pastries. She says she serves orders from customers and also supplies to provisions stores. Margaret also hawks (sells door-to-door) in her community to sell. She has been in business for two years.

Margaret buys her materials from Kumasi. She wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui que significa Ojos Negros en quechua.
Cristina es viuda, tiene 57 años y 11 hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ella, Cristina tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado que se esta ubicado cerca de varias instituciones, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Cristina necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Cristina son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the Yana Ñahui Village Bank. Yana Ñahui means "black eyes" in Quechua. Cristina is 57 years old and is the widowed mother of 11 children, 4 of whom live with her. Cristina runs a restaurant from a space she rents near various institutions. She works seven days a week. Cristina needs a loan of 2500 soles to buy rice and sugar. Cristina's dreams are to improve her business and for her children to become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Felicia sells foodstuffs and household appliances at Melcom in Hohoe, which she has done since 1995. Her husband is a petty trader who earns little for a living. Felicia uses her income in supporting her husband in paying the housekeeping expenses.

Felicia will use the loan to buy more of the foodstuffs and household appliances that she sells to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Felicia plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and household appliances to expand her business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia B. is thirty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to three children: one boy and two girls. All are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works with a local sawmill firm.

Felicia is a food vendor. She sells roasted plantain and yam by the roadside in the afternoons. She sells with roasted groundnuts (peanuts). She buys her goods from nearby communities. Felicia has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy plantains and yams in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy plantains and yams in bulk

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
