Debora N. is thirty-four years old. She is a married and has given birth to one child, a girl, who is currently in the nursery school. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a mason.

Debora is a seamstress by profession. She designs and sews for clients and also for sale. Debora has her workshop on the street in her community. She says that, at the moment, she has six apprentices under training. She has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy textiles and other sewing accessories in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her child a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles and other sewing accessories in bulk

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is the married mother of five children: three sons and two daughters who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. Akosua is forty years old and lives with her children and husband in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a pastor.

Akosua is a baker. She bakes bread in her community. She supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell as well. She buys bags of flour from Kumasi.

Akosua has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina O. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a son, who is yet to start school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a farmer.

Faustina is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She supplies food vendors and retailers and also treks to other markets to sell.

Faustina has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to sponsor all her children in school to the apex.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana N. is 52 years old, married and has four children, a daughter and three sons, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in Ghana's Western Region. Her husband works for a cocoa company, and Christiana works as a trader, selling kerosene by the gallon. She buys her supplies in bulk from distributers in tank cars. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy more kerosene to sell to her customers. Christiana goals are to expand her business and continue to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy kerosene in bulk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mene

texts.en: Mene K. is 38 years old, divorced and has a son who is in junior high school. She and her son live in a rented apartment in a town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital, and is a commercial and farming center. Mene is a trader who sells electrical goods such as rice cookers, stoves, blenders and other items. She sells in her community and in nearby towns. Mene has been in business for 12 years and is applying for this loan to buy items in bulk to sell to her custoemrs.

loans.use: To buy electrical items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna O. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through senior high school. Edna sells veterinary drugs at Abotoase near Hohoe, and has done this business for quite some time now. Her husband is a teacher. Edna uses her income to pay for school fees and housekeeping expenses. She will use her loan to purchase more drugs to sell to the farmers to treat their animals. With the new profits from her expanded business, Edna plans to reinvest to enable her meet her financial responsibilities.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs to sell to farmers to treat their animals

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes D. is a married and the mother of three children, two sons and one daughter, all of whom are currently in the primary school. She is 25 years old, and lives with her children and husband in a house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a student at the moment, while she makes a living as a baker, supplying bread to her community. Agnes has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She wants to expand her business and make enough money to give her children good educations.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour in bulk

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. is 43 years old, married and has five children, two sons and three daughters, all of whom are currently in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in Ghana's Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works in a sawmill. Hannah is a trader who makes a living selling food items such as plantain, cassava and yam. She sells from a table top at the local market, and travels to nearby towns to buy items in bulk for resale. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been in business for 10 years, and hopes to expand her business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy food in bulk to resell to her customers

loans.name: Blaise

texts.fr:
Z. Blaise est né le 29 Avril 1981 à Porto Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Blaise est marié et est père de deux (02) enfants tous scolarisés. Blaise réside avec sa famille dans Commune de Akpro Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. 

Blaise a comme activité principale la coiffure.  Afin de se faire plus de revenus Blaise a comme activité secondaire la vente de produits lubrifiants. Pour acheter le matériel nécessaire dans son salon de coiffure Blaise a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’il n’en possède. C’est la raison pour laquelle Blaise se tourne vers ALIDé pour avoir de prêt afin d’équiper son salon de coiffure en vue d'une meilleure prestation pour sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Z. Blaise was born on April 29, 1981 in Porto Novo, administrative and political capital of Benin. Blaise is married and the father of 2 children, both enrolled in school. He lives with his family in the Township of Akpro Missérété in the Department of the Ouémé.

Blaise's main work is hairdressing. So as to make more income, Blaise also sells lubricants. In order to buy the necessary equipment for his salon, Blaise needs financial means that he does not possess. This is the reason why Blaise has come to ALIDé to take out a loan to equip his hairdressing salon so he can better serve his clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of equipment and hairdressing products

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en: Kwabena M. is 37 years old, married and has four children, two sons and two daughters, all of whom are still in primary school. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a commercial town in Ghana's Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. His wife is a hard-working woman, and Kwabena runs a grocery store with her. The couple sells groceries such as sugar, rice, candies and bread in a store on a busy street. He has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy more items to sell to his customers, and to expand his business. He hopes to improve his family's standard of living and give all of his children good educations.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk to sell to his customers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is a mother of five children, two sons and three daughters, who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and primary schools. She is thirty-nine years old and married. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a tailor by profession.

Mary trades in bags of salt. She supplies them to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also sells under a shed-roof in the market square and treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Mary buys bags of salt from the distributors. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy bags of salt in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of salt

loans.name: Fytila

texts.fr:
K. Fytila est né le 17 Octobre 1972 à Porto Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Fytila est marié et est père de deux (02) enfants dont un seul est scolarisé. Fytila réside avec sa famille dans Commune de Akpro Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. 
Fytila est un mécanicien vélomoteur. 

Malgré la passion que Fytila a pour son métier, Fytila ne dispose pas assez de moyens financiers pour équiper son atelier de mécanique en vue d’offrir de meilleures prestations à sa clientèle. Fytila sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé pour y arriver et aussi pour faire plus de revenu capable de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
K. Fytila was born on October 17, 1972 in Porto Novo, administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. Fytila is married and the father of two children, of whom only one is enrolled in school. Fytila lives with his family in the Township of Akpro Missérété in the Department of the Ouémé. He is a bicycle repairman.

In spite of the enthusiasm Fytila has for his job, he does not have enough capital to equip his workshop so that he can offer better services to his clientele. Fytila is requesting a loan from ALIDé to manage this and also so that he do better at making a living and catering for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of equipment for repairing bicycles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth S. is a married mother of four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and primary schools. She is fifty-five years old. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Elizabeth’s husband is a retired bauxite miner. She deals in agrochemicals. Elizabeth sells agricultural chemicals such as herbicides, pesticides, fertilizers, etc. She sells in a shop by the road side. She supplies to farmers in her community and treks to other markets to sell as well. Elizabeth has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy agrochemicals in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy agrochemicals for resale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses D. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through senior high school. Moses sells "Fan" milk and ice creams at Abotoase near Hohoe, which he has done for quite some time now. His wife is a petty trader.

Moses uses his income to pay housekeeping expenses. Moses will use the loan to buy more ice cream, "Fan" milk and other "Fan" products for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Moses plans to reinvest to improve his capital and profits.

loans.use: to buy more ice cream, Fan Milk,  and other Fan products for resale

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua Y. is thirty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Akosua is a petty trader. She sells plantains and smoked fish. She sells on a table top at the market square. Akosua supplies the greater part of her merchandise to retailers and food vendors. She wants a loan to buy plantains in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. Akosua has been in business for ten years. She aspires to expand her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy plantains in bulk

loans.name: Sagbo Michel

texts.fr:
H. Sagbo Michel est né vers 1975 à Akpro-Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Sagbo Michel est père de quatre (04) enfants tous scolarisés. Sagbo Michel réside avec sa famille à Akpro centre toujours dans le Département de l’Ouémé.  

Sagbo Michel est couturier et en a fait son activité principale. La couture procure à Sagbo Michel des revenus qui l’aide à gagner sa vie. Toutefois, Sagbo Michel a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’il n’en a actuellement pour équiper son atelier de couture en vue d’offrir de meilleures prestations à sa clientèle et de faire plus de revenus pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire mieux les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
H. Sagbo Michel was born around 1975 in Akpro-Missérété in the Department of the Ouémé. Sagbo Michel is the father of 4 children, all enrolled in school. He lives with his family in Akpro Centre, also in the Department of the Ouémé.

Sagbo Michel is a tailor and he makes that his primary business. Tailoring is how he manages to earn his living. However, he needs more capital than he has right now to outfit his workshop in order to offer better services to his clientele and make more income so that he can better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of equipment and supplies for tailoring

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort B. is a married mother of four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and primary schools. She is forty-eight years old. Comfort lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Comfort’s husband is a farmer. She deals in agrochemicals. She sells agricultural chemicals such as weed-killer, pesticides, fertilizers, etc. She sells in a shop by the road side. Comfort supplies to farmers in her community and treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy agrochemicals in bulk. Comfort desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy agrochemicals

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 50 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus 3 hijos que son solteros y trabajan independientemente. Desde hace 5 años vende comida regional en todas sus variedades, además de frutas y golosinas en un pequeño puesto que acondiciona fuera de su casa. Adela vende durante todo el día y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar activa y demostrar que es una persona útil, además su negocio es rentable porque cuenta con sus clientes regulares que le compran desde el primer momento en que se inició. Posteriormente, Adela quiere llegar a tener un restaurante de comida típica de su zona.Este es si 8vo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que existe responsabilidad en los pagos y mucha unión entre sus compañeros. Con el dinero que solicita comprará frutas, golosinas e ingredientes para sus comidas, con otra parte adquirirá madera para hacer algunas reparaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Adela is a 50 year old single mother that lives with her 3 children who are single and work. She has been selling for the last 5 years a variety of regional cusine meals, as well as fruits and candy in a small booth in the front of her home. Adela sells all day and is doing very well. What she likes about her job is to be active and prove that she is useful. Her business is profitable because of her regular customers that have been buying her meals since she started the business.

Adela wants to have a regional cuisine restaurant. This is her 8th loan with MFP and what she likes about the community bank is that there is a commitment in making payments and the union among their members. With the money requested she will buy fruits, candies and the ingredients to prepare the meals. A percentage of the loan will be used to buy wood to repair her home.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and repair home

loans.name: Purchase Of Groceries To Restock Her Grocery Shop,

texts.es:
GREIS I. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS NAZARENAS”, vive en el Jr. Agustín Cauper N° 245 del distrito de Camporverde, tiene 35 años, 02 hijos y su esposo trabaja en una empresa de transportes.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa usada y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 10 años, con él, compró algunas prendas más y afianzo su negocio. Actualmente continúa con la venta de ropas usadas y además tiene una pequeña bodega.

Con este préstamo de S/.1000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su pequeña bodega y ropa usada que luego los vende en los caseríos.

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta por la ayuda que da a las mujeres para salir adelante y así estas puedan aportar a la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Greis I. S. is a member of the community bank "Las Nazarenas", and lives in Camporverde district. She is 35 years old and has 2 children with her husband who works for a transportation company. She has a business selling second hand clothing. She started the business 10 years ago, with a loan that she invested in the purchase of clothes and the enhancement of her business. She is currently selling second hand clothes and has a small grocery shop as well.

She is asking for a loan of $350 that will be invested in the purchase of groceries to restock her grocery shop, and second hand clothing that she will sell in the villages. During the short time that she has been working with Manuela Ramos, she has been happy for the help given to women to succeed, so they can contribute to provide for the household.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

borrowers.first_name: Purchase Of Groceries To Restock Her Grocery Shop,

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace N. sells yams at Abotoase near Hohoe. Grace has received Junior High School education. She is married and has 4 dependents. Grace has been selling yams for some time now. She is responsible for taking care of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more yams for resale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest and increase her capital  and profit.

loans.use: buy more yams for resale

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 24 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y su hijo de 3 añitos en la casa es de ellos. Ante la circunstancia de quedarse sola con su hijo, recibió el apoyo de sus padres quienes le dieron la oportunidad de instalar un negocio de venta de abarrotes para que pueda solventar sus gastos y los de su hijo. Con esta pequeña bodega lleva 3 años y está surgiendo poco a poco, atiende durante todo el día y le está yendo bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar en actividad, además de estar muy agradecida con sus padres por haberle enseñado a ser responsable. Ella considera que la rentabilidad de su negocio se debe a que se encuentra ubicada en buena zona y es la única persona que vende este tipo de productos en su barrio. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que le dieron la oportunidad de salir adelante, aprendiendo mucho sobre la responsabilidad y la solidaridad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará madera para ampliar y mejorar el espacio de su negocio, también adquirirá abarrotes y bebidas para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Delia is 24 years old, is a single mother, and lives with her parents and 3 year old son in her parents' house. Before the circumstances that left her alone with her son, she received the support of her parents, who gave her the opportunity to install a grocery sales business so that she could clear her expenses and those of her son. She has had this small grocery store for 3 years and it is developing little by little. She attends it all day and it is going well for her. What she likes about her job is the activity, as well she is very grateful to her parents for having taught her to be responsible. She considers the profitability of her business is owing to its location in a good zone, and also because she is the only person who sells this type of product in her neighbourhood. This is her fifth loan with MFP and what she likes about her communal bank is that they have given her the opportunity to move forward, learning a lot about responsibility and solidarity. With the money she is seeking she will buy wood to extend and improve her business space, and will also acquire grocery items and drinks to provide in her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Groceries to stock in supermarket and improve shop space

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis es viuda, vive con sus 3 hijas quienes se autoeducan y la apoyan mucho. La casa donde habitan es propia. Desde hace 12 años vende condimentos en todas sus variedades y los distribuye a todas las bodegas que se encuentran por su zona, los mismos que deja al crédito o al contado. Y cuenta con el apoyo de una de sus hijas que reparte los mismos productos por otros lugares. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y sobre todo conocer nuevos lugares para incrementar sus ventas, además este negocio le es rentable porque sus condimentos son muy demandados debido al uso para las amas de casa y los restaurantes. Para más adelante, Gladis quiere comprar una movilidad para repartir con mayor comodidad sus productos. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son puntuales en sus pagos y sobre todo que se comprenden mucho entre todos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más condimentos para seguir abasteciendo a sus clientes y con otro tanto, invertirá en el negocio de una de sus hijas que se dedica a la compra y venta de madera.
texts.en:
Gladis is widowed and lives with her three daughters, who are educating themselves and are very supportive of their mother. For the past 12 years, Gladis has been selling all kinds of different spices, which she distributes to local grocery stores for payments in cash or on credit. One of her daughters helps her with the business by distributing spices in other areas. Her favorite parts of her job are giving good customer service and traveling to new places to increase her sales. Her business is profitable because the spices she sells are in high demand from restaurants and housewives. Gladis would like to buy a car in the future to make the distribution of her products easier. This is her eighth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma; her favorite part about her village bank is that her fellow members make their loan payments punctually and understand one another. With the requested loan, Gladis will buy more spices so that she can continue to supply them to her clients and will also invest in her daughter's lumber sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spices and invest in daughter's lumber sales business

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 54 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus 2 hijas quienes también son madres solteras y la apoyan mucho. Hace 10 años se dedicaba a la venta de pescado en un puesto del mercado de su localidad y gracias a la buena relación que tenía con sus clientes, uno de ellos la contactó con los dueños (norteamericanos) de una planta llamada Inguirilla, donde desde hace 2 años empezó a trabajar. Pero para incrementar sus ganancias, vienen vendiendo gaseosas a todos sus compañeros de trabajo y le va muy bien. Lo bueno es que cuenta con el apoyo de sus jefes que le permiten realizar su negocio, sin descuidar su trabajo y le es muy rentable porque vende diariamente gran cantidad. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos son comprensibles, unidos y muy solidarios. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más gaseosas y con otra parte mandará a reparar algunas imperfecciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Irma is 54 years old and is the single mother of two daughters, who she lives with. Her daughters are also single mothers and are very supportive of her. For the past ten years, Irma had been selling fish from a stand at the local market. She had a very good relationship with her clients, and one of them put her in touch with the American owners of the Inguirilla plant, where she started working two years ago. In order to supplement her earnings, she also sells sodas to her coworkers, which is going very well for her. Her bosses let her carry out this business without any trouble as long as she doesn't neglect her work duties. This is very profitable for her, because she sells a large number of sodas each day. This is Irma's fifth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. Her favorite part of village bank membership is that her fellow group members are understanding, united, and show great solidarity amongst themselves. With the requested loan, Irma will buy more sodas and will also pay for some home repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sodas, pay for home repairs

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr: Cette promotrice est une commerçante, elle vend des habits chaussures et bijoux. Elle se rend chaque 15 jour à Dakar pour se ravitailler. Elle habite à Mbour à quelques 80km de Dakar. Elle est  âgée de 27 ans. Elle est mariée  et mère de deux enfants.  Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer aux dépenses de la maison. Le  sollicité lui permettra de renforcer ses activités en achetant plus de marchandises pour répondre à la demande des clients
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a merchant, selling clothing, shoes, and costume jewelry. She goes to Dakar every two weeks to replenish her stocks. She lives in Mbour, about 80 KM from Dakar. She is 27, married, and has 2 children.

The income from her business allows her to help support the family. The requested loan will permit her to bolster this business by buying more merchandise so that she can meet the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: add to her inventory

loans.name: Kantu San Jerónimo Group

texts.en:
Kantu San Jerónimo Bank is a group of 15 lenders that has been together for around 10 years. They are based in San Jerónimo, a small community located 20 minutes south of Cusco, Perú. They are currently in their second loan cycle with Asociación Arariwa, and regularly bring new members into the group and alternate the leadership positions. 

Members include housewives who run small businesses such as general stores and daycare centers from their homes.  They plan to buy merchandise for their businesses or to fix up their homes with the money. Griselda, the newest member, is a part-time university student who studies psychology and needs the loan to help finance her education.

David is the current president of Kantu San Jerónimo. He has three children and runs a metal carpentry shop for producing things such as furniture, doors, stairwells, and window frames. He wants to purchase new machinery for his store with this loan.

The group met at Arariwa headquarters in Cusco to discuss the terms and conditions of their loan. They are committed to paying it back on time and are grateful to have access to the capital needed to run their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase new machinery for metal carpentry shop

loans.name: Fahed

texts.en:
Fahed is a young man who is married and has two children. Fahed has been working in baking for ten years and currently has his own bakery, where he makes bread, Ka'ak, and sweets.

Fahed's business is growing, and there is strong demand for his products since he has an excellent reputation and the bakery is located at the entrance of Bethlehem's old city.

Fahed requested a loan of 1,000 USD from FATEN in order to renovate the bakery and buy some supplies.

Fahed appears on the picture organizing his products

loans.use: Improve the bakery and buy new goods

loans.name: Khawlah

texts.en:
Khawlah is forty years old.  She has four children, two of whom are still at school while the older two are in university. Her husband is a retired government employee who has a small workshop for olive wood carving.

Khawla has a shop in Beit Sahour, a town that is very close to Bethlehem.  Khawla sells carpets, bed covers, mattress and cushion covers, curtains, and mats. She started the business four years ago to meet her children's university expenses.

She approached FATEN to get a loan to buy goods for the summer since a lot of people get married during this season, and the demand for such products increases.

loans.use: To buy summer goods for the store

loans.name: Nafeesah

texts.en:
Nafeesah is a forty-year-old married woman with seven children. Nafeesah and her husband own a small grocery shop, which is the only source of income for the family. Their shop is located in Saffa, a village near Ramallah. Nafeesah manages this grocery shop with her husband.

With the loan of 1,500 USD, Nafeesah plans to buy new products to add more variety to her small shop. This is her first loan with FATEN. 

Nafeesah is pictured above at her shop.

loans.use: Buy Goods

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer owns a store where she sells CDs, accessories, teddy bears, and gifts. The business was started 10 years ago and has undergone continuous improvements. Abeer manages the business with the help of her husband, Na'el.  They have one child who is one and a half years old.

This is Abeer's first loan with FATEN. She requested 3,000 USD to re-decorate the store and buy new goods. 

Abeer appears in the picture with her husband.

loans.use: New decoration for the store and buy goods

loans.name: Mazouza

texts.en:
Mazouza is a 42-year-old married woman with 8 Children, all under the age of 18. She owns a grocery shop at Kharas village, near Hebron, while her husband works at a carpet shop in another city. Mazouza has one employee who helps her manage the grocery shop. 

Mazouza received more than ten loans from FATEN, all of which were fully repaid on time.  She has requested a new loan to buy goods for the store.

(The picture is of Mazouza in her store.)

loans.use: Buy goods for the Store

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 33-year-old Palestinian woman. She is married and has three children, a three-year-old daughter and two sons aged nine and ten.

Mai has been working in agriculture since she finished school. She has considerable experience in cultivation and planting. Her business grew dramatically, and Mai now owns a greenhouse, where she grows cucumbers, peas, and beans.

Mai is a very active woman and has other businesses in addition to the greenhouse. She raises rabbits and runs a small day care, where she currently has eight children. Mai says that she will do everything she can to ensure a better life for her children.
 
Mai's husband is a government employee but he helps in the greenhouse and sells the products at the vegetable market. Her mother-in-law helps to manage the day care and take care of the children. 

Mai has been a client at FATEN for more than eight years. She has received more than ten loans, all of which were fully repaid on time.

(The picture shows Mai in her greenhouse.)

loans.use: buy seedings, ferilizer

location.town: Biet Ommar Village, Hebron Destrict/West Bank

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah is a 34-year-old woman. She and her husband, Sulaiman, have four children - three girls: Bashayer who is eight years old, Dima who is six years old, Nada who is four years old; and one boy Ghandy who is one and a half years old.
 
Kifah and Sulaiman noticed that there was high demand for natural herbs medicine and started a business selling these products a few months ago. The idea for the business came from Kifah, who has good experience in this area and wanted to help her husband to improve the family income. Many people prefer natural herbs over ordinary medicine since they have no side effects. Also, they are cheaper, especially since the GAZA strip is under siege and modern medicine is very expensive. So, Kifah thought of creating this micro business.


The business is primarily managed by Kifah since her husband is employed elsewhere, but he helps her after finishing his work. They asked FATEN for this loan in order to meet the high demand and buy new herbs and oil. They also want to upgrade the store decoration. 

(In the picture, Kifah appears in her shop with her husband.)

loans.use: Raw Materials

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Don Ramón is 45 years old, married, and has two children. He has been an entrepreneur for more than four years. He owns a small workshop where, with the help of his wife, he makes leather belts, bags, and shoes. He also travels around selling various merchandise such as jeans, shirts, shorts, shoes, etc. He has more than 300 clients with whom he constantly works according to their needs and orders.

Through this activity he is able to provide the basic necessities to his family, as well as funding his children’s education.

loans.use: purchase of jeans for women and men, and leather for making belts

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.es:
GULNARA R. D. V. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS NAZARENAS” vive en la Av. Víctor Andrés BelaunD. del distrito D. CampoverD., en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 55 años D. edad, 4 hijos mayores y su pareja es empleado D. una empresa maderera.

Se inició en el negocio D. la costura, y el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró telas e hilos, para hacer sabanas y vender a sus amigos y vecinos.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. repuestos para autos ya que tiene un taller donD. ofrece el servicio D. reparación D. autos.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad D. familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres D. esta zona a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy muy contenta con esta ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Gulnara R. D. V. is a member of the "Las Nazarenas" Village Bank and lives on Victor Andres BelaunD. Street on CampoverD. District in the city of Pucallpa. She is 55 years old and has four adult children; her husband works for a lumber company. Gulnara first started out as a seamstress, and used her first loan of 300 soles to buy fabric and thread to make sheets to sell to her friends and neighbors. With this loan of 2,000 soles, Gulnara will buy replacement car parts, since she also has an auto repair shop. "Manuela Ramos is an NGO that supports a great number of families with small loans that allow women in this area to begin or improve their businesses, and I'm very happy with this help," Gulnara says.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement car parts

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
HORTENCIA P. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS”, vive en el Jr. Ricardo palma Nº 394 del distrito de Calleria, tiene 53 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada y 3 hijos menores de edad. Se desempeña como microempresaria en el rubro transportes ya que posee dos motocars y vende gaseosas.

Tiene 9 años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, el cual lo utilizó para comprar gaseosas, luego invirtió su ganancia en un motocar y hoy en día posee su segundo motocar. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá para comprar repuestos y realizar el adecuado mantenimiento de sus vehículos.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos porque logró obtener un crédito financiero sin tanto trámite y empezar su vida como microempresaria, el cual la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Hortencia P. R. is a member of the Mujeres Solidarias Village Bank and lives in Calleria District. She is 53 years old and married with three dependent children; her husband works as a heavy machinery operator. She runs a small transportation business with the two motorcycle taxis she owns, and she also sells sodas. Hortencia has been working with Manuela Ramos for nine years. The first loan she took out was for 300 soles, which she used to buy sodas, then invested the profits in the purchase of her first motorcycle taxi. She now has two motorcycle taxis. With this loan of 1000 soles, Hortencia will buy replacement parts and conduct routine maintenance on her vehicles. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because the institution has allowed her to take out loans without having to go through a lot of paperwork, and thus she was able to start her life as a small businesswoman. This motivates her to be responsible when it comes to making loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts and conduct maintenance on motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Mrs. Clementina Insfran V.D. P. is 60 years old and has been a widow for ten years.  She has three older children; Rossana is a teacher, Marlene is a lawyer, and Jimmy is in his third year of law school.  

They used to have a small grocery store in their house that she could not maintain very well.  As time passed, and with the help of the loans given to her by the Fundación Paraguaya, Clementina began selling jewelry and also working as a cook in a local hospital in the city Areguá.  She has various clients for her food sales in the hospital.  

In the future she would like to open a general store in her home as she will retire soon from working at the hospital.

loans.use: purchase of silver

loans.name: Ara Puahu Group

texts.en:
This committee Ara Puahu formed due to the internal problems of another committee, which dissolved.  Some of the women from that group decided to form the committee Ara Puahu in order to continue investing in their small businesses and to be able to progress and improve their families’ quality of life through the Fundación Pargauaya’s program.  The committee is now in their second cycle and is made up of 15 women who work in their own respective businesses. 

1	María D. C. D.- Hair salon 
2	Norma D.-	General store 
3	Myrian Galeano-	General store 
4	Melissa A.-	Shoe sales 
5	Celba O.- Food sales 
6	Cornelia S.- Food sales 
7	Fermina S.- General store 
8	María Raquel B.- Food sales 
9	Zulma H.- Cosmetics sales 
10	Timotea G.-  Food sales 
11	Crispina G.-	Dressmaker 
12	Cirila N. A.- Beverage sales 
13	Melina N.- Cleaning product sales 
14	María Juana M.-  General store 
15	Liz Liliana F.- Small grocery store

texts.en:
Angelina G. initiated contact for this committee. She invited and organized her friends and neighbors in order to form a program of Women Entrepreneurs.

M.- Clothing and cosmetics sales 13 Clides Daina G.- Food sales 14 Ana Fernanadez- Dressmaker 15 Buenaventura L.- Small grocery store and clothing sales

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 28 años, vive junto a su esposo quien es constructor y la apoya en lo posible, tienen una hija de 9 años que está estudiando y es su mayor inspiración para salir adelante. Desde hace 2 años vende productos de belleza por catálogo para una línea cosmética muy reconocida, estos productos los vende sólo a pedido ya que cuenta con clientes selectos y regulares. Gracias a las ventas que produjo durante estos años pudo implementar un negocio de venta de verduras en un puesto del mercado de su localidad, donde su esposo se dedica a la atención. A Maria le gusta mucho su trabajo porque ha aprendido mucho acerca del comercio y lo importante que es brindar una buena atención a los clientes. Lo bueno es que sus clientes atraen a otros clientes y cada día sigue creciendo. Para más adelante, Maria quiere tener una tienda de ropa. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos son unidos y existe mucha solidaridad ante los problemas que se les presentan. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos de belleza y verduras para su puesto.
texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old and lives with her husband who is a construction worker, and supports her as much as possible. They have a 9 year old daughter who goes to school and is their greatest inspiration to succeed. She has been selling beauty products trough catalog for a well known cosmetics company for the last 2 years. These products are sold on request as it has selected and regular customers. Thanks to the cosmetic’s sales during these years, she was able to start a business selling vegetables at a market in their locality. Her husband runs it.

Maria loves her job because she learned a lot about the business and how important it is to provide good customer service. The good news is that their customers attract other customers, so it keeps growing every day. Maria wants to have a clothing store in the future. This is her 2nd MFP loan. What she likes about her community bank is that all the members are united and there is a lot of sympathy and support for the problems they face. With the money requested she will buy beauty products and vegetables to sell in her booth.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela tiene 40 años, es profesora de nivel inicial, vive con su esposo quien brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro, tienen una hija de 9 años y también viven con su sobrino de 19 años. Por las mañanas trabaja en una institución educativa y por las tardes tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas) en su propia casa, donde atiende de lunes a domingo. A Mariela le gusta su trabajo porque mediante éste hace muchos amigos y gana clientes, además le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada y cuenta con clientes regulares que son generalmente los trabajadores de una empresa cercana a su casa, quienes acuden a su negocio por la buena atención y amabilidad que les brinda. Para más adelante, Mariela quiere tener un local más grande y con un mejor ambiente. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros se comprenden y demuestran mucha responsabilidad. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más cervezas y gaseosas para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariela is an elementary teacher who is 40 years old. She lives with her husband who works as a moto-taxi driver. They live with their 9 year old daughter and a 19 year old nephew. She works as a School teacher in the morning and sells beer and soft drinks from her home in the afternoon, from Monday through Sunday.

Mariela likes her job because she makes lots of friends and gets customers. Her business is cost effective because it is located in a very busy area. She has regular customers that are usually employees of a company located near her house, who go to her business because of the kindness and good service that she offers. Mariela wants to have a bigger and nicer establishment.

This is her 8th loan with MFP. What she likes about the community bank is that all their members show understanding and demonstrate a sense of responsibility. With the loan requested she is planning to buy more beer and soft drinks to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nila

texts.es: Nila tiene 26 años, es madre de 2 hijos y vive junto a su pareja quien la apoya en todo, la casa donde habitan es propia. Ella es propietaria y administradora de dos motocarros; adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, los mismos que lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares de su zona de casa en casa, dejándolos al crédito o al contado a sus clientes. Los motocarros los tiene desde hace un año, siendo uno de ellos manejado por su esposo y el otro por un chofer particular. La venta de productos de belleza es algo que acaba de empezar a realizar y ha puesto todas sus energías para crecer en este negocio. Lo que le gusta de sus trabajos es que son actividades que la mantienen activa y segura de sí misma para salir adelante. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que entre todos se apoyan mucho y existe confianza en la realización de un trabajo responsable. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para sus motocarros, puesto que necesita reparar algunos desperfectos urgentemente.
texts.en:
Nila, 26, has two children and lives with their father who supports her in everything. They live in their own house. She is the owner and administrator of two motorcycle carts. She also sells beauty products. She sells the products by going door to door in different places of her zone. She sells to her customers on credit or for cash. She has had the motorcycle carts for one year. Her husband drives one of them, and the other is driven by a private driver. The sale of beauty products is something that she has just started to do. She has put all of her energy into growing this business. What she likes best about her work activities is that they keep her active and self-confident about being able to get ahead. This is her eighth loan with MFP. What she likes about working with her community bank is that they support each other so much, and she likes the confidence that exists in doing responsible work. The money she is asking for is to buy replacement parts for her motorcycle carts. They are in urgent need of repair.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her motorcycle carts

loans.name: Jesús Misericordioso Group

texts.en:
Nilsa V. started this committee and invited her friends and neighbors to be part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs.

15	Angelina F. - Fruit sales
16	Martha R. - Clothing sales
17	Benita F. - Cosmetics sales

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell or of raw materials

loans.name: Martina Isabel

texts.en: Mrs. Martina Isabel was born in the city of Luque. She has been married for more than ten years to Mr. Pablo Anastacio C.. Together they have two older children. Martina owns a small grocery store that she runs out of her home, while her husband is a shoemaker. In order to have a larger family income, Pablo also travels frequently to Buenos Aires, Argentina, to make shoes. Martina has been working with the Fundación Paraguaya since 2003 and the last loan she took out was to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, food items and beverages

loans.name: Pedro Cesar

texts.en:
Mr. Pedro B. is single and works transporting objects with the truck he owns. Because the majority of his charters have been for construction materials, Pedro decided to open a small depository for these materials with his savings and he currently transports his own construction materials.

He will use this loan to purchase bricks, tiles, rocks, sand, and support beams. In the future, he is thinking about taking out a larger loan with the Fundación Paraguaya to increase his stock of merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase bricks, tiles, rocks, sand, and support beams.

loans.name: Sixta

texts.en:
Sixta left her husband five years ago, after a long marriage. She is 42 years old, separated, and lives with her three children, who are independent and have their own businesses. After owning a thriving family business, she had to start her life and business over again. She bought a new house and started a new business, challenging destiny.

With her savings from five years, she has been able to acquire a business in the market in Luque, where she sells garments for women, men, and children. She is requesting a loan to purchase a wide variety of winter garments.

loans.use: Purchase winter garments for resale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS NAZARENAS”, viveen la Av. Víctor Andrés Belaunde Nº 226, Distrito de Campoverde, tiene 61 años y 7 hijos mayores.

Ella vendía comida en el parque central del distrito de Campoverde, el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual lo invirtió en la compra de algunos víveres para preparar sus platillos ya que vendía comida. Actualmente se dedica a su bodega, el cual está creciendo poco a poco

Con este préstamo de S/.1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en comprar diversos abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da y la contribución con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of “ Las Nazarenas” Community Bank. She is 61 years old, lives in Campoverde District and has 7 adult children. She sold food in the Campoverde District Park. Her first loan received from Manuela Ramos was for $300 Nuevos Soles that she invested in the purchase of some ingredients to prepare meals to sell.

She is currently selling groceries at her small shop, which is growing little by little. She is requesting a loan for $600 that will invest in buying products to restock her grocery shop. She thanks Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and makes contribution to the women of that area.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ursulina

texts.en: Mrs. Ursulina A. was born in the city Aregúa, is the mother of three older children, and owns a small grocery store that she has operated out of her home for more than seven years. She has been a client of the Fundación Paraguaya since 2007. She used her last loan to purchase merchandise from Argentina. That loan helped her household income and at the same time helped her make small renovations to her home in order to improver her quality of life. She is requesting a new loan for the same purpose.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise from Buenos Aires, Argentina including food and beverage items in general.

loans.name: Union Collana Group

texts.es:
Doña Gloria Gregoria I. César tiene 47 años de edad, casada y con cuatro hijos. Desde hace dos años y cuatro meses viene trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, ocupa el cargo de presidenta en el banco comunal “Unión Collana”, llamado así por el apoyo que tienen entre sí los once integrantes, quienes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. 
La señora Gloria narra que antes de conocer los beneficios de EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, ella y su esposo contaban como únicos ingresos los productos que le proporcionaba una vaca que le había sido obsequiada por su padre y una pequeña hectárea de cultivo, vendiendo los productos de la cosecha y el queso a los diferentes mercados de Chosica. Gloria queriendo brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, es que tiene la visión de adquirir crédito con el fin de comprar más ganado; así mismo acude a EDAPROSPO–PROSPERIDAD para realizar una de sus grandes metas. Gracias a los esfuerzos de ella, su esposo y al apoyo de nuestra institución se hizo realidad el sueño de darles educación superior a sus cuatro hijos, además de instalar una pequeña tienda. Gloria es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha logrado sus propósitos, y con éste crédito implementará más su tienda, lo cual obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria Gregoria I. César tiene 47 años de edad, casada y con cuatro hijos. Desde hace dos años y cuatro meses viene trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, ocupa el cargo de presidenta en el banco comunal “Unión Collana”, llamado así por el apoyo que tienen entre sí los once integrantes, quienes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. La señora Gloria narra que antes de conocer los beneficios de EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, ella y su esposo contaban como únicos ingresos los productos que le proporcionaba una vaca que le había sido obsequiada por su padre y una pequeña hectárea de cultivo, vendiendo los productos de la cosecha y el queso a los diferentes mercados de Chosica. Gloria queriendo brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, es que tiene la visión de adquirir crédito con el fin de comprar más ganado; así mismo acude a EDAPROSPO–PROSPERIDAD para realizar una de sus grandes metas. Gracias a los esfuerzos de ella, su esposo y al apoyo de nuestra institución se hizo realidad el sueño de darles educación superior a sus cuatro hijos, además de instalar una pequeña tienda. Gloria es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha logrado sus propósitos, y con éste crédito implementará más su tienda, lo cual obtendrá mayores ingresos.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Epifania es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 4 hijos, Epifania viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende verduras, frutas, y de las ferias compra cereales, quesos que vende en el mercado cerca de su casa.
Epifania necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Epifania son educar a sus hijos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Epifania is a member of the “Sonrisa “Community Bank. She is 26 years old and has 4 children. Epifania travels to different fairs in the area, where she sells vegetables, fruits, and buy cereals and cheeses that later she sells in the market near her home. She is requesting a loan of $200 which will invest in the purchase of cereals. Her dreams are to give her kids an education and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 41 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos Perla de 15 años y Fabricio de 11 en su casa propia. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que desde muy joven incursionó en varios oficios, pero al tener su familia su dedicación tenía que ser hacia ellos, ya que sus hijos aún están en edad escolar, es por eso que decidió incursionar en el negocio de la venta de cerveza, ya que este negocio le permite realizarlo desde su casa, pudiendo, a la par, atender a su familia. Gloria realiza pedidos al camión distribuidor de estas bebidas y posteriormente las vende en su domicilio, siempre trata de tener una buena cantidad de producto, puesto que esta bebida es muy solicitada y obtiene buenos ingresos con la venta, aunque veces no tiene el dinero necesario para pedir en mayores cantidades y cuando llega el fin de semana, cuando hay mayor demanda, ya se le terminaron sus productos. Gloria espera seguir creciendo en su negocio, ya que gracias a éste se siente independiente y brinda a su hogar una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es una clienta antigua de Microfinanzas PRISMA y siempre ha mostrado dedicación y responsabilidad hacia su banco comunal, además sus compañeras también son sus amigas. Con el dinero que esta vez está solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de estas bebidas para que le alcance para los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old and lives with her partner and her children: Perla, who is 15, and Fabricio, who is 11. She owns her own home. She is a very hard-working woman, and has done various jobs since she was very young. After having her children, though, she had to shift her focus to them. Once her children were both in school, she decided to get back to work. She started selling beer, since she could do so from home and thus care for her family at the same time. Gloria places orders with beer delivery trucks, then sells the beer from her home. She tries to keep well-stocked, since this beverage is in high demand and she earns good money selling it. Sometimes, though, she doesn't have enough money to buy large quantities of beer and runs out by the time the weekend comes. Gloria hopes to continue to expand her business, since it makes her feel independent and helps her provide her family with a higher quality of life. She is a long-time client of Microfinanzas PRISMA, and has always shown herself to be dedicated and responsible to her village bank. Her fellow group members are also her friends. With this loan, Gloria will buy more beer so that her supply will last through the weekend.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 39 años, está casada pero vive sólo con sus hijos; Pablo de 21, Jorge de 18 y Carmen de 15 años, ya que su esposo viajó en busca de trabajo a otro país desde donde le manda algún dinero para los gastos de su hogar. Al ver los sacrificios de su esposo se decidió a trabajar por su cuenta para poder generar ingresos extras, dedicándose a algo que pueda realizar desde su casa sin descuidar a su familia. Es así que optó por algo que siempre le gustó; “la bisutería”, ya que con este trabajo puede dejar volar su imaginación y crear diferentes diseños de collares, pulseras, anillos, etc, los cuales son vendidos por pedido. Para esto no sólo elabora una o dos pulseras, si no debe producir por grandes cantidades para abastecer los requerimientos de sus clientes, que luego venden sus obras en los mercados, bazares o tiendas. Luz está muy contenta por todos los pedidos que le realizan, pero a veces no se da abasto para producir tanto, por eso le gustaría tener a alguien que la ayude, pero sabe que eso será con el tiempo y que debe trabajar mucho para lograr tener un bazar en alguna zona muy concurrida de la ciudad donde exponer sus artículos. Luz se encuentra en su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siendo muy puntual en todos sus pagos, además el trabajo en su banco comunal es muy bueno porque todas sus compañeras son muy responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más cantidad de materiales para la elaboración de sus collares, pulseras, anillos, etc, para abastecer la cantidad de pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Luz is 39 years of age and married, but lives alone with her children: Pablo (21 years), Jorge (18 years) and Carmen (15 years old). Her husband has left to look for work in another country from where he sends her money for the household expenses. In view of the sacrifices of her husband, she decided to work on her own so as to be able to generate some extra income, devoting herself to something which could be done from her home without disrupting her family. And so she chose something that she has always enjoyed, costume jewelry, since this work allows her to exercise her imagination and create different designs for necklaces, bracelets, rings, etc., which she sells to order. This isn't just making one or two bracelets but she must also produce large quantities in order to meet the requirement of her customers who later sell her work in the markets, bazaars or stores. Luz is very satisfied with all the orders they give her but at times it can be overwhelming. And for that she would like to have someone to help her but she knows that that will happen eventually and that she needs to work hard in order to succeed in having a bazaar in a well-traveled area of the city where she can exhibit her products. Luz finds herself in her fifth loan cycle with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She's been very punctual with all of her payments, and furthermore, working with her communal bank has been great because all her partners are very responsible. The money she is requesting will be used to buy additional quantities of materials for the manufacture of her necklaces, bracelets, rings, etc., in order to fill the orders that she has in hand.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 34 años, vive con sus hijos; Jerson de 16 y David de 14,  ya que su esposo se fue a trabajar al país de Chile, desde donde le manda dinero para los gastos de su hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, incursionó en este negocio para generarse ganancias adicionales a lo que le manda su esposo. Por eso vendes esta bebida en la loza deportiva cerca su casa, donde todos los días sábados se reúne gran cantidad de gente para jugar campeonatos deportivos de fútbol. Además, también lo hace de lunes a viernes en su casa, guardando las bebidas en su refrigeradora para mantenerlas a tiempo para así venderlas a sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes, siendo esta una gran fuente de ingresos porque es la única persona que vende esta bebida por su zona. Pero no todo es bueno, ya que algunas veces tiene que lidiar con personas que no quieren pagarle, ocasionándole pérdidas en el negocio, es por eso que la experiencia le ha enseñado a asegurarse cobrando primero. Ahora su negocio obtiene menos pérdidas y mayor cantidad de ingresos, dándole a Martha las esperanzas de seguir creciendo hasta conseguir una tienda donde también venda productos comestibles. Este es si 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siempre demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad en todos sus pagos al igual que todas sus compañeras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos de la distribuidora de cerveza más cercana a su casa.
texts.en:
Martha is 34 years old and lives with her two sons, Jerson, sixteen, and David, fourteen. Her husband is working in Chile. He sends her money from Chile for her household expenses. Martha sells beer. She became involved in this business in order to earn additional money to augment what her husband sends to her. She sells her beer at the sports field near her house. Every Saturday a large group of people gather there to compete in soccer. Also, from Monday to Friday, she sells beer from her house to her neighbors who are her principal customers. She keeps the beer cold in her refrigerator. This is a great source of income because she is the only person who sells this drink in her area. Everything is not great though. Sometimes she has to deal with people who don’t want to pay her which causes her business loses. These experiences have taught her that she needs to get paid before providing her product. Now her business has less loses and more income. Martha hopes that her business will continue to grow. She would like to have a store where she can also sell other types of goods. This is Martha’s fifth loan with PRISMA microfinance. She has always responsibly and punctually paid back her loans, as have her companions. With the money she is requesting, she will buy more products from the beer distributor close to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa P. owns and operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 31 years old, married and has one small child. She is from Oroquieta City. Marissa has been in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2001, Marissa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Marissa is now requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 17th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle R. is from Oroquieta City. She is 24 years old, married and has one small child. To make a living, Michelle owns and operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in her community. Michelle has been in this business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Michelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. Michelle is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa B. is 61 years old. She is married and has one adult child. She is from Oroquieta City. Elisa owns and operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in her community. Elisa has been in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Elisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elisa is now requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia A. makes a living operating a food stall selling snacks and other delicacies in her community. She is 58 years old, married and has ten adult children. She is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Eustaquia has been in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Eustaquia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eustaquia is now requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and to expand product offerings. This will be her sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and to expand product offerings

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia A. is 37 years old. She is married and has four school-age children. Eugenia is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz city. To make a living, Eugenia raises crops--primarily planting and harvesting rice and corn to sell. Eugenia has been farming for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eugenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eugenia is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children and to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a farming business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan T. is a villager who has an occupation raising pigs. She has had a small pigpen next to her house for nine years and she can raise at least two litters a year. In addition, she sells a few cakes to her neighbors in the village for additional profit. 
She is married to Cheang Choun (he is shown in the picture), who drives a motorbike taxi. Recently, Chan T.'s husband can't generate as much revenue as before because his motor is not attractive to his clients. Therefore, Chan T. has decided to ask for a loan to replace her husband's old motor.

loans.use: To replace her husband's old motor

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila B. is from the village of Buenavista, Oroquieta City, Misamis, Occidental. She is 50 years old. Mila is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mila owns and operates a business in the retail sector operating a "sari-sari," or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Mila is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anaceta

texts.en:
Anaceta D. is from the town of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Anaceta is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Anaceta owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from engaging in the buying and selling of dried fish in their village. She peddles her product every day. During our visit to Anaceta, her dried fish was already sold out. Anaceta has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. She is hoping for more improvement to her business.

In 2008, Anaceta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anaceta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Anaceta is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anaceta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Yi L. is a 53-year-old divorced woman and is the mother of four children. Three of them are married and live independently, while the youngest one is a daughter who works selling used goods for a profit. Yi L. currently sells a few items in her own store next to her home. She sells them to villagers who live near her house. Yi L. is a fantastic mother who has tried to earn money to feed her kids from the time they were still babies until they married. Currently, because of her investment, the fact that her business is still running well, and an increasing number of customers' needs, she would like a loan of $1000 to order buy more grocery inventory to sell. Yi L. was not available at that time for photographing, so her daughter is shown in the photo instead.

loans.use: To order buy more grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda H. is from the village of Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Erlinda is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a "sari-sari" or general store selling both food and daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand the product offering in her store. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita J. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Florita is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Florita owns & operates a "sari-sari" or general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Florita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Florita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell to expand the product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Florita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo C. is from the town of Agusan, Camp Phillips Bukidnon. He is 28 years old. Romeo is single. To make a living, Romeo owns & operates a business providing motorcycle service in their village, locally known as habal habal. He drives his motorcycle every day to generate more income. Romeo has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Romeo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Romeo is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to make the full payment of the motorcycle used for his business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Romeo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family and for daily allowance of his siblings in school. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
