loans.name: Roem

texts.en: V. is a Cambodian farmer who has been working in this sector in the village of Ptas Rong for more than nine years. Her husband helps her in the farming activities. She is aged 28 years and has given birth to three children who are of school-age and under her care. V. will use this loan to add to her savings and buy a plot of neighbor’s farmland located near her house. she will use this land to grow a various kinds of vegetables for sale. V.'s husband is shown in the picture on their farmland.

loans.use: To buy a plot of neighbor’s farmland.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita Q. is from the village of Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Marianita is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Marianita owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells snacks and other food products within Sto. Nino School, in Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. Marianita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marianita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Marianita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the  business (habal-habal). She does have a motorcycle, locally known as habal – habal, for transport within their place. Marianita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marianita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita C. is from the village of Buenavista, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old and single. To make a living, Tita owns and operates a business in the retail sector operating a "sari-sari" store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Tita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Tita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Tita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.name: Neak

texts.en: S. N., 23, is a local grocery seller. She sells items such as cooking ingredients to her clients, most of whom are her neighbors. She also sells sweets to kids. She is married with two minor children who are enrolled in primary school. She applies a loan for capital to accrue her grocery inventory to sell. This will help her to grow her investment and provide more additional income. S. N. was not available for photo, so her mother is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: To accrue grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy M. is from the village of Gusa , Cagayan de Oro City. She is a 31-year-old married mother of two school-aged children. To make a living, Nancy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of used clothing locally known as ukay-ukay. She delivers her ukay -ukay in nearby villages during market days. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns ~3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional items of clothing for the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education and put up a stall for her business in the village.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Emily is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education and provide for the needs of the family.

In 2007, Jimmy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Jimmy is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to buy materials to repair fishing nets. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jimmy from GDMPC. He plans to use additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
The smiling-faced person shown in the picture is Seang M., age 40, who lives in the Pursat Province of Cambodia. He works for a salary, driving a truck that belongs to a villager, which he uses it to transport merchandise. In addition, he also takes time to work as a motor-taxi driver for a profit. He is married with five children; all five of whom are single and in school,.

His wife earns a living selling fish by mobile transportation. Seang M. saw that his wife works hard in transportation at her business activities. Seang Ma has decided to ask for a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle for his wife to transport her fish to sell more quickly.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his wife's business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda F. is 59 years old, separated from her spouse and has four adult children. She is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. To make a living, Erlinda owns a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in her community. Erlinda has been in this business for over six years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en: The person who is standing on the farmland is Mrs. Koeun R., age 35, who is a married woman and the mother of three childR. who are of school-age. She currently cultivates a rice crop on her own farmland that was inherited from her grandparents. Her husband works with her in the farm field. Koeun R. planted her rice crop three months ago but her crop is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Therefore, she requested a loan of $200 to purchase more fertilizer to fatten her crop yields.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer to fatten her crop yields

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en:
Tsolmon D. is 49 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. Her family lives in the Ger district in the central province. Her children are between the ages of 15 and 28. Two of her children have graduated from university, and another two children are in university. Her children work for the business, but her husband does not work for the business. He has been working for a government organization for the last 20 years, focusing on agriculture.

Since 2001, she has been running a retail business that processes sheep wool and makes handicrafts such as shoes, souvenirs and necklaces. Together with World Vision, she leads training on processing wool to train other business men and women.

Tsolmon has a stall in the local market. During the evening, she makes souvenirs or teaches her children to make the products. With the profits from her business, she paid for four of her children's university tuition. She says that she has been running this business for a long time, and it is very profitable. She wanted to increase her working capital to pay for all of her children's tuition fees, feed her family and expand her business. With this loan, she will buy sheep wool, pearls and wire to make necklaces. She also wants a wool processing machine and wool brush.

loans.use: To buy a wool processing machine, wool brush, sheep wool and materials to make necklaces

loans.name: Sobirchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Собирчон -мужчина в возрасте 37 лет, женат имеет троих детей .Работает убойщик скота.Он занимается откормом и продажей говяжьего мяса на рынке города Худжанда.У него очень много постоянных клиентов которые у него покупают.Он хочет получить кредит для закупа молодого скота, который откормив хочет зарезать и продать мясо в розницу.Он благодарен KIVA за сотрудничество и финансирование.
texts.en:
Sobirchon is a 37-year-old man who is married and has three children. He works as a beef butcher. He is involved with the care and sale of beef at the market in the city of Khujand. He has very many repeat clients who buy from him. He wants to receive a loan in order to buy young cattle, which when raised he wants to slaughter and to sell the meat at retail. He is thankful to Kiva for the collaboration and financing. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: care and sale of cattle

loans.name: Kikelomo

texts.en: Kikelomo sells drinks in retail and in bulk. She purchases directly from the company. The larger the quantity, the more discount one gets. Kikelomo needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more crates of drinks for sale. Kikelomo is 41 years old, married to K. and they have three children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more juice & drinks

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is 42 years old, married and has two children. She sells provisions and frozen food items. She has been in business for the past eight years and needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more cartons of frozen food items in order to meet customers' demands. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions in cartons to sell

loans.name: Buvojon

texts.ru: Буводжон Рахимов 1985 года рождения , женат имеет 1 ребенка. Высшего образования не имеет.  В Чкаловске торгует на рынке овощами : капустой , морковью , чесноком и различными овощами. Иногда мать заменяет его на прилавке, когда он занят другими делами.  Первый кредит получил в 2008 году на расширение своей точки. На прилавок ему поставляли тоннами лук. После получения кредита разнообразил свой товар.
texts.en:
Buvojon R. was born in 1985, is married and has one infant. He does not have higher education. In Chkalovske, he trades at the vegetable market: cabbages, carrots, garlic and various vegetables. Sometimes, his mother takes his place at the counter, when he is engaged with other tasks. He received his first loan in 2008 for the expansion of his retail spot. A ton onions was delivered to his booth. After receiving the loan, he diversified his goods.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of food products

loans.name: Temitope

texts.en: Temitope sells phone recharge cards in large quantities as she has a printing machine, and also runs a viewing center. She has been in these businesses for over three years now and needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more phone recharge cards and DVD tapes, and to improve the video club viewing center. Temitope is 35 years old, married to I. (a fashion designer) and they have three children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more phone recharge cards and DVD tapes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 23-year-old single man. In 2006, he decided to open a new business; that is when he came up with the idea of a barbershop, which he then called "Ali's Salon". Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new chairs for his salon to be able to attract a wider range of clientele and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy new chairs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 44 years old, married and has four children. She sells provisions and drinks and has been in business since the year 2000. She needs a loan of N140,000 to increase her inventory and promises to repay her loan when due. Maria said her business assists her husband in providing for the needs of the family.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
The two people shown in the picture are Mrs. Vun P., 59, and her husband, 54, and they both are people living in Pursat Province. This couple makes a living planting crops and are the parents of eight children. Three of their children are married and have ready started new family homes, whilst the remainder of them are students and also work on the farm when they are free from learning. Beside the farm work, the family always buys a few cows to raise for sale for additional income.

Vun P. is applying for a loan to buy a cow to alleviate her hard physical labor in the farm work during this coming crop-growing season. She will also raise it for their offspring for sale in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow to alleviate her hard physical labor

loans.name: Dilshodchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Дилшодчон Зикруллоева услышав от односельчан о нашей организации, обратилась к нам за помощью. После одобрения всей ее документации она получила кредит и потратила его на  изготовление и продажу лепешек.  Получив хорошие доходы, она подала повторную заявку на получения кредита, но уже для закупа  2 ягнят .
Дилшодчон параллельно с бизнесом по изготовлению лепешек  занимается животноводством. Откармливает скот и продает его на рынке. Стаж работы в сфере животноводческой деятельности у нее 15 лет. В этом бизнесе ей помогает муж Бахрулло. У Дилшодчон и Бахрулло 2 детей.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

When Dilshodchon Zikrulloeva heard of our organization from her fellow villagers she has come to ask for help. After the approval of all her documents she received a loan and spent it on production of flat breads. After making good profit she has applied for another loan but this time for purchase of two young sheep. Dilshodchon is running an animal husbandry business parallel to the flat bread production. She feeds the cattle and sells it on the market. She has fifteen years of experience in the animal husbandry field. Her husband Bahrullo helps her with this business. Dilshodchon and Bahrullo have two children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sheep

loans.name: Adepeju

texts.en: Adepeju makes native beads worn on the hands, neck and ears. She supplies them to customers by retail. She also has a shop where she sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for over three years and needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Olubummi

texts.en:
Olubummi sells wood for furniture and house building etc. She started this trade two years ago but before that, she sold wrappers. She changed business because wood selling is more profitable. Olubummi needs a loan of N100,000 to increase her inventory.

Olubummi is 45 years old, married and has a child. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to sell

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Гулмира Назарова проживает в городе Истаравшане. Детей у нее нет, после развода с мужем, она переехала жить к своему отцу. Гулмира торгует на рынке зеленью: укроп, петрушка, зеленый лук. Каждое утро она покупает, свежую зелень, которую привозят ей из города Худжанда.  Ежедневная чистая прибыль от продажи зелени составляет 20-30 сомони. Гулмира хочет разнообразить свой товар. Дополнительно к зелени она хочет продавать чеснок, капусту острый и болгарский перец.
Для этого она запрашивает сумму в размере 300 сомони.
texts.en:
Gulmira N. lives in the city of Istaravshan. She has no children, and after her divorce from her husband, she moved to live with her father. Gulmira sells herbs, such as dill, parsley and green onions, at a market. Every morning, she buys fresh herbs that are delivered to her from the city of Khujand. Her daily profit from the sales of herbs is 20-30 somoni. Gulmira wants to vary her products and additionally sell garlic, cabbage and spicy and bell peppers. She is requesting a loan in the sum of 300 somoni for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand product variety

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou T. est une femme de 29 ans, mariée et mère d’un garçon. Elle est revendeuse de friperies à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. ce commerce est très prospère à cause de la forte demande. Avec ce crédit Akou désire accroître la taille de son commerce.
texts.en:
Akou T., 29, is married and the mother of one son. She sells used clothing in Lomé, the Togolese capital. This business is very prosperous because of the high demand. With this loan, Akou wishes to grow the size of her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: growing the size of her business

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en: Olabisi is 45 years old, married and has five children. She sells provisions and has been in business for over ten years. Olabisi needs a loan of N70,000 to increase her inventory in order to meet customers' demands. She says thank you and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Bibiri

texts.en: Bibiri is 55 years old, married and has nine children. She is the leader of her group and has been borrowing from LAPO for over two years without default in payment. She needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more clothing materials in bundles. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine makes bedspreads and duvets, and supplies to big organizations like schools and hotels etc. She started this trade four years ago and with a constant increase in demand for goods, she needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more materials for making bedspreads and duvets to sell. Josephine is 37 years old, married and has a child. She has been borrowing from LAPO for over two years. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make bedspreads and duvets to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi T. est une femme de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 3 ans. Elle est revendeuse de charbons à Lomé. Le charbon étant la principale source d’énergie dans les foyers au Togo, la demande est très forte. Afi désire avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son activité en achetant des sacs de  charbons pour la revente.
texts.en:
Afi T., 48, is married and the mother of 3 children. She sells charcoal in Lomé. Charcoal is the principal source of energy in Togolese households, so the demand is high. Afi wishes to use this loan to grow the size of her business by buying sacks of charcoal for resale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing sacks of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Mukum

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Мукум  Муллоев имеет 30 летний стаж работы в сфере животноводческой деятельности и переработки молока. В этом бизнесе ему помогают жена и дети Мукума. Дополнительно доход в его семью приносит работа Мукума садовником и продажа молока соседям.
Мукум запрашивает кредит в размере 1600 сомни для откорма скота.
texts.en:
Mukum M. has 30 years of experience in the animal husbandry field and milk processing. His wife and children help him with the business. Mukum’s work as a gardener and sales of milk to his neighbors bring in additional income to his family. Mukum is requesting a loan in the sum of 1600 somoni for livestock feeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Atinuke

texts.en: Atinuke is a member of LAPO and she sells drinks and foodstuffs. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell; she said this will increase her profit and help her serve her customers better. Atinuke is 45 years old, widowed and has three children. With her business, she provides for the needs of her children as she has no support from anyone. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mumindjon

texts.ru: Муминджон Турсунов  1957 года рождения, женат имеет 5 детей.  Имеет среднее образование. Он торгует в Чкаловском магазине запасными частями. Три года назад он торговал там же, но арбузами и лепешками. И первый кредит получил на приобретение арбузов и дынь. Теперь у него 2 торговые точки. И он успевает везде. В одной из точек  он посадил продавца торговать товаром, на  другой сидит он сам и торгует. Благодаря кредит от КИВА он прикупит  дополнительные запасные части и различные товары необходимые дляторговли.
texts.en:
Mumindjon T. was born in 1957, he is married and has five children. He has secondary education. He sells spare parts in the store in Chkalovsk. Three years ago he was selling watermelons and flat breads there. His first loan was for buying watermelons and melons. Right now he has two vendor locations and he has time to be everywhere. Mumindjon has hired a sales person to be at one of the locations and stays himself and sells at the second one. Thanks to the loan from Kiva he can buy additional spare parts and other items for sale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle, sheep, and pigs

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin is 39 years old, married and has three children. She sells phone rechargeable cards. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more rechargeable cards to sell. Oluwatoyin has been in business for over four years and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cards in bulk

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Фуркат  Аюбов электрик. Он ремонтирует легковые автомобили. Кроме этого дома у него есть несколько голов крупнорогатого скота, он имеет 10 летний опыт работы в животноводстве. Фуркат подал заявку на получение кредита, и планирует использовать его для откорма скота. 
Фуркат женат,  у него 2 детей. Место их жительства Ганчинский район.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Furkat A. is an electrician. He repairs small vehicles. Besides that he has several heads of large cattle at home. He has ten years of experience working in animal husbandry. Furkat has applied for a loan and plans to use it for feeding of his livestock. Furkat is married and he has two children. They live in the Gonjy region.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding of livestock

loans.name: Đinh's Group

texts.en:
G. Đinh Thị (20206050001) is a 45 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. G. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Vĩ 01 (1).

G. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, G. operates a family member's business bamboo products manufacturing business. G. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month from these activities.

G. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. G. is requesting a loan for the first time from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. G. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Phùng Thị H. (20206050002) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 3,360,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2.  Đỗ Thị L. (20206050003) is a 42 year-old female requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business operating a fishing business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị K. (20206050004) is a 36 year-old female requesting a 2,016,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4.  Trần Thị H. (20206050005) is a 27 year-old female requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.



*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


G. Đinh Thị (20206050001) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  G. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Yên Vĩ 01 (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  G. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, G. kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND.  G. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  G. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Phùng Thị H. (20206050002) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Đỗ Thị L. (20206050003) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  Nguyễn Thị K. (20206050004) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Trần Thị H. (20206050005) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy insecticide to protect her crop and fertilizer to improve yield

loans.name: Adewusi

texts.en:
B. is 37 years old and married with two children. She sells materials for making beads and also makes and sells them herself. She has been in business for two years now. Her weekend is spent training people on how to make beads.

B. needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase bead-making materials for sale. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more bead-making materials to sell

loans.name: Valeriy

texts.en: Valeriy is married with two children. He sells home equipment, like TVs, music recorders, Playstations, etc. He has been in this business for 3 years. Valeriy has been selling his equipment just from his little truck. Recently, he rented a store and has been fixing it. He needs this loan to do the finishing work at the store and open it. The store will help him to take better care of his inventories and attract more customers. Valeriy has almost no competition in his small city and wants to develop his business further.

loans.use: To open a store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells children's toys and clothing materials. She goes to market once a week to get inventory. Esther started this business over six years ago and needs a loan of N70,000 to buy bundles of clothing materials to sell.

Esther is 36 years old, married and has two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 




Фарход- мужчина в возрасте 28 лет пока не женат .Он работает начальником в аэродробной службе, помимо этого он вместе с отцом занимается откормом и продажей скота.Сейчас у него три большие коровы, которые дают молоко.Узнав , что в кредит возможно увеличить оборотный капитал , решил обратится в "Арванд".
texts.en:
Farhod is a 28-year-old, single man. He works as an airport service supervisor. His father and he are also involved in livestock feeding and sales. Farhod currently has three large cows that produce milk. Having found out that it is possible to increase working capital with credit, Farhod decided to reach out to Arvand.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and sales

loans.name: Jennie Lynn

texts.en: Jennie is the proud owner of an automotive paint shop in her village for the past 14 years. She is married and has four children from pre-school age to high school age, and her greatest aspiration is to be able to afford to send all of her children to college. She started her business with capital from her husband who had saved money from his income in another paint shop for them to start their own. With her Kiva loan, Jennie will be buying paint and other supplies needed for the shop. She also has additional income from a plot of land she farms on and part of her loan will be used to buy fertilizer and to rent a tractor for the fields. She hopes that with this extra money, she will be able to attract more customers and be able to save money to put away to help with her children's education.

loans.use: Automotive paint shop, buying supplies and farm inputs

loans.name: Sy

texts.en:
Sy K. was born in 1964 and is a mother blessed with three kids. She is a local crop cultivator, growing crops such as morning glories, cucumbers and cabbages. She takes 2 or 3 months' time to cultivate her crop and then sells them to the market sellers. Another source of profit comes from her husband who works caring for a neighbor's livestock.

Sy K. is growing her crop well, but unfortunately, the insects ravage her crops. Because of that problem, she would like a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL. She will use half of the loan to buy insecticide to protect her crop and the rest to buy more fertilizers to fatten her crop yields.

loans.use: To buy insecticide to protect her crop

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn V. (20206050011) is a 28 year-old male living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 5-member group L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Vĩ 03 (3).

T. is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, T. owns & operates a business raising chickens for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to engage in business activities. T. is requesting a L. of 5,152,000 VND to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st L. taken out by T. from SEDA. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20206050012) is a 28 year-old female requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her furniture making business.

2.  Đàm Thị T. (20206050013) is a 24 year-old female requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her furniture making business.

3.  Trần Thị L. (20206050014), a 34 year-old female, is requesting a 3,360,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.

4.  Đàm Thị N. (20206050016), a 46 year-old female, is requesting a 4,256,000 VND L. to support her furniture making business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn V. (20206050011) là 28 tuổi nam.  Anh ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Yên Vĩ 03 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20206050012) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Đàm Thị T. (20206050013) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Trần Thị L. (20206050014) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Đàm Thị N. (20206050016) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies	.

loans.name: Tupendane  B Group

texts.en:
Aziza L., age 38, is married. Her two children are aged 17 and 20 years. She has a salon business, which she started 4 years ago. She works daily from 8am until 8pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $154. 

This will be Aziza’s seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open the salon business. She used to sell clothes and has repaid the loans successfully. She hopes for a seventh loan to help to expand both businesses. 
	
Aziza will share this loan with her loan group, Tupendane B, which totals  16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Aziza is in the middle, front row, in a black sleeveless blouse.

loans.use: To buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Liên Lê Thị (1207021008) is a 38-year-old femaL. living in the town of Ninh Giang. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Liên owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a restaurant. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Liên has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Liên joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Liên is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Liên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married. She sells glasses at Angolenko market, Zaporozhye city. She has been in this business for ten years and her monthly profit is 3,000 UAH. Her kiosk is located in a good place at the market. She has many repeat clients because of great variety, excellent customer service and a flexible pricing policy.

Galina would like to obtain this loan to purchase new sunglasses for the summer season. She hopes to make additional profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new sunglasses for the summer season

loans.name: Aergash

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Эргаш  Окулов проживает вместе со своей семьей в Ганчинском районе. У Эргаша 5 детей.  20 лет Эргаш занимается откормом скота и переработкой молока.
Эргашу в животноводстве помогают жена Рузигул и сыновья. Дополнительно наш клиент работает мастером по ремонту жилых домов.
Эргаш запрашивает кредит для откорма скота.
texts.en:
Aergash O. lives with his family in the Gonjy district. He has 5 children. Aergash has been involved in livestock feeding and milk processing for 20 years. His wife, Ruzigul, and sons help him with the animal husbandry business. Additionally, our client works as a home repairman. Aergash is requesting this loan for livestock feeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is going to buy supplies for her store including school supplies like notebooks, pencils and crayons as well as umbrellas, t-shirts and pants to sell. She also earns money by fattening hogs and selling them at a livestock market. She is going to buy extra hogs to have on her property as well as feed for them. 
Marivic is 27 years old and happily married to her husband, Vilmor, who is a year older than her. She has two small children and with her loan and profits she hopes to be able to afford to send her children to school and also afford college classes for herself. She has had a previous loan with ASHI and was on time making all of her repayments and so was able to increase the amount of this loan. She is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for helping fund her store.

loans.use: To restock a general store and for raising hogs

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Парвина - женщина в возрасте 26 лет, замужем имеет одного ребёнка.Она нигде временно не работает ,т.к. у неё маленький ребёнок. Но без дела   она не сидит  помогает мужу по уходу за скотом.Её муж работает частныи таксистом и на плохо зарабатывает. Но из-за того что Парвина в мужем хочет отремонтировать дом она вместе с мужем занимается уходом за скотом и продав скот с дохода хочет осуществить свои планы.На снимке Парвина в день выдачи получает деньги.
texts.en:
Parvina is a 26-year-old woman, who is married and has one child. She is temporarily unemployed because she has a small child. However, she does not sit idly by. She helps her husband take care of livestock. Her husband works as a taxi driver and makes a good living. But because Parvina and her husband want to repair their house, they are involved in livestock care. Once they sell the livestock, they want to use the profit to accomplish their goals. The photograph shows Parvina receiving money on the disbursement day.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and sales

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann S., 43, lives in Battambang Province, where she makes a living selling different kinds of fruit. She usually uses her old bicycle to transport her produce to sell door-to-door in her community, and earns an average of $3 profit a day to manage her family's daily expenses. She has given birth to five children, three of whom are employed as seamstresses, while the others are of school-age.

Ann S.’s husband is a musician, playing for wedding parties. Ann S. would like to take out a loan of $300 as capital to grow her business and to buy an extra musical instrument for her husband.

loans.use: To grow her business and to buy a musical instrument for her husband's business

loans.name: Euceria

texts.en: Euceria is 51 years old and is married with seven children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions in wholesale and retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Assogba

texts.fr:
T. Assogba est né vers 1975 à Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé.  Assogba est marié et est père de deux (02) enfants tous scolarisés. Assogba a comme activité principale la coiffure.  Afin de se faire plus de revenus Assogba a comme activité secondaire l'élevage. 

Pour acheter le matériel nécessaire dans son salon de coiffure Assogba a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’il n’en possède. C’est la raison pour laquelle Assogba se tourne vers ALIDé pour avoir de prêt afin d’équiper son salon de coiffure en vue d'une meilleure prestation pour sa clientèle.
texts.en:
T. Assogba was born around 1975 in Missérété in Ouémé County. Assogba is married and the father of two children who are both in school. He has a barbershop as his main business. To bring in more revenues, he has a second business, raising livestock. To buy the equipment and supplies necessary for his shop, Assogba has need of more funding than he possesses. This is why he is inquiring with Alidé for obtaining a loan for a better range of services for his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for cutting hair

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chit

texts.en:
Chit C., 28, has had a job for years selling various kinds of fruit by mobile transportation. She typically generates an income of $40 each day to meet her family's daily food needs. She is married but has no children. Her husband works at fishing in the Public Pond of their community for income.

The family is always paying much money taking taxis because they do not own a vehicle. Therefore, Chit C. has decided to seek an $800 loan in order to purchase a new motorcycle for her family’s riding needs, as well as for her to use to pick up her vegetables to sell more quickly.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle  for her business and for her family’s riding needs

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en: Lubov is a widow with two grown-up sons. She rents a big kiosk and sells all kinds of clothing. She has been in this business for 12 years. She started this business when she lost her job. During this time, she invested all the additional income from her garden in this business. It has become the main source of her income. Lubov would like to receive a loan to purchase more inventory for the summer season. She will use the additional income to help her younger son pay for his university tuition.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Nestor

texts.fr:
H. Nestor est né vers 1966 à Sado dans la Commune d’Avrankou. Nestor est marié et est père de cinq (05) enfants dont deux (02) seulement sont scolarisés. Nestor réside avec sa famille à Yèvié Wadon dans la Commune d'Adjarra.  Nestor est un photographe  et en a fait son activité principale. La photographie procure à Nestor des revenus qui l’aide à gagner sa vie. 

Toutefois, Nestor a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’il n’en a actuellement pour équiper son laboratoire de photographie en vue d’offrir de meilleures prestations à sa clientèle et de faire plus de revenus pouvant lui permettre d’envoyer tous ses enfants à l’école et de satisfaire mieux les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
H. Nestor was born around 1966 in Sado in the community of Avrankou. He is married and the father of five children, of whom only two are in school. He resides with his family in Yèvié Wadon in the community of Adjarra. Nestor is a photographer and has made it his primary business. Photography brings in the revenues that helps him earn his living. However, Nestor has need of more funding than he currently has for equipping his photo lab. The aim is to offer a better range of services to his customers and to make more income, thus allowing him to send all his children to school and to provide for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment for photography

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marianel

texts.en: Marianel B. is from the village of Sto. Ñino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Marianel owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling both food and daily-use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Marianel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marianel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell so as to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell to expand her product offering

location.town: Sto. ñino, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Đinh's Group

texts.en:
Bé Đinh Thị (20206050006) is a 54 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Bé is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Vĩ 02 (2).

Bé is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Bé owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Bé has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

Bé joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Bé is requesting a loan for the first time from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND to purchase additional products to sell. Bé plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Vũ Thị H. (20206050007) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Trần Thị H. (20206050008) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector providing waste management services.

3.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20206050009) is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

4.  Trần Thị H. (20206050010) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business in raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.
