loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
K. Jackline is the leader of the Mugyera AIDS Care Group in Bushenyi. Jackline is 36 years old, and married with five children aged between 8 and 18 years old. Together with her husband, she works to clear their school dues. She also helps to care for her aunt.

Jackline has had a business selling second-hand clothes for eight years. Her main challenge is transporting her goods between various markets, which sometimes becomes too costly. Her main markets of business are Katerera, Kyendangara and Mugyera town markets, and these give her a monthly profit of 250,000 UGX. Jackline is successful because she deals in a variety of clothes, including womenswear, menswear and childrenswear. Her dream is to have a clothes store in Katerera town so that she can cease transporting her stock to markets. She also dreams of seeing all her children attain the best education and get good jobs.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jasila

texts.en:
Jasila gets to work with her father every day on their farm. She had a previous loan with ASHI and because she was on-time with all of her payments, she was able to double the amount of this loan.

She and her father have a rice field and also grow vegetables. She is going to use the loan to buy fertilizer for the field and rice to plant. She is looking to increase the standard of living for her and her family by growing her business and increasing profits. She is excited to be a member of Kiva and says thank you for supporting her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the field and rice to plant

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: N. Daniel est né le 22 Octobre 1973. Daniel est marié et est père de quatre (04) enfants dont un (01) seul est scolarisé. Daniel réside avec sa famille à Amouloko dans la Commune de Akpro Missérété. Daniel est couturier et les moyens financiers dont il dispose actuellement ne lui permettent pas de bien développer son activité de couture et de satisfaire bien la demande de ses clients dont le nombre ne cesse de s'accroître. C’est la raison pour laquelle Daniel s’est dirigé vers ALIDé pour avoir un crédit.
texts.en:
N. Daniel was born on October 22, 1973. He is married and the father of four children, of whom just one is in school. Daniel resides with his family in Amouloko in the community of Akpro Missérété. He is a tailor, and the financial means he has at his disposal do not currently allow him to develop his tailoring business and to satisfy his customers, who are every-growing in number. This is the reason why he inquired with ALIDÉ for obtaining a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
K. Annet is a 40 year old, humble and hardworking widow with five children, ages 19 – 12 years and all in school. She also cares for two orphans. She is a business lady selling beans and bananas to her customers in Katerera town.

She has been in business for 9 years. Her main business challenge is getting enough produce to sell once the season ends. However, she is able to make 100,000 per month as profit hence she is able to support her children as a widow. Customers are attracted to her stall because her food is good and the beans only take a short time to cook. She has the goal of buying a motorcycle that will help her transport her produce to the main market in order to make more profits.

She works hard to ensure that her children acquire academic diplomas and certificates. Annet needs a loan to help with buying more sacs of beans and to cover transport costs to deliver her produce to her stall.

loans.use: To buy more sacs of beans and to cover transportation costs

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila N. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 59 years old, widowed, and has four adult children. Lucila owns and operates a business running a food stall, primarily selling food snacks near the school. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lucila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Lucila is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: A. David

texts.fr:
K. A. David est né vers 1984 à Avrankou dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Mais David réside avec sa famille dans à Amouloko dans la Commune d'Akpro-Missérété. David est en effet père de deux (02) enfants tous scolarisés. 

David a comme activité principale la couture. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenus David fait en plus de l'élevage. Pour mieux servir sa clientèle, David a besoin de plus de matériels de couture. C’est pourquoi David sollicite un crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. A. David was born around 1984 in Avrankou in Ouémé County. But he resides with his family in Amouloko, in the community of Akpro-Missérété. He is actually a father of two children who are both in school. David is principally a tailor. To diversify his revenue sources, he also raises livestock. To serve his customers better, he has need of more sewing supplies and equipment. This is why he's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an overcasting machine and some sewing supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 54 years old and proudly married to Fred. She has three grown children and many grandchildren. Her greatest hope is to be able to help pay for her grandchildren's education.

This is her second loan from ASHI and, because she paid her first one on-time, she is able to double the amount of this second loan. With the money she is going to buy rice and feed. She is then going to harvest the rice and sell it in the market. She is a happy woman looking to improve her way of living and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy rice and feed

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
"M. Trương Thị (20201010001) is a 26 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. M. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ngân Cầu 01 (1).

M. is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, M. owns and operates a business providing cargo transport services to local community members. M. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. M. is requesting her first loan from SEDA, for 5.152.000 VND, which she will use to purchase equipment to improve her business. M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Nguyễn Thị V. (20201010002), a 28 year-old female, is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

2. Đào Thị V. A. (20201010003), a 36 year-old female, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

3. Nguyễn Thị H. (20201010004), a 55 year-old female, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010005), a 48 year-old female, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her food stall.

5. Nguyễn Thị CA. (20201010006), a 48 year-old female, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

M. Trương Thị (20201010001) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. M. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngân Cầu 01 (1).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doA. chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ vận chuyển hàng hóa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. M. thực hiện công việc kinh doA. này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND. M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doA. của cô ấy/ A. ấy. M. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị V. (20201010002) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là vận hành công việc kinh doA. trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 2. Đào Thị V. A. (20201010003) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là kinh doA. cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 3. Nguyễn Thị H. (20201010004) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010005) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 5. Nguyễn Thị CA. (20201010006) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DoA. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các dA. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Шухрат - молодой человек, женат имеет двоих детей, жена домохозяйка.Проживает в посёлке Исписар г.Гафурова.Он работает мастером по покраске и евроремонту квартир.В день его отутствия за скотом ухаживает его жена.На снимке Шухрат в день выдачи
texts.en:
Shuhrat is a young married man with two children. His wife is a homemaker. He lives in the Ispisar settlement in the city of Gafurova. He works as a master painter and does European-style remodeling for apartments. In his absence during the daytime, his wife looks after the cattle. In the picture, Shuhrat is shown at the bank on payday. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: care and sale of cattle

loans.name: Max's Group

texts.en:
M. Max is a kind and friendly 40-year-old lady who is married with six children aged 22 – 11 years. She also helps to care for two orphaned relatives and two abandoned children. Of her children, one is at the university while the rest are in secondary schools. She works so hard to ensure that all her children reach university level and get good jobs to support themselves.

For ten years, Max has had a business dealing in agricultural products, buying and selling coffee and cotton from Mirarikye. The coffee and cotton are sold to the coffee factories and ginneries respectively, hence enabling her to make monthly profits of UGX 300,000. Her main challenge is that during the rainy season, the roads become impassable, hence increasing the cost of transportation of the produce.

Max employs coffee and cotton collectors and provides them with bicycles, hence enabling them to make enough purchases. She has a dream of owning a pick-up truck that will help to collect the produce from the furthest of villages and transport it to the factories on time. Her loan will be used to buy coffee for resale and to buy a bicycle to help in the business. In most cases, her loan money helps to replace business capital that is taken out for school fees.

loans.use: To buy coffee for resale and to buy a bicycle to help in the business

loans.name: Zounmenou

texts.fr:
B. Zounmenou  est né vers 1976 à Katagon dans Commune de Akpro Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Zounmenou vit dans cette Commune de Akpro Missérété depuis son enfance. Et c’est là que Zounmenou  mène son activité de coiffure. Zounmenou est père de deux (02) enfants tous scolarisés. 

Zounmenou veut offrir de meilleures prestations à sa clientèle. Mais, ses moyens financiers ne lui permettent pas d’équiper son salon de coiffure en matériels nécessaires. Alors pour y arriver, Zounmenou  s’adresse à ALIDé. En effet, Zounmenou  sollicite un crédit de ALIDé pour améliorer ses prestations de services et  pour accroître ses revenus dans le but de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
B. Zounmenou was born around 1976 in Katagon in the community of Akpro Missérété, in Ouémé County. He has been living in Akpro Missérété since his childhood, there where he has a barbershop as his business. He is a father of two children who are both in school. Zounmenou wants to offer a better range of services to his customers. But his financial means don't allow him to equip his shop with what is necessary. To do so, he is inquiring with ALIDÉ. Essentially he's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ to improve his range of services and to grow his revenues with the goal of providing for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large mirrors and and an electric clipper

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Thor

texts.en: Thor K. is 37 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She earns a living by raising pigs. She raises two lots of pigs per year and sells them to the slaughterer every six months. She has been earning an income of approximately $3 a day since 1994. She is married with five children who are teenagers and still under her care. Her husband is a local chef for wedding parties. The family has also cultivated rice. To earn more revenue, Thor K. is applying for a loan to buy sows to raise to sell their babies.

loans.use: To buy sows to raise to sell their babies

loans.name: Justin's Group

texts.en: B. Justin is a kind, hard-working and gentle lady with a medical clinic in Kirugu town, her business for 11 years. She is 42 years of age and a widow with 5 children aged 24 - 14 years; she also cares for one orphan. One of her children is at the university while the rest are in secondary schools. Justin’s cases range from minor bruises to women with maternity problems and she is able to make monthly profits of 270,000 UGX.  She has experience in treating various illnesses so she has many patients. She hopes one day to own her clinic building so she can admit more patients and to ensure that in the future, all her children can begin families of their own. Justin needs a loan to buy medical drugs for the clinic. With a loan, she can buy in large quantities and thus save on transport costs by making fewer purchasing trips.

loans.use: Buying medical drugs for her clinic.

loans.name: Barnabé

texts.fr:
H. Barnabé est né le 08 Octobre 1981 à Adjohoun dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Barnabé vit avec sa famille à Katagon dans la Commune d'Akpro-Missérété toujours dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Barnabé est père de trois (03) enfants dont un (01) seulement est scolarisé. 

Barnabé est couturier de formation et de profession. Pour renforcer sa capacité de service afin mieux satisfaire ses clients, Barnabé a besoin d’équiper son atelier de couture. Barnabé sollicite alors un crédit de ALIDé pour y arriver. Ainsi Barnabé peut faire plus de revenus pouvant lui permettre de mieux supporter ses charges familiales.
texts.en:
H. Barnabé was born on October 8, 1981 in Adjohoun in Ouémé County. He lives with this family in Katagon in the community of Akpro-Missérété, also in Ouémé County. He is the father of three children, just one of whom is in school. Barnabé is a tailor by training and by profession. To bolster his service capacity in order to satisfy his customers, he needs to equip his shop. He's therefore requesting a loan from ALIDÉ to do so. He can then have more income, enabling him to support his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and an overcasting machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Inoyatkhon

texts.en: Inoyatkhon is a sharp, energetic entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She started her own clothing business sixteen years ago and has been building a successful enterprise. She has a good location in the market for her sales and creates an attractive display of clothing for passing customers. She is a married woman with two children. The income she is able to make is a help to her to support her children with a proper education. Inoyatkhon has requested a loan of 12,000 Somoni so that she can purchase an inventory of new clothing. This loan will allow her to increase her income by having the right clothing available to meet seasonal demand. Over the last four years, She has proven to be a great loan client with IMON International. We are glad to have this new opportunity to continue assisting her with her business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Dương's Group

texts.en:
"Hà Dương T. (20201010007) is a 29 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Hà is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 1 (Ngân Cầu 01).

Hà is single and does not have any children. To make a living, Hà owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from selling herbs and spices in the local community. Hà has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1.800.000 VND a month from these activities.

Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5.152.000 VND to purchase additional products to sell. This is her first loan from SEDA. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Trương Thị L. (20201010008), a 22 year-old female, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her restaurant.

2. Nguyễn Thị H. (20201010009), a 31 year-old female, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her clothing business.

3. Nguyễn Thị M. (20201010010), a 32 year-old female, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010011), a 35 year-old female, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her food stall.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hà Dương T. (20201010007) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Hà là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các tH.nh viên. Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 1 (Ngân Cầu 01). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hà thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hà kiếm được khoảng 1.800.000 VND. Hà đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hà đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Trương Thị L. (20201010008) là 22 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh nhà H.ng. 2. Nguyễn Thị H. (20201010009) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 3. Nguyễn Thị M. (20201010010) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20201010011) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
Sitting in the pigpen in this picture is Mrs Duch T.. She is 58 years old, and lives in Pursat Province. She has five children, three of whom are married and live separately. Duch T. is a widow as her husband died of senility years ago.

Duch T. earns a living raising pigs in a stall behind her house. She sells the pigs for slaughter six months after she begins raising them, so she can raise pigs twice a year. She has been running this business since 1979 and is currently earning $4 USD a day. Duch T. will be using her loan to buy more piglets to raise, and to buy fertilizer to grow a few crops.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise, and fertilizer to grow crops

loans.name: Blanche Cécile

texts.fr:
Z. Blanche Cécile est née vers 1984 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Blanche Cécile est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants dont deux (02) sont scolarisés. Blanche Cécile réside à Tokpa Houété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. 

Blanche Cécile a comme activité principale la coiffure. Grâce à cette activité de coiffure, Blanche Cécile arrive à venir en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges du foyer. Blanche Cécile a besoin de mieux équiper son salon de coiffure pour offrir de meilleures prestations à sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. C’est pourquoi Blanche Cécile sollicite de ALIDé un prêt.
texts.en:
Z. Blanche Cécile was born around 1984 in Porto-Novo, the economic and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of three children, of whom two are in school. Blanche Cécile resides in Tokpa Houété in Ouémé County. Her main business is hairdressing. Thanks this business, she manages to come to her husband's aid concerning household expenses. She needs to equip her salon better to offer a better range of services to her burgeoning customer base. This is why she's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cap for drying hair and a large mirror

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
S. is 60 years old and is a resident of Pursat Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother to three children: two are employed as garment workers and the other one is still living at home and under her care. She is married to Thorn, age 58, who works on the farm.

Rice growing is S.’s main source of income to sustain her family’s living conditions. To alleviate the hard physical labor, S. is applying for a loan to buy a water-buffalo to use for plowing the field.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo to use for plowing the field

loans.name: Abdulvohid

texts.en: The need to improve his income and provide education to his four dear children are the reasons Abdulvohid is courteously requesting this loan. He is a very responsible and hardworking father who for many years has been dedicated to the business of buying and selling clothing and shoes. Abdulvohid has so far accessed loans from IMON International five times and has seen his business expand. With the income, he said he was able to educate his children as it is the most important thing for him. Abdulvohid is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to expand his business so that he can generate more income in order to be able to arrange the wedding of his son. He is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasing more new clothing to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: H. Alice est née le 08 Aout 1976 à Hanzounmè  dans la Commune d'Akpro Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé.  Alice est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants dont deux (02) scolarisés ; le troisième n’a pas encore l’âge d’aller à l’école. C’est dans cette Commune d'Akpro Missérété que réside Alice et sa famille.  Alice est coiffeuse de formation et de profession. Alice a besoin d’agrandir et de mieux équiper son salon de coiffure pour une plus grande capacité de ses prestations à cause de sa clientèle sans cesse croissante. C’est pourquoi Alice sollicite un crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Alice was born on August 8, 1976 in Hanzounmè in the community of Akpro Missérété in Ouémé County. She is married and the mother of three children, of whom two are in school; the third one is not yet old enough to go to school. The community of Akpro Missérété is where Alice resides with her family. She is a hairdresser by training and by profession. She needs to expand and to equip her salon better to offer a larger service capacity. This is because her customers are constantly growing in number. For these reasons, she's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, shampoos, straighteners, ointments, and some hairdresser tools

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: B. H. is a 40-year-old mother from Pursat Province. She has three children, all of whom are single and attend school. B. H. works with her husband as a vegetable grower. She runs the business on her own farmland, growing different kinds of vegetables, such as cabbages and potatoes, and morning glories. She has been in this line of work for more than four years and currently earns an average of $2 a day.  B. H. will use her loan to buy a cart to connect to her existing oxen, so that she can use it to transport her mature vegetables to market.

loans.use: To buy a cart

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Zuhra Suljić was born in 1953. She is a widow and comes from the suburbs of the town of Bratunac. She has KM 650 monthly income. She keeps herself busy working in agriculture and taking care of her livestock. The work is very important for her needs. When she works, she doesn`t think about the bad things from the past.

Now, Zuhra wants to extend her business by buying chicks for fattening and selling. She requested her first loan from WWI (Žene za Žene International) of KM 1,000. Zuhra already has cows and sheep and her little farm will be fully operational when she purchases the chickens.

loans.use: To buy chicks and poultry food

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is the mother of two and she is 36 years old. She sells fufu (which is made from cassava) and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more cassava in order to cook more fufu to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava in order to cook more fufu to sell

loans.name: Norbert

texts.fr:
A. Norbert  est né le 23 Novembre 1982 à Porto Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Norbert est marié et est père de deux (02) enfants dont un (01) scolarisé. Norbert réside avec sa famille à Dangbo Centre dans le Département de l’Ouémé. 

Norbert  est couturier de formation et de profession. Norbert a un atelier de couture que son actuel volume d’activité ne permet pas de bien faire. Alors pour mieux équiper son atelier de couture afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle sans cesse croissante sollicite un crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Norbert was born on November 23, 1982 in Porto Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. He is married and the father of two children, one of whom is in school. Norbert resides with his family in Dangbo Centre, in Ouémé County. Norbert is a tailor by training and by profession. He has a workshop, where the current business volume does not allow him to do well. So, to equip his shop in order to do better in satisfying his burgeoning customer base, he is requesting a loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment for work

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco A. is from the village of Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Francisco owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector, primarily engaging in sand and gravel. He uses his skills in manufacturing and selling hollow blocks. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Francisco joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Francisco has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to finance his sand and gravel business. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase items for a planned sari-sari (variety) store on his business site. This loan will be his 3rd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family and support the education of his children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase items for the planned sari-sari store on his business site

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Murotali

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Муротали житель г. Гафурова , женат имеет троих детей, возраст 43 года. Работает в санатории "Шифо" заместителем директора.Его доход с этой работы не большой , поэтому он имеет дополнительный доход с откорма и продажи скота.У него много запаса корма для своих коров.На снимке Муротали в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Murotali, a resident of the city of Gafurova, is married, has three children and is 43 years old. He works as the deputy director in the Shifo sanitorium. His salary with this job is not large, and therefore he has supplementary income with the care and sale of cattle. He has a large supply of fodder for his cows. In the picture, Murotali is at the bank on payday. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: care and sale of cattle

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa Mašić was born in 1984. She lives near the town of Bratunac. She is not married and lives with her parents. Her family deals in stock-breeding. They have cows, sheep, goats and chickens. That business is the only source of income for the whole family and they earn about KM 700 monthly.

Melisa requested her first loan with WWI (Žene za žene International) for the amount of KM 1,000 to buy a horse. Having a horse will help them with the transportation of stock food and make their jobs easier.

loans.use: To buy a horse for transportation of stock food

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen sells kerosene in her house and she has been in this business for the past twelve years. She is 40 years old and married with four children and she lives in Lagos state.

Helen is a LAPO client. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Mahmasaid

texts.en: Y. Mahmasaid is 20 years old. He is not married and he lives with his parents. He makes a living raising cattle in his house. He's the kind of boy who works hard to provide for his family. Every day, from very early in the morning, he tends his cattle, feeding them and milking the cows. Currently, Mahmasaid needs to buy young cattle that he needs to continue his business and, in turn, maintain his humble household. With your help this young and energetic boy can achieve his goals. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more young cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en: A. Abdumanon is 42, and lives with his wife and two children in a house they own. For seven years he has worked in agriculture. Currently he works taking care of livestock and supervising crop land. Abdumanon eagerly waits for harvest season to see the results of his family’s hard work. Everyone helped out. The expectations for a good harvest are more clear for Abdumanon, because the weather doesn't seem to be against his wish. Later on, he wants to spend more time working with livestock and growing his own feed for the cattle, which will allow him to save on costs. This is the ninth time that Abdumanon has requested a loan from IMON International. He is committed, once more, to keep getting ahead with hard work. The money requested will be used to buy seeds and fertilizer for his harvest. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.name: Onorchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Онорчон женщина- возраст 42 года ,замужем имеет четверых детей, работает бухгалтером в больнице города Чкаловска.Её заработная плата не большая , поэтому она вместе с мужем занимается откормом и продажей скота.Ей помогает её муж , по продаже скота, т.к. это мужская работа , продавать скот на рынке.Онорчон устаривают все условия организации и она решила получить кредит для увеличения оборотного капитала.
texts.en:
Onorchon is a 42-year-old woman who is married and has four children. She works as a bookkeeper in a hospital in the city of Chkalovska. Her work pay is not large, and therefore she is engaged in the care and sale of cattle together with her husband. Her husband helps her by selling cattle, since this is [considered] men's work, to sell cattle at the market. Onorchon meets all conditions of the organization and she decided to receive a loan to increase her circulating capital. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: care and sale of cattle

loans.name: Ahad

texts.en: S. Ahad is 45 years old and lives with his wife, a nurse, and their four children. Ahad says he comes from a humble family and, from a very young age, he helped his father in the fields, which is why he never finished his studies. Despite that, he cultivates potatoes, onions and tomatoes. Ahad comments that he is very thankful for what he has and, thanks to the dedication and support from his family, he can have a dignified life and give a better life to his children. At this time, Ahad is applying for a loan in order to buy more raw materials such as: seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, chemical products, etc., that help him cultivate more. loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en: A. Abdurasul is 29 years old and lives with his wife and a little son. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions and their well-being. He has been a farmer for five years and started this activity on his own. He plans to be able to diversify his crops. With the proceeds of the loan he will buy supplies and fertilizers for his fields, in order to obtain better production and the ability to sell at a better price. Be an important part of the growth of Abdurasul‘s business. loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Абдурахмон - мужчина в возрасте 22 лет пока неженат , работает кассиром и продаёт свои товары в столовой на рынке Худжанда.Также он занимается продажей окарачков и напитков в этой же столовой.Абдурахмон для закупа оптом окарачков хочет получить кредит .На снимке Абдурахмон на месте бизнеса.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Abdurahmon is a 22 year man, he is not married yet. He works as a cashier and sells his goods in the cafe on the market of Khujand. Also he sells chicken leg quarters and drinks in the same cafe. Abdurahmon wants to take out a loan to buy leg quarters in wholesale. On the photo Abudurahmon is at his business location.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leg quarters in wholesale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells sand and she has been in this business for the past seven years. She goes to the riverside to purchase her sand to sell to people building houses. She is a widow and she is 35 years old. She has four children.

Grace hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more sand to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sand to sell

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger Q. is from the village of Hilltop Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Roger owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling beverages and engaging in a variety store business. He has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Roger joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in selling beverages as a wholesaler in their village. Roger is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his 7th from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children and to provide for the needs of the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

location.town: Hilltop, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мастура женщина которая кредитуется для увеличения своего оборотного капитала.Она торгует маслом и костным жиром.Для закупа растительного масла она хочет получить повторный кредит.
texts.en:
Mastura is a woman, who is requesting a loan in order to increase her working capital. She sells oil and bone fat. She wants to obtain another loan in order to buy vegetable oil.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetable oil

loans.name: Sobir

texts.en: Sobir is married with two children and is from Isfara in the southern part of Tajikistan. He sells foodstuffs in his grocery store. His merchandise is assorted and of very good quality. He has been in this trade for almost three years. Sobir is very disciplined and responsible. He is thorough and his mind is very sharp – he can keep all his business details in his head. All these qualities have helped him to overcome many challenges that have come his way and allowed him to reach success in business. He has always sought to achieve economic freedom and independence. He is hoping this loan will help his venture to continue growing and continue bringing him profit. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Obid

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Махкамов  Обид мужчина, который берёт кредиты для расширения своего дела. Он занимается производством и продажей мясных шашлыков. На сегодна Обид открыл ещё одну точку и готовит здесь домашний плов, он на снимке готовит плов. А шашлык готовит его сын. Следующий кредит хочет использовать для закупа риса большой партией по оптовой цене.
texts.en:
Obid M. is a man, who obtains loans to expand his business. He is involved in making and selling shish kabobs. Obid also opened another stand, where he cooks home-made pilaf. The photograph shows him cooking pilaf. His son prepares shish kabobs. Obid wants to use his next loan to purchase a large stock of rice at a wholesale price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of rice

loans.name: Awissim

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée à un monsieur qui est un militaire à la retraite, elle a 02 enfants. La pension de son mari est insuffisante pour couvrir toutes les charges de la famille. Pour l’aider à subvenir aux charges, elle a entamée le commerce de charbons de bois, elle fait son commerce non loin d’un marché local,d’autres femmes exercent ce commerce dans ce marché mais ses marchandises sont plus appréciées parce qu’elle a relativement diminué ses prix pour mieux vendre. Faisant face à une diminution de son stock elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 16 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married to a gentleman retired from the military. She has two children. Her husband’s pension is insufficient to cover all family expenses. To help meet these expenses, she started doing commerce in charcoal not far from the local marketplace. Other women there are in the same business, but her merchandise is more appreciated because she has by comparison reduced her prices for better sales. Facing a diminished inventory, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to stock up again with 16 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Азиза кредитор , которая берёт займы на расширение своего бизнеса. Она торгует семечками, жвачками и мелкими продуктовыми товарами. Следующий кредит она хочет потратить для закупа семечками оптом мешками и пожарив продавать их в розницу.Она благодарна инвесторам KIVA за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
Aziza is a borrower, who obtains loans for business expansion. She sells seeds, gum and small food products. She wants to use her next loan to purchase seeds by bags wholesale, toast them and then sell them retail. Aziza is grateful to Kiva investors for the financing and support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of seeds

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is very happy with Kiva loans. She sells cooked foods and drinks. She is 31 years old and married with two children. She hopes for the loan of N160,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Résidente du quartier d’agoè assiyéyé, cette femme est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, en 1995 elle a débuté le commerce de petits poissons, son ancienneté dans ce commerce fait qu’elle en a une parfaite maîtrise de la gestion de cette activité. Actuellement son stock de poissons a diminué, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit qui lui permet d’acheter 17 paniers de poissons.
Avec le revenu de son commerce elle contribue aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
A resident of the Agoè Assiyéyé district, this woman is married and the mother of two. In 1995, she started a business selling small fish. Her seniority in this commerce means she has mastered the managing of it. Currently, her stock of fish is diminished. She wants to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES to allow her to buy 17 baskets of fish. With the revenues from her commerce, she helps with meeting household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 17 baskets of fish

loans.name: Menelyn

texts.en:
Menelyn R. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Menelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Menelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling beverages, like soft drinks, in their village. Menelyn has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Menelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Menelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Menelyn is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Menelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of the children and provide for the family's needs.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a fashion designer, and she also sells sarongs. Caroline is 50 years old and married with 6 children. She desires to pull her family out of poverty. She hopes to receive a loan for the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and one sewing machine so that she can meet the demands of her numerous customers. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and one sewing machine

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel R. is from the town of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Raquel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ready-to-wear products and peddling dried fish within the community. Raquel has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Raquel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue she will generate to improve and expand her business and provide for the needs of the family.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ayaba Yvonne

texts.fr:
Cette femme a commencé en 1999 le commerce de boissons locales alcoolisées appelées « SODABI », cette boisson est très appréciée  dans le milieu togolais. Elle va s’approvisionner au sud du Togo où cette boisson est mieux préparée. Le stock dont elle dispose présentement ne lui permet pas de bien satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 bidons de 25 litres de sodabi.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
In 1999, Mrs. N. started selling local alcoholic beverages that are known as "Sodabi." This beverage is very popular among Togolese. She is going to purchase her stock in southern Togo where this drink is better prepared. With her current stock, she is unable to meet client demand. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 10 cans of 25 liters each of Sodabi. She is married and has three children.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "Sodabi" alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Omorola

texts.en: Omorola sells loaves of bread and drinks in her shop. She is 26 years old and married with a child. She is an active LAPO client and is requesting the loan of N70,0000 to purchase more drinks and loaves of bread to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Genevive

texts.en: Genevive T. is from the town of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old, married, and has one infant child. Genevive owns and operates a meat-vending business. Every month she schedules to butcher a pig and sell its meat to her customers in their community. In 2009, Genevive joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Adjowoa

texts.fr:
Mariée à un monsieur qui est un mécanicien automobile et mère de 1 enfant, cette femme a commencé en 1999 le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois, elle est seule à exercer cette activité dans son quartier, ce qui est très bénéfique pour elle et lui permet de réaliser de bons profits sur ses vente. La pluie a détruit une partie de son stock de marchandises, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
Avec le revenu de son commerce elle contribue aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. is married to a mechanic and has one child. In 1999 she started selling sacks of charcoal. She is the only person who sells charcoal in her neighborhood, and as a result, she makes good profits on her sales. A portion of her stock was destroyed by rain so she wants to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal and is requesting a loan through WAGES to do so. She contributes to her family's household expenses with the money she receives from her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Aliya

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits cosmétiques de façon ambulante, elle gère bien son activité, son lieu d’approvisionnement est le  grand marché de Lomé.  Elle fait souvent un traitement de faveur à ses plus fidèles clientes en leur vendant à crédit et récupère l’argent à la fin du mois. Sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, elle doit par conséquent agrandir son stock pour pouvoir les satisfaire, elle demande à WAGES un crédit pour acheter  des produits de beauté.
texts.en:
Mrs. M. T.'s business involves traveling from town to town and selling cosmetic products. Her business is doing well and she gets her stock from the large market in Lomé. She often helps out her most loyal customers by allowing them to buy products on credit and obtaining payment at the end of the month. Her client base is growing day by day and as a result she needs to buy more stock to meet the increasing demand. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy more beauty products.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana Y. is from the town of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old, widowed, and has one school-aged child. Juana owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Juana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her child. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en: Ifeoma sells clothes in her shop. She is 36 years old and married with two children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Célibataire et devant subvenir à ses propres charges, ce monsieur a commencé l’an dernier le commerce de chaussures, il exerce son activité dans sa propre boutique, il a aussi commencé à approcher les gens dans leur services pour leur proposer d’acheter les chaussures, cela lui permet d’augmenter encore plus ses recettes. Il a reçu des commandes de ses clients, pour pouvoir les satisfaire il doit se réapprovisionner, il s’adresse alors à WAGES pour demander un crédit et acheter 5 cartons de paires fermés et une douzaine de chaussures pieds nus.
texts.en:
Unmarried and having to support himself, this gentleman started doing commerce in shoes last year. He operates in his own shop. He also started approaching people as a service to offer shoes to buy. This enables him to increase his income even more. He has received orders from his customers. To satisfy them, he must stock up again. He is therefore inquiring with WAGES to ask for a loan to buy five boxes of close-toed shoes and a dozen pairs of open-toed shoes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Zita

texts.en: Zita C. is from the town of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old, married, and has two adult children. Zita owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Zita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru: Гулъизор  является  нашим активным клиентом с 2007 года. Она торгует продуктами питания боле 4 лет. Она торгует шоколадом и другими сладостями, также в ассортименте ее товара имеются  макароны и соль.  Но в основном у нее покупается соль , сахар  и макароны. Товар закупала с Уратюбе, теперь ее знакомый привозит себе  и ее товар. Так выгодней и ей и ее знакомому. За прилавком сидят также ее дети по очереди. Кредит получила на расширение ассортимента своих товаров.
texts.en:
Gulizor has been an active borrower since 2007. She has sold food products for over four years. She sells chocolates, sweets, noodles, and salt; the majority of her sales are of salt, sugar, and noodles. One of Gulizor's acquaintances purchases her goods for her in Ura-Tyube, where he goes for his own purchases. This system is more profitable for both of them. Her children also take turns behind the counter. She has received loans in the past in order to expand the range of products she sells.

Translated from Russian by Pavle Milekic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy T., from the village of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon, is a 35-year-old married mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Dorothy owns and operates a specialized retail store, its main source of income derived from selling a variety of ready-to-wear items such as sandals, slippers and underwear. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Dorothy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, Dorothy is now requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education and provide for the needs of the family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Aïchatou

texts.fr:
Cette femme a commencé en 2007 le commerce de bijoux, elle s’approvisionne au Ghana, ainsi elle arrive à réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes, elle vend ses marchandises aux bonnes dames du grand marché de Lomé. Le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de répondre à la demande de ses clients, raison pour laquelle elle s’adresse à WAGES pour demander son premier crédit lui permettant d’acheter 4 cartons de bijoux de nouvelles gammes.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who started a jewelry business in 2007. She supplies herself from Ghana, so she manages to realize a larger profit margin on her sales. She sells her merchandise to women at the grand marketplace of Lomé. The inventory currently at her disposal does not allow her to respond to customer demand. This is the reason behind her inquiry with WAGES. She is asking for her first loan to buy four boxes of new assortments of jewelry. She is married and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah, 32 years old and married with four children, sells foodstuffs in Lagos state, Nigeria.  Sarah is a LAPO client and hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.en:
Edmundo T., from the village of Fatima Lingating, Baungon, is a 40-year-old married father of one infant-aged child. To make a living, Edmundo owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income is derived from selling variety products such as canned goods, coffee, and bread in their village. Edmundo has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Edmundo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, he is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his second from HSPFI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Cet homme est marié et est père de 02 enfants, l’activité génératrice qu’il exerce pour pouvoir subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de farine de blé et de sucre.
