Il exerce son activité dans sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé « ETS IN GOD WE  TRUST ». Son commerce marche  bien, il voudrait l’agrandir et demande pour cela à WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de sucres, 10sacs de farine de blé.
texts.en:
This is a man who is married and the father of two. His income-earning business, which allows him to provide for his family, involves commerce in wheat flour and sugar. He operates his business in his own shop, which he called “ETS IN GOD WE TRUST”. His business is doing well. He would like to expand, and to do so, he’s asking WAGES for his first loan to buy ten sacks of sugar and ten sacks of flour.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Nnenna

texts.en: Nnenna, a 34-year-old widow whose life has not been too easy as she takes care of herself and her three children alone, sells drinks in retail to her customers.  Nnenna hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel I., a single 26-year-old from Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City, raises pigs for sale, a business he only recently started. He is also working as a construction worker in a nearby subdivision to support his daily needs.

In 2009, Rodel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI, and he plans to invest the additional revenue generated from the business for his future use.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Vera

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme est une célibataire, elle est rentrée dans la vie active tôt pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres charges, l’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle a embrassé est le commerce de pagnes bazins, elle a associé à cette activité le commerce de mèches. Elle s’approvisionne en passant des commandes au mali. Son stock a diminué, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 pagnes bazins de haute qualité.
texts.en:
This young woman is single and had to begin to support herself early on. The business that she took up is selling "pagnes bazin" (lengths of African-dyed damask cloth). She also sells hair extensions. She buys her inventory by ordering it from Mali. Her stock is diminished and she wants to replenish it, so she has asked WAGES for her first loan to buy 20 lengths of high quality "pagnes bazin".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes bazin"

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
Ifeoma O. is 30 years old and married with two children.  She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Ifeoma sells second-hand clothes and hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. 

Ifeoma says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.en:
In the Virgen Sagrado Corazón de Jesús district in the city Quiindy, about 23 km outside of the city of Carapeguá, a group of women with limited resources found out about the program Committees for Women Entrepreneurs. They decided to meet to receive information about the program.

These women are active, and the majority of them work as domestic employees, as saleswomen, among other things. They are looking for a little bit more support in order to increase their family incomes and to improve their quality of life.

  1. Jorgelina G. - spice sales
  2. Rosalba E. - food sales
  3. Porfiria A. - domestic employee
  4. Graciela E. - lottery ticket sales
  5. Tomasa A. - pork and cheese sales
  6. Ramona F. - domestic employee
  7. Cinthia C. - food sales
  8. Antonia C. - domestic employee
  9. Elena V. - saleswoman
  10. Jesica V. - clothing sales
  11. Francisca V. - food sales
  12. Berta I. - domestic employee
  13. Ma-Eugenia V. - lottery ticket sales

Two other members of the group decided not to take out a loan this cycle and rather save their money.

loans.use: The majority of the participants of this committee invested their credit in their respective businesses.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde A. is 30 years old and is married with four children. She sells electrical materials and cosmetics. She is a hard working woman that is determined to lift her family above poverty. 

Kehinde hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more electrical materials and cosmetics to sell. 

She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Arsacia

texts.en:
Mrs. Arsacia Z. D. R. is a small entrepreneuer who is 57 years old; she has been married for almost 40 years to Gumercindo R., who is a self-employed construction worker. Together they have 12 children, one of which passed away, leaving them with 11 – seven have their own familias, and the other four live with them. The youngest, 20 years old, is studying accounting at the National University. 

They moved from Asunción to the interior of the country about 20 years ago in seach of better opportunities and well-being for their family. They now are located in Villa Elisa, where Arsacia opted to work for herself and to open a small grocery store in her home. This way, she would be able to raise her children as well as work. 

Arsacia has a very well-established clientele, as she was one of the first grocery stores in the area. The loan she has taken out will be invested exclusively in the purchase of merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To purchase milk, sugar, rice, yogurt, cheese, meat, etc.

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru: Товарова Шамигуль проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 42 года. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Шамигуль более 9 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует продуктами питания. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот, на полученный доход хочет сыграть свадьбу своего сына.
texts.en:
Shamigul T. lives in Vahdat city. She is 42 years old and is widowed, with two children. Shamigul has over 9 years experience trading. She has a shop in the market where she sells food. She is requesting a loan to increase her trade turnover, and with the profits, she wishes to pay for a wedding for her son.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase trade turnover

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice E. is 39 years old and married with two children.

Eunice sells second-hand clothes. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell.

Eunice says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying and selling condiments, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Caacupé Poty 2 Group

texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the Seminario neighborhood of Caacupe, which is about four kilometers outsiD. the downtown area. 

With the financial support of the Fundación Paraguaya, they have been able to succeed. They have been sure of themselves in their businesses, despite the economic risks, and have planned ahead for whatever comes. 

This group is working on their 11th loan cycle with the Fundación. Every day they work at bettering their projects for their own personal and economic development. 

1. Rogelia G. D. B. - Beverage sales 
2. Mary Nelly F. - Clothing sales 
3. Maria Graciela C. - Food sales 
4. Euliana B. -	Small grocery store 
5. Rosa Ramona V. - Clothing sales 
6. Luisa Ramona V. - Small grocery store  
7. Elva M. - Raising and selling chickens 
8. Amalia G. - Dressmaker 
9. Delfina P. - Small grocery store  
10. María Luisa M. - Small grocery store 
11. Hilda Ramona M. - Raising and selling pigs  
12. Ramona Ignacia V. - Domestic employee 
13. Eloisa Natalia G. - Clothing sales 
14. María Agueda V. - Food sales 
15. Lilian Rossana L. - Domestic employee 
16. Marta A. - Plant sales

loans.use: The 16 participants all have their own commercial activities, and each member invests her credit in the sustainment of her business through the purchase of merchandise to sell or of raw materials.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Mr. Rodrigo B. A. is from the city of Carapeguá and is married to Mrs. Vidania Paez, with whom he has three school-aged children.  They live in the Virgen del Carmen neighborhood of Carapeguá. 

Rodrigo has worked treating leather and producing shoes, clothing, and jackets for a large clientele to which he supplies a quality product.  He will use the loan for the purchase of leather, the raw material for his business, which is offered at a great price.

loans.use: The purchase of leather

loans.name: Ruben Ruíz

texts.en:
Mr. Rubén Ruíz Díaz is from the city of Roque González.  He is 40 years old, single, and lives in the Immaculada Concepción neighborhood. 

Rubén travels and sells comforters, hammocks and tablecloths, which are all artisan products.  He sells these products in San Lorenzo, about 80 km from where he lives.  He also has a small grocery store that generates income.  He will use the loan for the purchase of comforters and blankets to sell.

loans.use: The purchase of comforters and blankets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Renovation of studio and purchase of materials for production

loans.name: Santa Teresa Group

texts.en:
The committee “Santa Teresa” was formed by neighbors from the city of Villa Elisa.  All the participants in the group have developed their own independent activities, many in sales.  The members have created a very united and capable group that participates in many activities that strengthen their camaraderie. 
All of the participants in the committee are mothers and work in their respective fields in order to strengthen their household economies and to develop their businesses in a sustainable way.  

1	Elida R.-	   Food sales 
2	Graciela S.-	   Dressmaker 
3	Juana Elena M.-   Charcoal sales 
4	Petrona M.-	   Manicurist 
5	Maria Elena V.-	   Dressmaker 
6	Guillermina Z.-	   Convenience store 
7	Norma E. A.-	   Hair salon 
8	Aida Karina M.-	   Cosmetics sales 
9	Norma Teresa M.-     Fruit sales 
10	Juana Maria A.-     Charcoal sales 
11	Zulma A.-   	   Beverage sales 
12	Margarita A.-  Event planner 
13	Ruth Noemi R.-    Food sales 
14	Isolina F.-	   Cosmetics sales 
15	Carmen Lorena R.-  Clothing sales 
16	Claudia B. R.-	   Hair salon

loans.use: The funds obtained by the committee are invested in their respective small businesses.  All of the participants invest their loan according to the needs of their business.

loans.name: Eugenio Ramón

texts.en:
Mr. Eugenio O. is 59 years old and is married to Fidencia Ferreira.  They have two adult daughters who are married with children.  One of his daughters works with them in their restaurant in the city of Fernando de la Mora.  In addition to the restaurant, he has a to-go service for chicken, as well as sandwich catering for events. 

All of his employees are relatives who live nearby.  Eugenio starts work very early in the morning, when they go to buy the ingredients they need to make their food. 

His restaurant has been open since 1982 and has a well-established clientele.  He has no problem with sales, as his business is open until late in the evening.  The loan he applied for will be used exclusively for the purchase of supplies for his business.

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials such as meat, chicken, oil, sodas, beer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: sewing

loans.name: Rahmatkhucha

texts.ru: Рахматхуча Мирзорачабов проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 32 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. По специальности Рахматхуча является "шофером" и работал он по специальности более 6 лет. В данный момент он имеет фотосалон, где выпукает школьные винетки. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 5 лет. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить сырье.
texts.en:
Rahmatkhucha M. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 32 years old, married and has three children. Rahmatkhucha is a driver by profession and has worked in this field for more than six years. At this time he has a photo studio where he makes school vignettes. He has been in this business for more than five years. The client is asking for a loan to buy supplies.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is 34 years old and married with a child. She sells phone accessories like phone batteries in her shop. She opens her shop from Mondays to Sundays from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.

Saidu is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more phone accessories to sell. This, she says, will increase the living standard of her family and she says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed through the promotion from past months. The group is strong and has the desire to continue to improve. All of the women have their own business activities.

1. Juana G. -- Dressmaker
2. Josefina D. -- Domestic employee
3. Sonia C. -- Domestic employee
4. Fatima R.- 	Undergarment sales
5. Isidra A. -- Small grocery store
6. Marisa P. -- Domestic employee
7. Maria S. -- General sales
8. Gregoria V. -- Secretary
9. Carmen M. -- Convenience store
10. Maria V. -- Saleswoman
11. Myrian A. -- Clothing sales
12. Cornelia O. -- Convenience store
13. Ramona O. -- Beverages sales
14. Sonia P. -- Food sales
15. Maria O. -- Food sales
16. Teofila A. -- Fruit sales
17. Alberta A. -- General sales
18. Fidelina P. -- Domestic employee
19. Mirta F. -- Teacher

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for sale or of raw materials

loans.name: Luiz

texts.en:
Mr. Luiz O. is 44 years old and is married to Mrs. Aida Mancuello, 42 years old, with whom he has two young children who are in elementary school.

Mr. O. has a small grocery store that he has been running out of his home for nine years. The grocery store is named “Adri” and is located in an area without a lot of other grocery stores, so there is minimal competition. Additionally his business is located next to a high school, and so many students buy supplies and candy from his store.

Mr. O. would like to invest his loan in merchandise such as rice, sugar, flour, noodles, tea and candy. When bought in bulk he purchases his merchandise cheaper, in order to make a larger profit on the sales.

loans.use: To purchase of merchandise such as rice, sugar, flour, noodles, tea and candy

loans.name: 3 De Junio Group

texts.en:
This committee formed with the reunion of various neighbors in the city of Villa Elisa. All of the participants of the committee have developed their own independent business activities, the majority of them in sales. The members form a very stable and organized group, as they have been together for more than two years.

All of the participants of the committee are mothers that work in various fields in order to strengthen their household economies and to develop their businesses in a sustainable way. They hope to experience continuous growth with the help of permanent financial assistance. 

1. Maria Cristina D. -- Small grocery store
2. Lisandra S. -- Food sales
3. Delia M. -- Food sales
4. Adela C. -- Small grocery store
5. Maxima I. -- Dressmaker
6. Pablina G. -- Convenience store
7. Gelicita R. -- Hair salon
8. Norma L. -- General sales
9. Maria Victoria L. -- Fruit sales
10. Laura C. -- Charcoal sales
11. Magda Raquel N. -- Beverage sales
12. Nilda F. -- Fast food sales
13. Sandra N. M. -- Clothing sales
14. Benigna M. -- Cosmetics sales
15. Pelagia C. A. -- Diner
16. Maria C. B. -- Clothing sales
17. Maria Veronica T. -- Fruit sales

loans.use: To be invested in each member’s respective business

loans.name: Fummi

texts.en: Fummi sells clothes and jewelry. She is 47 years old and married with ten children. She hopes for the loan of N150,000 to purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.en:
The committee “Oñondivepa” formed with the union of many neighbors from the same district of La Lomita, in the city of Ñemby.

All of the participants of the committee have developed their own independent business activities, the majority of them in sales. The members form a very united and capable group, and do their activities together, as many of them sell fruits and vegetables.

All of the participants of the committee are mothers and they work in order to strengthen their household economies and to develop their businesses in a sustainable fashion.

1. Paulina L. R. -- Clothing sales 
2. Venancia M. -- Food sales 
3. Dionicia T. -- Beverage sales 
4. Maria Teresa O. -- Manicurist 
5. Mercedes A. -- Dressmaker 
6. Lucia O. -- Fruit sales 
7. Ignacia N. -- Fruit sales 
8. Maria Gloria N. -- Cosmetics sales 
9. Isidora A. -- Vegetable sales 
10. Senona V. B. -- Vegetable sales 
11. Marta B. -- Fruit sales 
12. Rosa M. -- Event planning 
13. Nelida C. -- Food sales 
14. Elena I. B. -- Food sales 
15. Limpia O. -- Fruit sales 

One member of the committee decided not take out a loan, and to save her money instead.

loans.use: To be invested in each member’s small business

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr: fatou bintou N. est parent beneficiaire dans la communaute de camberene qui evolue dans la vente de foulards et d'echarpes pour femmes.cette activite est pratiquee depuis 2004.son objectif est de diversifier les articles commercialises en y incorporant d'autres articles tels que chaussures et ou sacs a  mains pour femmes.par consequent elle sollicite un credit 75 000frs afin de satisfaire sa clientele et aussi accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Fatou Bintou N. is a beneficiary and a parent in the community of Camberene. She sells scarves and shawls for women. She has been in this business since 2004. Her goal is to diversity what she sells, adding such articles as shoes or handbags for women. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of 75,000 frs so as to satisfy her clientele and increase her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling articles for women

loans.name: Estelista

texts.es:
Estelista es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Estelista es casada, tiene 46 años y 3 hijos, Estelista tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir llamado La Casa del Sastre, en un local alquilado, tiene 3 personas que le ayudan en la confección de las prendas. Estelista tiene proyectado implementar una lavandería.
Estilista necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de algunas maquinas para la lavandería.
Los sueños de Estelista son tener una empresa grande que sea administrado por sus hijos e implementar otros negocios.
texts.en:
Estelista is a member of the Sonrisa Microfinance Institute. She is a 46-year-old married mother with 3 children. She has a small garment factory called “La Casa del Sastre” in a rented business space. She has 3 people who help her sew garments. She is also planning on starting a Laundromat. Estelista needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan that she will invest as partial payment for some washing machines for her Laundromat. Estelista dreams of having a large company that is run by her children, and of starting other businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial payment for washing machines

loans.name: Olubukola

texts.en: Olubukola sells provisions and drinks. She is 48 years old and married with five children. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Frida Esther

texts.es:
Frida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Frida es conviviente, tiene 59 años y 8 hijos, Frida vive en la comunidad de Viñaca a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde compra y vende tara, cochinilla y lo vende a intermediarios. Además Frida vende leña en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Frida necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara.
Los sueños de Frida son mejorar su negocio y educar a sus hijos, nietos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Frida is a member of the Sonrisa Microfinance Institute.

She is a 59-year-old with a live-in partner and 8 children. She lives in the Viñaca community, located 45 minutes from the city of Ayacucho, where she buys and sells tara pods and cochineal insects, then sells them to intermediaries. Additionally, she sells firewood in the city of Ayacucho.

Frida needs a 2,600.00 PEN loan so that she can purchase tara pods.

Frida dreams of improving her business and providing an education for her children and grandchildren so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tara pods

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Tomasa es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Tomasa vive en la comunidad D. Huayllapampa que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Tomasa junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación artesanal D. ladrillos, los cuales los comercializa en la misma comunidad. Además Tomasa compra y venD. tara, cochinilla y tuna dependiendo D. la temporada.
Tomasa necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago D. los peones.
Los sueños D. Tomasa son construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a member of the Sonrisa Microfinance Institute.

She is a 48-year-old married mother of 5 children. She lives in the Huayllapampa community, located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Tomasa and her husband make bricks by hand for a living, which they then sell in their community. Additionally, Tomasa buys and sells tara pods, cochineal insects and prickly pears, depending on the season.

Tomasa needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in paying workers.

Tomasa dreams of building her own house and of providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying workers

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Mr. Roberto M. F. is 43 years old and has been married to Petrona Gonzalez for 10 years.  They have two children, both older with families of their own. 

Roberto went into business about 13 years ago with a very small grocery store where he sold sugar, bread and other items. Thanks to lots of hard work and dedication, his business grew and became a gas station. He is also now selling products in bulk to a well-established clientele. Currently he is selling a lot of charcoal.  With the credit he obtained from the Fundación Paraguaya he built a place from which to sell his charcoal. Both of his businesses are going really well, and he thanks the Fundación for the support he has received.

loans.use: The buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Lucia es separada, tiene 46 años y 2 hijos, Lucia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, productos que vende en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz y haba.
Los sueños de Lucia son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Sonrisa Microfinance Institute.

She is a 46-year-old separated mother of two children. She travels to the different markets in the region where she buys grains, then sells them in various markets throughout the city of Ayacucho.

Lucia needs a 1,600.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing corn and broad beans.

Lucia dreams of buying a car so that she can transport her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn and broad beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land that is near town and has a good supply of water

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 20 years old and married. She makes a living placing phone calls and selling rechargeable phone cards. Blessing has applied for this loan to buy more rechargeable phone cards to sell to her customers. She wishes to extend her thanks to everyone at Kiva who helps fund this loan.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Julia es casada, tiene 63 años y 7 hijos, Julia se dedica a la elaboración D. papa seca (papa sancochada, pelada, picada y que es secado al sol) producto que es utilizado en la preparación D. platos típicos, actividad que realiza en su casa con la ayuda D. 2 personas, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa.
Los sueños D. Julia son aumentar su negocio y ahorrar para implementar otro negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Sonrisa Microfinance Institute.

She is a 63-year-old married mother with 7 children. She makes papa seca (parboiled potatoes, peeled, diced, then sun-dried), which is used in preparing local meals. She does this from home with the help of two other people. She sells her products at the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

Julia needs a 600.00 PEN loan, which she will invest in purchasing potatoes.

Julia dreams of expanding her business and saving money to set up another business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and to pay for various services

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice K. is a friendly and hard-working 40-year-old widow with five children aged 12 to 20 years of age. The older two are currently on vacation, while the rest are in secondary school. She also cares for one nephew, one niece and her own parents. Beatrice makes a living running a canteen and a farm that she has owned for five years. She is also a seamstresss, who learned her trade at a school where she now teaches sewing other people, mostly young girls. 

In her canteen, Beatrice sells a variety of products because this attracts more customers, and uses a portion of her income to pay school fees for her children and to maintain their standard of living. She has applied for this loan to complete work on the building where she teaches sewing, and to buy more products for her canteen, particularly sugar, bread and cakes. She leads the Tulwanirewamu loan group pictured here.

loans.use: To restock her store and buy building materials .

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a struggling widow with 6 children. Angelina is 70 years old. She sells ice fish in retail to her customers in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more ice fish to sell. She is indeed grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice fish to sell.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
LILIANA S. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS NAZARENAS” vive en el Distrito de Camporverde, tiene 40 años, 5 hijos y uno de ellos es menor de edad, su esposo es agricultor y mototaxista.

El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual lo invirtió en víveres para preparar sus comidas y luego venderlos en la plazuela del distrito.
Hasta la fecha ella continua vendiendo comida en la plazuela.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara respuestos para repararar su moto taxi y también comprara víveres y platos para la venta de sus comidas.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por los 4 años que viene trabajando el cual le ha permitido implementar su negocio,  es una ayuda interesante que me ha permitido seguir adelante remarcó. Y hoy se siente capaz de administrar más su dinero.
texts.en:
LILIANA S. A. is a member of the “LAS NAZARENAS” Microfinance Institute. She is a 40-year-old woman who lives in the Campoverde district and has 5 children, one of whom is under age. Her husband is a farmer and motorcycle taxi driver.

She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan from Manuela Ramos in purchasing food to prepare her meals that she later sold in the district’s small square. To this date, she still sells meals in the small square.

With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle taxi. She will also purchase food and plates for her food business.

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the past 4 years that she has been a member because this institute has allowed her to start her own business. She stated that it has been of great help to her, and has permitted her to keep moving forward. Now she feels that she is capable of managing her money better.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Moralayo

texts.en: Moralayo sells bags of cement. Moralayo has 4 children and she is married. She is 40 years old. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more bags of cement to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: khady S. est parent beneficiaire depuis 1999.elle habite a camberene et s'active dans la vente de fripperie.elle sollicite ce credit de 150 000frs pour faire face a l'accroissement de la demande de sa clientele.elle capitalise plus de dix ans d'experience dans ce domaine.
texts.en:
Khady S. is a beneficiary, a parent, and a member since 1999. She lives in Camberene and works at selling used clothing. She is asking for this loan of 150,000 frs to satisfy the increasing demand of her customers. She is banking on more than 10 years of experience in this field.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling used clothing

loans.name: Paul

texts.fr:
Z. Paul  est né vers 1977 au quartier Latchè dans la Commune  d'Avrankou dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Paul réside dans cette Commune  d'Avrankou depuis son enfance et il y mène son activité. Paul est marié et père de deux (02) enfants dont un (01) scolarisé. 

Paul mène comme activité la coiffure ; mais en plus, Paul fait de l'agriculture comme activité secondaire. Paul a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’il n’en a actuellement pour équiper son salon de coiffure  en vue d’offrir de meilleures prestations à sa clientèle et de faire plus de revenus pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire mieux les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Paul Z. was born around 1974 in the Latchè neighborhood, in the city of Avrankou (Ouémé Department). He's been living there since his childhood. He's married and the father of two children, out of which one attends school. Paul is a hairdresser in Avrankou, but he's also a farmer as a secondary job. He needs more financial needs than what he's got today, in order to equip his hair salon to provide better services to his clientele. This will enable him to turn a higher profit, and to better provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipments and products for his hair salon

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
MARGOT S. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS NAZARENAS” vive en el distrito de Campoverde, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 30 años de edad, 2 hijos y su pareja es mecánico.

Su trabajo pertence al rubro de mecánica y venta de repuestos para carros; el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles con el adquirió un poco de repuestos y los vendió a precio cómodo.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de herramientas y accesorios para reparación de motores el cual va de la mano con la venta de repuestos, además ella es costurera y quiere comprar una remalladora.

Margot manifiesta que la ONG Manuela Ramos me ha ayudado a generar un ingreso más para mi familia, también me ha permitido ampliar mi negocio y seguir creciendo y desarrollándome como mujer.
texts.en:
MARGOT S. C. is a member of the “LAS NAZARENAS” Microfinance Institute. She lives in the Campoverde district of the city of Pucallpa. She is a 30-year-old mother of two, and her husband is an auto mechanic.

She works in the vehicle repair and parts sector. The first 300.00 PEN loan that she obtained from Manuela Ramos was used to purchase a few spare parts, which she sold at a reasonable price.

She will invest this 3,000.00 PEN loan in purchasing tools and accessories for engine repair, which goes hand-in-hand with parts sales. Furthermore, she is a seamstress and would like to purchase an overlock sewing machine.

Margot states that Manuela Ramos— the non-governmental organization—has helped her generate extra money for her family. It has also allowed her to expand her business and continue growing as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools, accessories, and spare parts for repair shop

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells weaves, hair extensions and hair cream. She is also a hairdresser. Fumilayo is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more weaves and hair extensions to sell. She says thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more weaves and hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr: khary K. est parent beneficiaire et habite la localite de cambereneelle ademare son activite de vente de chaussures depuis 1968.elle sollicite ce pret de 100 000frs pour augmenter son fonds et aaccroitre ses ravenus afin de mieux participer au soutient de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khary K. is mother and lives in the small town of Cambereneelle Ademare. Since 1968, her business has been consisting in selling shoes. She's seeking this loan of XOF 100'000 to bolster her working capital and increase her income, in order to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital

loans.name: Sébastien

texts.fr: F. Sébastien  est né vers 1983 à Avrankou dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Sébastien est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants dont un (01) seul est scolarisé. Sébastien réside avec sa famille à Amouloko dans la Commune de Akpro Missérété toujours dans le Département de l’Ouémé.  Sébastien est couturier. Mais les moyens dont dispose Sébastien actuellement ne lui permettent pas de développer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients dont le nombre ne cesse de croitre. C’est pourquoi Sébastien sollicite un crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sébastien F. was born around 1983 in Avrankou, in the Ouémé Department. He's married and the father of 4 children, out of which only one attends school. Sébastien lives with his family in Amouloko, in the city of Apro Missérété, in the Ouémé Department. He's a tailor. The financial means he has currently do not enable him to bolster his business to meet an ever-increasing customer demand. This is why Sébastien is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khardiata

texts.fr: khardiata S. est parent beneficiaire et commercante en habillement .elle capitalise une dizaine d'annees d'experience dans ce domaine.voulant satisfaire les sollicitations de clientele'khardiata S. sollicite un pret de 100 000frs pour elargir son marche.
texts.en:
Khardiata S. is a client parent, and she is a clothing merchant. She capitalizes on a dozen years of experience in this field. Wanting to satisfy customer requests, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to expand her market.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a hard working woman. She sells bags of charcoal. Dorcas is 34 years old and married with a child. Dorcas hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tokpassi

texts.fr:
D. Tokpassi est née en 1963 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Tokpassi est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants dont un (01) scolarisé. Tokpassi réside à Avakpa dans le troisième arrondissement de la Commune de Porto-Novo. 

Tokpassi a une cafeteria qu’elle gère elle-même. Tokpassi mène cette activité de cafeteria avec  passion et ceci lui permet de venir en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges familiales. Mais les moyens financiers dont dispose Tokpassi  actuellement ne lui permettent pas de bien développer sa cafeteria en vue d’une meilleure prestation à ses clients. C’est pourquoi Tokpassi  sollicite un crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Tokpassi was born in 1963 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. Tokpassi resides in Avakpa in the third district of the town of Porto-Novo. Tokpassi has a cafeteria that she herself manages. She runs this business with passion, and this enables her to come to her husband’s aid regarding family expenses. But the financial means currently at her disposal are preventing her from really improving her cafeteria, with the aim of offering a better range of services for her customers. This is why she’s requesting a loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three boxes of pasta, five 5-kg sacks of Gino rice, a half-box of canned tomatoes, a 1-kg box of canned milk, and some pub drinks

loans.name: Jéronime

texts.fr:
S. Jéronime est née vers 1976 à Oganla dans le troisième arrondissement de la Commune de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Jéronime est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants dont un (01) scolarisé. 

Jéronime est dans le secteur de la restauration. C’est Jéronime elle-même qui gère son restaurant. Grâce aux revenus de son activité de restauration,  Jéronime arrive à  venir en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges familiales. Jéronime veut mieux développer les activités de son restaurant  en vue d’une meilleure prestation envers sa clientèle dont le nombre ne cesse de croitre. C’est pourquoi Jéronime sollicite un crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Jéronime was born around 1976 in Oganla in the third district of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married and the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. Jéronime is in the restaurant field. She herself is the one who manages her restaurant. Thanks to the revenues from her restaurant business, she manages to come to her husband’s aid regarding family expenses. She wants to improve her business with the aim of having a better range of services for her customers, who are ever-growing in number. This is why she is requesting a loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three 500-mg boxes of spaghetti, five 7-kg sacks of Gino rice, a half-box of canned tomatoes, a 25-L drum of vegetable oil, and ten 6-packs of pub drinks

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Bancomunal  Avancemos Juntas.
Yolanda es casada tiene 59 años, 6 hijos todos mayores todos trabajan y algunos estudian
Yolanda  tiene su puesto de locería hace 10 años, su hija empezó el negocio, empezaron vendiendo abarrotes  pero tuvieron que cambiar de giro por que la zona donde estaban era de artículos de bazar, ahora vende todo lo que es Loceria  por  las tarde se dedica a dar servicio de secado de ropa por kilo.. 
Desde que  Yolanda esta en Finca aprendió ahorra, por que casi no ahorraba se gastaba el dinero fácilmente.. 
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de  1000 soles, va comprar paltos de loza, vasos, plásticos.
El sueño de Yolanda es tener su puesto lleno de mercadería, y  seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Avancemos Juntas Microfinance Institute.

She is a 59-year-old married mother of 6 children, all of whom are of age and work, while some are in school.

Yolanda has been selling housewares in her own stand for about 10 years. Her daughter started the business, initially selling groceries, but they had to change plans because the stand was located in the miscellaneous items section. She now sells all types of dining items. In the evening, she provides laundry drying services by the kilogram.

Ever since Yolanda has been a member of Finca, she has learned how to save her money; she never used to save it and would spend it easily.

Yolanda needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan so that she can purchase dinnerware, cups, and plastic tableware.

Yolanda dreams of filling her stand with merchandise and would like to continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dinnerware, cups, and plastic tableware

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es socia del Bancomunal  Avancemos Juntas
Celia es conviviente, tiene 68 años,11 hijos todos mayores independientes.
Celia  es de Moquegua, estudio repostería, pero no la ejerció porque con su hijo empezaron un taller de metálica en su casa, ella recepción los pedidos, 
Desde que Celia esta en Finca, ha podido progresar en su economía.
Celia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de fieros, arreglo de su maquina soldadora.
El sueño de Celia es tener una tienda de venta de estructuras de fiero.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the Avancemos Juntas Microfinance Institute.

She is a 68-year-old married mother with 11 children, all of whom are independent. She is from Moquegua. She studied pastrymaking, but has never practiced her profession because she and her son started a metal shop at home, where she takes in all the orders.

Ever since Celia has been a member of Finca, she has been able to get ahead financially. She needs a 1,000.00 PEN loan so that she can buy metal and have her soldering iron repaired.

Celia dreams of having a store in which she sells metal structures.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase metal and fix soldering iron

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity sells foodstuffs. She is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal  Avancemos Juntas
Juana es casada tiene 50 años,  tres hijos, dos gemelas y uno de 11 años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Juana, no estudio nada por que se dedico a trabajar para darle educación a sus hijas, hace quince años vende comida, los vecinos la animaron por que la zona donde vive es céntrica, también hace tamales por pedidos para restaurantes y para  sus vecinos. 
Desde que Juana esta en Finca, pudo darle estudios a sus hijas que son policías
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para compra arroz por saco,maíz . 
El sueño de Juana es  techar su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Community Bank “ Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas”. She is 50 years old, married and has 3 children, a set of twins and an 11 year old who is studying at a public school. Juana did not go to school because she started to work to provide for her daughters. She has been selling food for fifteen years. Her neighbors encouraged her to start the business since she lives in a central area; she makes tamales to sell to restaurants and neighbors.

Because of “Finca” Juana has been able to give an education to her daughters who are police officers. Juana is asking for a loan of $550 to buy rice and corn. Juana’s dream is to build the roof of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and corn

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Bancomunal  Avancemos Juntas
Sandra es conviviente tiene 32 años, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 4 años que estudian en la escuela estatal.
Sandra estudio para asistenta dental, no lo ejerció por que tiene que cuidar a sus hijos  los dos sufren de asma y necesitan cuidados ,  empezó vendiendo productos de belleza por catalogo y con las ganancias logro comprarse un moto-car de segunda, que lo ha dado en alquiler.  
Desde que Sandra esta en Finca ha podido superarse económicamente como persona, puede aporta para la economía de su hogar, esto ha ayudado a su matrimonio. 
Sandra necesita un préstamo de  1000 soles, para repara la moto-car que tiene.
El sueño de Sandra es  tener una flota  de moto- car.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the community bank “Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas”. She is 32 years old and has two children who are 12 and 4 years old and attend a public school. Sandra studied to be a dental assistant, but didn’t work on the field because she had to take care of her children since both have asthma and need special care. She began selling cosmetics by catalog and with the profits she bought a secondhand moto-car, which she rents.

Because of “Finca” Sandra was able to improve financially personally, and can provide for the household which has helped her marriage. Sandra is asking for a loan of $350 to repair her motor-car.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a moto-car

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: anta D. est parent beneficiaire a camberene'elle vend de l'encens depuis plus de sept ans compte tenu des nombreuses sollicitatons provenant de ses clients elle veut augmenter son fond en vue de gagner d'autres marches.son objectif est d'ameliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anta D. is a client parent in Camberene. She has been selling incense for over seven years. Given the number of requests from her customers, she wants to increase her working capital with the aim of gaining other markets. Her goal is to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Juana Elsa

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92709&_tpos=5&_tpg=1
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Juana  con los ahorros  adquirió, un puesto donde vende carne de res, carnicería JHOANNA,      
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de mercadería para su negocio, siempre debe surtir de mondongo, hígado, bofe, que compra Importados por cajas.
Aprovecha que está en Finca para invertir cada vez más.
Continua con su sueño de comprarse una cámara frigorífica.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92709&_tpos=5&_tpg=1 Juana is a member of the "Avancemos Juntas" village bank. With her savings, Juana has been able to open a store called Carniecería Jhoanna, where she sells meat. Juana needs a load of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy merchandise for her store. She always needs to keep tripe, liver and lung in stock and she buys them imported by the case. She makes use of her Finca loans to invest a little more in her store each time. Her goal continues to be to one day purchase a walk-in freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rosa  Leny

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92715&_tpos=4&_tpg=1
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas. 
Se dedica  hace 8 años a la  venta de  ropa, que  ofrece  a sus amigas y vecinas.  
Rosa solicita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para  comprar ropa Sport de temporada.
Desde que Rosa está en Finca trabaja con tranquilidad, se siente respaldada por los prestamos.  
Continua con su sueño de poner un bazar en su propia casa.
texts.en:
You can look at Rosa's first loan through Kiva by clicking on the following link; http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92715&_tpos=4&_tpg=1 Rosa is a member of the communal bank "Avancemos Juntas" (Together We Move Forward). She has been making a living by selling clothing for the past 8 years. She sells the clothing to her friends and neighbors. Rosa is requesting a loan for $425 (1,200 Soles) so that she will be able to buy sports clothing that is in style this season. Since Rosa has been part of the organization Finca she has been able to work with a sense of calm. The loans have helped her a lot and she continues to dream about opening up a store in her own house.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sports clothing that is in style this season.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Primer préstmao: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92719&_tpos=6&_tpg=1
Elizabeth es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Hace tres años trabaja por las tardes en un taller de carpintería junto con sus esposo y también sus hijos que la ayudan, ellos invierten en el están comprando herramientas para abrir en un futuro su taller, en un futuro, también se ha puesto a vender productos de belleza, para poder ayudar mas en la economía .
Desde que esta en Finca se siente bien, se siente que es útil para su familia.
Elizabeth  necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles,  para comprar madera por tablones y planchas de tripley .
El sueño de Elizabeth es tener su propio  taller de carpintería con su esposo.
texts.en:
First loan http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92719&_tpos=...

Elizabeth is a member of Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.

She has worked afternoons in a carpenter’s shop for three years alongside her husband and her children that also help. They invest by buying tools to open her own workshop in the future. She also sells beauty products to help her finances.

Since she has been with Finca, she has felt that it is valuable for her family.

Elizabeth needs a loan of 1200 soles ($425 USD) to buy wood boards and scraps.

Elizabeth’s dream is to have her own workshop with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood boards and scraps

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
MIRNA G. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS NAZARENAS vive en el Distrito de Camporverde, tiene 45 años, 5 hijos de los cuáles dos de ellos menores y su esposo es agricultor.

El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual lo invirtió en gaseosas para venderlo en una fuente de soda.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles lo invertiirá en la compra de msesas, sillas, gaseosas y otros productos que servirán para mejorar su pequeño local.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por los 4 años que viene trabajando con ella ya que le ha permitido implementar su negocio y el cual la ha ayudado a salir a adelante como empresaria. Manifiesta que hoy más que nunca se siente capaz de administrar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Mirna G. P. belongs to the “Las Nazarenas” community bank. She lives in the Camporverde district, is 45 years old, and has five children of which two are young. Her husband is in agriculture.

The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos was for 300.00 Nuevos Soles, which she invested in sodas to sell from a soda fountain.

With this loan of 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy tables, chairs, sodas and other products that will serve to improve her small business.

She thanks Manuela Ramos for the 4 years working together with her, which has allowed her to start her business and move forward as a businesswoman. It shows that today, more than ever, she feels the capacity to run her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, sodas and other products for her soda fountain

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida sells bags of salt and sugar. Rashida lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bags of salt and sugar to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of salt and sugar.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: amadou N. est parent beneficiaire a camberene'il est aviculteuret meme temps eleveur de moutons.il sollicite ce pret de 150 000frs pour l'elargissement de son poullailler et le stockage d'aliments de betails.son objectif st d'accroitre ses revenus pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amadou Aiang is a client parent in Camberene. He raises poultry and at the same time raises sheep. He’s requesting this loan of 150,000 francs to enlarge his chicken coop and his inventory of feed. His goal is to increase his revenues to provide for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Luz y Vida.
Nelly es soltera, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Nelly viaja  a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales menores, quesos, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y en algunas oportunidades lleva a la selva ayacuchana. Además Nelly se dedica a la elaboración de papa seca (papa sancochada, pelada, picada y que es secado al sol) producto que es utilizado en la preparación de platos típicos
Nelly necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa y pago de peones.
Los sueños de Nelly son mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of Banco Comunal Luz y Vida.

Nelly is single, 32 years old and has 3 children. Nelly travels to different markets in the region where she buys young animals and cheeses, products that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho and sometimes brings to the Ayacuchana jungle. Nelly also makes dried potatoes (potatoes that are parboiled, peeled, chopped and dried in the sun), which are used in the preparation of local cuisine.

Nelly needs a loan of 750 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of potatoes and to pay laborers.

Nelly’s dreams are to improve her businesses and offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and pay laborers

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr:
A. Philomène est née le 12 Août 1967 à Adjohoun dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Philomène est mariée à MONNANDJO Emile. Philomène est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Philomène a été à l’école jusqu’en classe CM2 c’est-à-dire le cours primaire. Ensuite, Philomène a appris la couture qu’elle a exercée pendant une dizaine d'année. 

Cependant, Philomène a abandonné la couture pour problème de santé.  Actuellement Philomène vend des tissus sur commande qu’elle distribue souvent à crédit à ses clients. Philomène a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ce crédit. Philomène a besoin de moyens financiers pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de satisfaire toutes les commandes de tissus qu’elle reçoit. C’est pourquoi Philomène sollicite un deuxième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Philomène was born on August 12, 1967 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé County in southern Benin. She is married to MONNANDJO Emile and is the mother of four children who are all in school. She attended school through the 5th grade, that is, primary school. Next, she learned how to sew, something she did for 12 years. However, Philomène dropped sewing due to health problems. She currently sells fabrics by special order and distributes them, often on credit, to her customers. She has already had a loan with Alidé and has repaid it. She has need of funding for boosting her working capital, in order to satisfy all the orders she receives for cloth. This is why she’s requesting a second loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy twenty 5-meter bolts of damask cloth

loans.name: Luz Velza

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Luz y Vida.
Luz es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Luz tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes. Actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija. Además Luz los días sábados y domingos viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende ropa.
Luz necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, bebidas.
Los sueños de Luz son salir adelante y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Luz y Vida ("Light and Life") Village Bank. She is 42 years old and is married with four children. She runs a store from her home, where she sells basic grocery itemes, vegetables and meat. She works seven days a week, and her daughter sometimes helps her run the store. Luz needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice, sugar and soda. Luz dreams of getting ahead in life and that her children will grow up to be working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and drinks

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence Y. is 38 years old. She is married and mother of two children who are currently in junior and senior high school respectively. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains a daily source of livelihood.  She has been selling bunches of plantains and cocoyams for the past eighteen years now to support her family. Plantain and cocoyam are favorite staple foods that supply carbohydrate components in diets. She takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with a direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen, who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy bulk supplies of plantains and cocoyams to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to support her children in school. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Gye Nyame’ which literary means Except God.

loans.use: To purchase more bulk supplies of plaintains and cocoyams directly from the farmers.

loans.name: Anasthasie

texts.fr:
T. Anasthasie est née le 14 Avril 1965 à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Anasthasie est mariée à LABITE Lucien, déclarant en douane. Anasthasie est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Anasthasie a fait les études jusqu'au lycée. Ensuite, Anasthasie suivi une formation en secrétariat bureautique. Anasthasie reçut son parchemin et travailla avec dans une structure privée pendant neuf (9) mois. 
Anasthasie a choisi délibérément d’abandonner le secrétariat pour se lancer dans le commerce de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) et des cartes de recharge téléphonique. 

Anasthasie a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ce crédit. Anasthasie a besoin de moyens  financiers pour diversifier son activité avec la vente de produits vivriers précisément le maïs. Anasthasie sollicite donc un deuxième prêt de ALIDé pour l'achat de sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
T. Anasthasie was born on April 14, 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to LABITE Lucien, a customs agent, and is the mother of three children who are all in school. She attended classes up to high school. Then, she had office secretarial training, received her certificate, and worked in a private organization for nine months. Anasthasie consciously decided to abandon secretarial work to get started in the commerce of various goods: candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, laundry detergents, dish soap, and bath soap, batteries, candles, etc. and also mobile phone recharge cards. Anasthasie has already benefited from an ALIDÉ loan and has repaid it. She has need of funding to diversify her business by selling staple foods, corn to be exact. She's therefore requesting a second loan from ALIDÉ to buy sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six 100-kg sacks of corn

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is married and the father of two children who are in school. He is thirty-seven years old. He lives at Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana with his family. He operates a corn mill machine where people come to grind their corn, peeled cassava, and sometimes fresh tomatoes. He happens to be the only person who is in this business in the community. Daniel has been in this business for the past year. He complains that the number of people who come to grind their products are more than what the machine can grind. This has slowed his profits drastically, therefore, he wants the loan to buy an additional corn milling machine and its parts, so that he can meet the demands of his customers before competition emerges in the community. He believes this will make him more resourceful in taking care of the home as a father. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Yehowa nemewhefo’.

loans.use: To buy a corn milling machine and parts to meets the demand of his customers.

loans.name: Degoo De Carabane Group

texts.fr:
Nous sommes un groupe de jeunes femmes, accompagnées d'un homme, qui travaillent dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires, d'ustensiles de cuisine, et la transformation de produits halieutiques pêchés dans notre écovillage. Nous sommes constitués en groupe qui fait chacune une activité différente de l'autre. Le prêt va nous servir chacun dans son domaine de travailler et de créer  des revenus qui va nous aider à subvenir aux besoins de nos familles et à payer la scolarité et les soins de nos enfants.
Nous habitons une zone enclavée où nous n'avons pas la possibilité d'accéder aux crédits conventionnels. C'est pour cette raison que nous sommes venus solliciter Kiva pour l'octroi d'un prêt afin que nous puissions travailler comme beaucoup de nos sœurs.
texts.en:
We are a group of young women, along with a man, who are working in the commerce of food items, kitchen utensils, and the processing of seafood harvested from our eco-village. We compose one group in which each of us has a business that is different from the next. Each of us will use the loan in our respective domains to work and create revenues, which are going to help us to provide for our families and to pay for the schooling and the care of our children. We live in an isolated area where we lack access to conventional loans. For this reason, we've come to requesting the granting of a loan from Kiva, so that we may work, as do many of our sisters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils, seafood products, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Aissa Gaye

texts.fr: aissa gaye M. est parent beneficiaire a camberene depuis 1999.elle s'active dans la fripperie et capitalise une certaine experience dans ce domaine.pour repondre ala forte demande de sa clientele elle sollicite ce pret de 100 000frs afin d'etre plus competitive.
texts.en:
Aissa Gaye M. has been a client parent in Camberene since 1999. She is active in used clothing and is capitalizing on some experience in this field. To respond to the strong customer demand, she is requesting this loan of 100,000 francs to be more competitive.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Señor De Lagunas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Los Andes, a este pertenece la asociación “Señor de Lagunas”, formada por trece mujeres.
Un grupo muy alegre que  junto  a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con mucha responsabilidad en actividades internas del centro.
La mayoría de las integrantes de  este grupo se dedican comercialización de ropa, por ejemplo Vicky vende pantalones para todas las edades, otras de  ellas se dedican a la venta de chamarras, ropa para invierno, ropa para niños y bebes, además también elaboran y venden comida. 
Solicitan mayores créditos con el fin de ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, de este modo sus ganancias serán mayores,  con el único de objetivo de mejorar el estilo de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The thirteen women who make up the Señor de Lagunas Association are all members of the Los Andes Community Center, which is located in the city of El Alto. It is a very cheerful group that works very responsibly on the center's internal activities in cooperation with its loan officer. Most of the group members sell clothing. For example, Vicky sells pants for all ages. Other group members sell jackets, winter clothing, or baby and children's clothing, while some prepare and serve meals. The group members are requesting larger loan amounts in order to buy more merchandise so that they can increase their sales and their incomes. They all share the ultimate goal of improving their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise (clothing, ingredients to prepare meals)

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. is 50 years old, and is married with five kids. Three of the children have finished junior high school while the remaining two are still in school. Veronica is very resourceful in providing her family with food and paying bills. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey with fish in the community where she lives. She sells kenkey in the mornings and in the afternoon. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grain, which is cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers, since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. She belongs to the village group called “Emmanuel” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa T. is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a son and two daughters. Two are in senior and junior high schools while the last born is in primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a mason. Theresa trades in second hand clothes. She deals in clothes and bed sheets. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells them at the market square in her community, and also treks to other markets to sell. Theresa has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is a 45-year-old married mother of five. She lives in Suhum, a town in the Eastern Region of Ghana, with her nuclear family. All of her children currently attend school.

Regina loves selling goods. She has sold yams, rice and soap detergents for the past eight years to maintain her livelihood and support her family. She treks to farming communities like Kintampo in the Brong-Ahafo Region to buy yams in bulk from cassava farmers. She receives deliveries of soap and rice from Koforidua, a nearby city in the Eastern Region. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. 

With this loan, Regina aims to buy yams in bulk, bags of rice, and soaps to serve her customers. This, she believes, would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of their home. She also hopes to use some of her profits to support her kids in school. She belongs to a village bank called "Nyame Adom," which means "God’s Grace."

loans.use: She wants to buy yams, bags of rice, soap detergents etc.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. is 38 years old. She is married and has one son and two daughters. All are currently in junior high and primary schools. Adwoa lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Adwoa's husband is an electrician, while she is a trader who sells plantains. She has sold her goods in nearby markets for the last 10 years. 

Adwoa is requesting a loan to buy plantains in bulk. She currently buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. She aspires to expand her business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy plantains in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cultivation of food crops

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. is a 54-year-old mother of four. All of her children are working. She has sold plantains and other grocery products for the past 14 years in order to support her family. She gets her plantains directly from farmers in nearby communities, which allows her to avoid dealing with middlemen.

In addition to selling plantains, Mary also operates a grocery shop that serves the community she lives in.  In it, she sells items like sugar, biscuits, and evaporated milk. Unfortunately, business has slowed somewhat due to current food prices and the economic crunch in the world market. Mary wants to use the loan to buy more bunches of plantains and grocery products, increasing her efficiency by buying in bulk and maintaining her supply to her customers.

Mary believes this will help expand her business so she can raise more income to support her family. She belongs to a village bank called "Nyame Mmoa," which means "God’s Help."

loans.use: To buy more plantains and grocery products to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Valérie

texts.fr:
N. Valérie est née le 28 Avril 1975 à Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Valérie est mariée à ZOHOUN Archille, un technicien en bâtiment. Valérie est mère de quatre enfants dont deux jumelles. Valérie a été à l’école jusqu’en classe CM2 c’est-à-dire le cours primaire. Ensuite, Valérie a appris la couture qu’elle a exercée pendant une deux ans. Valérie a abandonné la couture parce que ça ne lui permettait pas de subvenir à ses besoins.

Actuellement, Valérie vend de la friperie de façon ambulante. Valérie a déjà bénéficié e deux crédits de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ces crédits. Valérie a besoin de moyens  financiers pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de faire plus de revenus pour ses besoins. C’est pourquoi Valérie sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
N. Valérie was born on April 28, 1975 in Cotonou, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to ZOHOUN Archille, a building technician, and is the mother of four children, of whom two are twins. Valérie attended school through the 5th grade, that is, through primary school. Then she learned how to sew and did so for two years. She dropped sewing because it did not allow her to support herself. Currently, Valérie sells second-hand clothing door-to-door. She has already benefited from two loans with Alidé and has repaid them. Valérie needs funding to augment her working capital in order to produce more income for supporting herself. This is why she’s requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bale of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cultivating maize

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella B. is twenty-six years old. She is married and has one child, a boy who is yet to start school. She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a hard working woman. Her husband is in the sand winning business while Stella runs a provision store. She sells groceries such as Milo (a chocolate malt beverage), sugar, rice, candies, and bread in a store on the street. She has been in business for seven years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her store. She hopes to improve her standard of living and give her child a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mame Mberry

texts.fr: mame mberry S. est parent beneficiaire a camberene vendeuse de produits cosmetiques depuis plus de cinq annees.elle sollicite ce pret de 150 000frs pour augmenter son fond de roulement ce qui pourra contribuer a l'accroissement de reveus.ainsi elle pourra ameliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mame Mberry S. is a client parent in Camberene and a seller of cosmetics for over five years. She is requesting this loan of 150,000 francs to augment her working capital, which will be able to help with growing her revenues. She will thus be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Crecer, el Banco inicia su tercer ciclo con 17 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, refrescos, abarrotes en general, ropa, panes, loceria, comidas, golosinas y embutidos.
	
Como es el caso D. Judith es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Judith se dedica a la preparación D. pasteles como alfajores que prepara en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza D. manera ambulatoria.
	
Mientras que Soledad es soltera, tiene 31 años y 1 hijo, Soledad tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles  haciendo un total D. 5,700 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. harina, manteca, bebidas, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, ropa.

Los sueños D. las socias son ahorrar para ampliar su negocio, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener una pastelería y construir su casa.
texts.en:
The Crecer ("To Grow") Village Bank is beginning its third loan cycle with 17 members. The group members are involved in a variety of economic activities. They sell grains, drinks, general grocery items, clothing, bread, dishes, prepared meals, sweets and cold cuts. For example, Judith is 22 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their son. She bakes sweets, like traditional alfajor cookies, in a rented overn. She sells her desserts on the street. Soledad is 31 years old and is the single mother of one boy. Soledad runs a stO. from her home, where she sells basic grocery items and vegetables seven days a week. The group members are requesting different individual loan amounts, such as 300 or 450 soles, and the total group loan amount is 5,700 soles. The group members will use their loans to buy flour, lard, sodas, rice, sugar, sweets and clothing. The group members dream of saving money to expand their businesses, of providing their children with a good education, of opening a cake shop and of building their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, lard, sodas, rice, sugar, sweets and clothing

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 40 years old.  She is married and blessed with two children who are in school. Janet is a trader who works very hard to provide food for her children. She enjoys selling cosmetics, a trade which has been her primay source of income for the past two years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. She mostly sells her goods through hawking, and she balances that with the manufacturing of palm oil.

Janet believes that with this loan, she will have more resources to purchase a wider variety of cosmetics like pomade, hair cream, and lipstick.  She will also be able to purchase more palm nuts to increase her inventory for palm oil sales. Janet would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called "Yehowa Nemewhefo."

loans.use: Janet wants to use the loan to buy more cosmetic products and palm nuts.

loans.name: Ana Valentina

texts.es:
Ana es separada tiene 48 años, tres hijos  de 21,19 y 17 años que están estudiando y trabajando.
Ana comenzó a trabajar desde los 18 años en el  mercado en el puesto de su mama, con sus ahorros se pudo comprar un puesto donde trabaja actualmente, ella vende verduras, apio cebolla, arveja, lechuga, pero también  vende  verduras chinas.  
Desde que Ana esta en Finca aprendió como llevar mejor su negocio, a tratar bien a las clientas.
Ana necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, para la compra de verduras.
El sueño de Ana es que su negocio crezca más.
texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old and separated with three children who are 21, 19 and 17 years old. Her children are currently in school or working. Ana started working at her mother's market stand when she was 18 years old. She saved up enough money to buy her own stand, where she currently works selling vegetables like celery, onions, peas and lettuce in addition to a variety of Chinese vegetables. Since becoming a member of FINCA, Ana has learned how to give better customer service and has improved her business management skills. Ana needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy vegetables. Her dream is to further expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables

loans.name: Joyeux Lutins Plus Group

texts.fr: Kilolo M. est vraiment passionnée du commerce. C’est depuis 1985, qu’elle est entrée dans le monde de micro-entreprise à l’âge de 15 ans. Elle avait commencé son affaire avec un capital initial de $50 qui lui avaient permis d’acheter des poissons salés à revendre. Son affaire a connu la prospérité jusqu’en 1990. Les instabilités politiques et économiques des années quatre-vingt dix ont perturbé l’activité causant ainsi sa baisse. En 2000 an, Kilolo relance la vente d’habits usagers qu’elle diversifie quelques années plus tard en y ajoutant des épices qu’elle vend jusqu’aujourd’hui. Elle décide d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Joyeux Lutins » en 2008, dans le but d’ouvrir un jour un magasin d’habillement. Elle est une cliente fidèle qui a reçu des crédits de Hope RDC qu’elle a totalement remboursés à temps. Le dernier prêt qu’elle a obtenu, lui a servi d’acheter 10 plateaux d’œufs ainsi que d’épices à revendre pour accroitre le revenu. Kilolo est divorcée, mère de 4 enfants dont leurs âges varient de 6 à 17 ans. Trois d’entre eux étudient. Un au secondaire et deux à l’école primaire. Actuellement, son capital propre est de $100. Son activité lui génère un bénéfice de $48 par semaine.
texts.en:
Kilolo M. really has a passion for commerce. In 1985 at the age of 15, she got involved in the world of micro-enterprises.
