She had started her business with $50 in initial capital, which had enabled her to buy salted fish to sell. Her business prospered through 1990. The political and economic instabilities of the 90’s disrupted her work leading to a drop in business. In 2000, Kilolo started up again selling used clothing, and she diversified a few years later by including the sale of spices, which she sells today. Kilolo decided to join a HOPE RDC group named “Joyeux Lutins” in 2008, with the goal of opening a clothing store one day. She is a loyal client who has received HOPE RDC loans and who has totally repaid them on time. The last loan she had was used to buy ten trays of eggs, as well as spices to sell in order to grow her revenues. Kilolo is divorced and is the mother of four children, ranging in age from 6 to 17. Three of them are students. One is in secondary school, and two are in primary school. Currently, her capital amounts to $100. Her business generates for her a profit of $48 each week.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten trays of eggs and some spices to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cultivating maize

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is fifty years old, is married, and has given birth to nine children: three sons and six daughters. All are still in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer.

Adwoa is a food vendor and has been in business for three years. She prepares and sells rice and stew, selling on a table by the roadside in the mornings. She buys her goods from Kumasi and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr:
K. Victorine est née  en 1942 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN dans le Département de l'Ouémé. Victorine est mariée et mère mais tous ses enfants sont déjà majeurs donc ne sont plus à sa charge ni à la charge de leur père. Victorine a été à l’école jusqu’en classe CM2 c’est-à-dire le cours primaire. Ensuite, Victorine a appris la couture qu’elle a exercée pendant quelques années. 

Parallèlement à la couture, Victorine vendait des  divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) qui ont  pris finalement le pas sur la couture. Victorine a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ces crédits. Victorine a besoin de moyens  financiers pour diversifier son activité avec la vente de produits de brasserie et des jus de fruit. Victorine sollicite donc un cinquième prêt de ALIDé pour l'achat d'un réfrigérateur.
texts.en:
K. Victorine was born in 1942 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin, in Ouémé county. She is married and a mother, though all her children are already of age and so are no longer in her care nor in their father’s care. Victorine has been to school through the 5th grade, that is, through primary school. Then, she learned how to sew, something she has been working at for a few years. Along with sewing, Victorine has been selling various items: candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardine, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, batteries, candles, etc., and this business has in the end supplanted her sewing. She has already benefited from four loans with Alidé and has repaid them. She needs funding to diversify her business by selling pub products and fruit juices. She is therefore requesting a fifth loan from Alidé to buy a refrigerator.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria D. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children: one boy and two girls. All are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a community policeman. Victoria is a trader. She trades in mineral water and soft drinks. She sells on a tabletop by the road side from morning to evening. She wants a loan to buy more crates of drinks. Victoria buys her drinks from Kumasi. She has been in business for six years. She aspires to expand her business and to be able to give her children good education.

loans.use: To buy drinks for her business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa O. is 58 years old. She is a widowed mother to four children. All her children are currently independent and are working, reducing her burden. Her husband died following a prolonged sickness. Theresa lives at Suhum, in the eastern region of Ghana, with grandchildren. She works very hard to provide for her business and to support herself. In her business, she sells kerosene, bottled water and peanuts in the community market where she lives. She has been in business for the last 2 years; she mostly sells the kerosene from home. She requests a loan to support the purchase of more gallons of kerosene, bottled water and peanuts to upgrade her inventory. It is her desire to save more towards her old age. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the community group called ‘Emmanuel’.

loans.use: To buy kerosene, sachet water and bags of peanuts.

loans.name: Delfina Emperatriz

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Delfina  es casada tiene 42 años, dos hijos de 18 y 11 años,  que estudian en la escuela estatal
Delfina comenzó en el negocio vendiendo anticucho en la puerta de su casa, pero se dio cuenta que la salchipapa era más rentable y se puso a vender salchipapa por las noches, en el día trabaja en un salón de belleza.
Desde que Delfina esta en Finca su negocio pudo crecer y comprar mas mercadería, también pudo estudiar cosmetología.
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de licuadora, cerveza, gaseosas. 
El sueño de Delfina es poner una peluquería.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Mujeres Progresando ("Progressing Women") Village Bank. Delfina is 42 years old and married with two children, who are 18 and 11 years old. Her children are currently studying in public schools. Delfina started out selling anticuchos (beef-heart kabobs) from her doorstep, but then realized that selling salchipapas (French fries with hot dog slices) would be more profitable, so she switched. Since joining FINCA, Delfina has been able to buy more merchandise and expand her business. She was also able to study cosmetology. Delfina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy a blender, beer, and sodas. Delfina's dream is to open up a hair salon.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a blender, beer and sodas

loans.name: Union Pro Mujer Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Unión Pro mujer” trabaja junto a  Pro-Mujer hace más diez,  a la fecha  cuenta con doce socias activas, ellas han  demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría están casadas y con familias, se ven en la necesidad de buscar  otras fuentes de ingresos ya que las necesidades de sus hijos aumentan día a día.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de ropa usada, víveres, cosméticos otras también se dedican al  tejido de mantas, en lana de vicuña. La mayoría de ellas venden sus productos en ferias de la ciudad Necesitan capital para poder comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería  o productos, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer bienestar a sus familias
texts.en:
The Unión Pro Mujer group has worked together with Pro-Mujer for over ten years. They currently have 12 active members. They have shown themselves to be an organized group regarding their loan payments. Most of the group members are married and have families. They need to look for other sources of income since their children’s needs increase every day. Within the group there are different businesses such as selling used clothes, provisions, and cosmetics. Other group members weave blankets from vicuna wool. Most of them sell products at the fairs in the city. They need capital to be able to buy a larger quantity of merchandise or products. This way they will generate greater income, which will allow them to provide for the well being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is thirty-eight years old. She is the divorced mother of three children. All of her kids are in school in the community where they live. She was divorced some years ago when her husband disrespected her by getting married to another woman. Responsibility for the family rests completely on her and she works very hard to provide for the children.

She has being selling foodstuff for the past 15 years to provide for her family. She sells plantains and cassava by the main roadside that links to Koforidua Township, in the eastern region. She says her goods are usually purchased by travelers who regularly travel that road.

Mercy’s business is doing well due to the good human relation she has with her customers. Her major challenge is in accessing funds to buy more from the farmers so that she can store products when there is a price hike. Mercy wants a loan to buy foodstuff like bunches of plantains and cassava etc. to restock her inventory. It has also being her dream to save more from her business proceeds to take care of the children in school. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Mmoa’, meaning God’s Help.

loans.use: She wants the loan to buy food inventory.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to two daughters. One is in the senior high school while the other is in university. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Dwenase, in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town. Her husband is a trader. Cecilia is also a trader. She trades in domestic goods such as plates, glassware, blenders, etc. She sells from a container at the lorry station in her community. Cecilia has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plates and drinking glasses in bulk.

loans.name: Luz Magaly

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92749&_tpos=6&_tpg=1
Luz es socia D. Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Luz es soltera, tiene 35 años no tiene hijos alquilo un local donde puso y una bodega,  su bodega queda en una venida,  ella trabaja todo el día.
 Desde que está en Finca, los  préstamos han ayudado para  invertir, su negocio ha crecido.
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos para surtir su bodega, todo lo necesario para una bodega.
El sueño de Luz es tener una casa propia, y que su negocio crezca más.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92749&_tpos=... Luz is a member of the Mujeres Progresando Community Bank. Luz is 35, single, and she does not have children. She rents a place where she set up a mini market. Her mini market is on an avenue, and she works all day. Since she has been in Finca, the loans have helped her to invest, and her business has grown. She needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and everything necessary to stock her mini market. Luz’s dreams are to have her own house and that her business grows more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, milk, and noodles

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is married mother with one child. Currently her child is in school in the community where they live. She works very hard to help her husband in taking care of the home. She has been married for five years now. Gifty’s business is the sale of corn dough. Corn dough is used to prepare banku or kenkey and it can also be used for the preparation of porridge. She has been selling corn dough for the last two years now. She says selling of corn dough is lucrative because its moves very fast. She started this business with the support of her husband. The working capital she has is not enough to buy more bags of maize for the corn dough. She decided to look elsewhere for assistance and her friend, who is a beneficiary of the loan, introduced her to Sinapi. She is therefore requesting a loan which she believes would enable her to buy more bags of maize, from the villages, to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Nyame Mmoa’, meaning God’s Help.

loans.use: To buy more maize for the preparation of corn dough.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris B. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: three sons and a daughter. All are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region. Her husband is a farmer. She trades in vegetables and other food items. She sells vegetables such as onions, garden eggs, pepper, tomatoes, etc. on a tabletop at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and from Kumasi. Doris also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr: marieme D. est parent beneficiaire acamberene vendeuse de poissons depuis 1997.elle capitalise plus de dix ans d'experience dans ce domaine.elle sollicite ce pret de 50 000frs pour ameliorer ses conditions de travail.avec l'achat d'un frigo elle pourra assurer la conservation de ses produits.
texts.en:
Marieme D. is a client parent in Camberene and has been a fish seller since 1997. She capitalizes on over ten years of experience in this field. She is requesting this loan of 50,000 francs to improve her work situation. With the purchase of a refrigerator, she will be able to ensure her products are preserved.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is fifty-five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child, a son, who is currently in the polytechnic. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in utensils. She buys her goods (sets of utensils) from Kumasi, at affordable prices, and sells at the market square in her community. Mary also deals in textiles. She hawks and treks to other markets to sell as well. Mary has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to give her son all the necessary support.

loans.use: To buy utensils.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene K. is a forty-two year-old trader. She is married and has four children who are currently attending school through the help of government compulsory free education. It is her daily dream to provide quality education for her children, to give them better future life. She lives at Adawso, a suburb in the eastern region of Ghana. Within the community, there are diverse business activities and most of them are petty traders. Irene owns and operates grocery shop with items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, soaps, etc.

She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stock of different variety, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She hopes to pay the loan in due time because she believes the loan would boost her business growth. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Mmoa’, meaning God’s Help.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Roció es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Roció es casada tienen 34 años, tiene 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 4 años, que están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Roció estudio educación inicial, pero no lo ejerció y  por que el negocio daba mas dinero y se caso aprendió hacer tamales con su tía, todos sus familiares se dedican hacer tamales, ella vende reparte  tamales  a restaurantes sábado y domingo   semanal hace 3000 tamales.
Desde que Roció esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar y ha podido ampliar su negocio, aprendió a organizarse.
Roció necesita un préstamo de  1000 soles para la compra de tamales, maíz, hoja de plátano, canastas de paja, para salir a vender.
El sueño de Roció es tener un restaurante grande de comida.
texts.en:
Roció is a member of the Mujeres Progresando Community Bank. Rosa is 34 and married. She has three children ages 14, 11, and 4; they attend a state school. She studied early education. She did not work in that field because her business gave her more money. She got married and learned to make tamales from her aunt. All of her family members make tamales. She sells and delivers tamales to restaurants on Saturdays and Sundays. She makes 3,000 tamales a week. Since Roció has been in Finca she has learned to save. She has been able to expand her business, and she learned how to be organized. Roció needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy tamales, corn, banana leaves, and straw baskets for when she goes out to sell. Roció’s dream is to have a large restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tamales, corn, and banana leaves

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha G. is forty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children: two daughters and a son. Her children are all in the senior high and the junior high schools at the moment. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town, called Dwenase, in the Western Region of Ghana. Agatha is a trader. She trades in utensils. She buys her goods (sets of utensils) from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks and treks to other markets to sell as well. Agatha has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children good education.

loans.use: To buy utensils.

loans.name: Progreso Y Conciliacion #1 Group

texts.en:
Andrea (pictured on the far left wearing blue) has five children and lives in a small town in Consuelo named “Barrio 15”. It can get quite confusing, really fast, when you travel within Consuelo. The dirt roads are very narrow and not named, but are just the perfect size for motoconchos (taxi motorcycles) to ride in. The motoconcho drivers have to make sure they accurately dodge the kids and animals playing outside. If you are lost, you can usually easily find your way by asking the friendly community members, everyone knows each other and can direct you without a problem. 

Andrea has requested a loan to purchase new women’s clothes, sheets, and comforters. She particularly states that she wants to buy women’s intimate apparel as she is currently running low. She has been doing this business for 12 years and is very experienced with it. This is her third consecutive loan with Esperanza but she says that she used to borrow from Esperanza eight years ago. Andre says that her life has changed dramatically after she became an Esperanza client. Now she has a lot of material goods that she never dreamed she could purchase. She proudly confesses, “life keeps on getting better”. Andrea hopes to always manage a successful business and aspires to see her children succeed in life. 

Support Andrea and her team of entrepreneurs achieve their goals. Thank you.

loans.use: Purchase of women's clothes, sheets, and comforters.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha A. is thirty-one years old and is married, with two children who are currently in school. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood at Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana where she lives with her family.

Bertha is very skillful and a talented hairdresser and has two apprentices who are learning skills for their future dependency. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. Therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy a larger quantities of hair products like weavons (hair extensions), pomade, shampoo, activators etc., to serve her customers. She has won so many customers in the community who come to her salon to have their hair done. She said it is mostly the weekends that customers come in numbers as most of them will be going to work on weekdays.

Bertha will be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Nyame Mmoa’ meaning God’s Help.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret G. is a married mother of three children, two sons and one daughter who are all currently in the junior high and primary schools. She is 33 years old. Margaret lives with her children and husband in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She says her husband is a mason. She is a baker. She bakes bread in her community. Margaret supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks to sell. She buys bags of flour from Kumasi. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Giovanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92751&_tpos=6&_tpg=1
Giovanna  estudio secretariado pero no termino se caso y tuvo hijos, le  gusta la cocina y  vende menú de lunes a viernes en su casa y desde los 18 años los sábados y domingos hacen tamales y los vende en la puerta de una panadería, por las tardes teje chompas, chalinas.
Desde que Giovanna esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar a desenvolverse, le gusta el compañerismo. 
Giovanna necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, para comprar lanas, hilos y ingredientes para hacer tamales.
El sueño de Giovanna es comprarse un carro para taxi
texts.en:
Giovanna studied to become a secretary but did not finish. She is married and has children. She likes to cook and sell meals from Monday to Friday at her house and for the last 18 years, on Saturday and Sunday, she makes tamales and sells them outside of a bakery. In the afternoon, she knits sweaters and scarves. Since Giovanna has been with FINCA Peru she has learned to save and to manage herself, and she likes the companionship. Giovanna needs a loan of 2,200 Sols in order to buy wool and thread, and ingredients to make tamales. Her dream is to buy herself a car to use as a taxi. Click here to see her first loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, thread, and ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Currently all the kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood.  She has been selling onions for a year now to support her family. Her husband is a farmer in the community.
She buys the onions from the Koforidua market and sells them through hawking in Suhum community. For lack of funds, she buys her onions at retail price making it difficult to make a profit. She requests a loan to travel to the northern region of Ghana so that she can buy onions in bags. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Margaret belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Adom’ which literary means God’s Grace. This, she believes, will enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of their home.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of onions.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is a married mother of three children, two sons and one daughter who are all currently in the senior high and primary schools. She is fifty years old. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She says her husband is a farmer. Elizabeth is a food vendor. She fries and sells doughnuts. She supplies to other retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks to sell. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. Elizabeth has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D. is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of five children, four of whom are in school. Through her business, Mary has supported her eldest child through senior high school and continues the support. Mary lives with her husband who is also a trader. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey and fish through hawking. She carries the hot kenkey on her head and hawks until the sun goes down. She has been in business for the last fifteen years, so one can imagine she survives to cater to her family.

Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education. Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Adom’ which literary means God’s Grace.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora started her fish sales a year ago at Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana. She gets her stock of smoked fish from Yeji and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish. Because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base that travels from the other part of the community to buy her fish. She is now 42 years old, married and the mother of five children. Currently, four of the children are in school. She wants to use the loan to buy more assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She belongs to the village bank called Emmanuel.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is thirty-four years old and is the married mother of two children. Currently both of her children are in school.She belongs to the village bank called “Emmanuel”. 

Joyce operates a drinking spot where she sells all kinds of drinks such as soft, canned and bottled drinks, etc. She has been running the drinking spot for the past year.

Joyce is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with a quality education for their future careers. But she claims she is without adequate funds and so it isn’t possible to realize that dream. She is humbly requesting your help to make her dream come true so that she would be more able to take care of the children. With the loan, she wants to purchase an increased stock of assorted drinks from the wholesalers to restock her shop.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of assorted drinks to restock her shop

loans.name: Aminah's Group

texts.en:
N. Aminah has had a retail shop as her business for eight years. She is 29 years old and married with three children aged 10, 8, and 6 in primary 3, 2 and 1 respectively.

She had a challenge of lack of enough capital but, now that she can access loans, the problem is somewhat solved. She can use her loans to restock her shop with more products hence making more profits of about UGX 60,000 a week. She hopes her shop will grow much bigger so that she is able to buy her own house in the future. She needs a new loan to help restock her shop.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced. Her kids are grown. Tatyana runs a small female clothing sales business in her home-town of Kahovka. She also travels to small neighboring towns, in Kherson region, selling clothing merchandise as well. Sixteen years ago, after the collapse of the Soviet Union, Tatyana was forced to find new ways to support and feed her family, which motivated her to launch this small vending venture. Tatyana worked really hard to see her trade succeed. Presently, she has 40,000 Grivnyas (Ukrainian Hryvnia or UAH) in turnover capital.    

Tatyana is requesting a loan of 12,640 Grivnyas to increase her inventory of assorted merchandise that she offers for sale. She wants to increase her sales and income as a result. Tatyana always says she enjoys being self-employed and would never trade it for any other job.

loans.use: to increase inventory.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 30 years old. She is currently single and mother to one child, currently in school. She divorced out of unfaithfulness on the part of her divorced husband, she tells us. She lives at Suhum, at the eastern region of Ghana with her child. Therefore, the responsibility of the child and business progress rests of her shoulders. She is determined to provide for her child through hard work and commitment. To support her child, she has been selling cosmetics: products like spray, powder, lip gloss, blouses etc. and sells through hawking. She has been in business for a year and a half now. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to sponsor her children’s education. She is sure that your loan support will bring her the desired results she expects. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Gye Nyame’, which literary means Except God.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with grown children. She lives and works in Kahovka, in the south-eastern part of Ukraine. Yelena has been in the clothing sales business for 11 years. Just as many other small entrepreneurs at that time, Yelena started her venture because she didn’t have any other way to provide for her family’s needs. Today she has 40,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital.

Yelena has been successful working in this sphere of trade. She says this venture gives her opportunity to support her famil, which makes all the hard work worth the income she is making. This time Yelena is requesting a 12,640 Grivnyas loan to increase her income and to be able to provide for her family in the future as well.

loans.use: to increase her sales.

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer Y. is married and has 4 dependants.  He has received schooling through Senior High School. Ebenezer makes and sells fishing boats at Abotoase, near Hohoe.  He has been in this business for quite some time now. His wife is a trader. Ebenezer uses his income to pay school fees for his children. Ebenezer will use the loan to purchase more wood and other materials for making the fishing boats for resale, to expand his business and gain much profit, to enable him to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ebenezer plans to reinvest and expand his business for more profit.

loans.use: Ebenezer will use the loan to purchase more wood and other materials for making the fishing boats.

loans.name: Valdemar

texts.en:
Valdemar and his family live in Drogobych, Western Ukraine. Valdemar sells men’s and women’s clothing in his home town. He launched his business 15 years ago. Ever since his business has flourished and grown to be a sustainable and profitable venture.

Today Valdemar is seeking a 12,000 Grivnya loan to re-stock his merchandise. He is hoping to increase assorted clothing merchandise he offers for sale in his kiosk and boost his sales as a result. Valdemar has proved to be a responsible borrower who has repaid all his previous loans without delinquencies.

loans.use: to re-stock his merchandise.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 58 years old and is a divorced mother with two children. The elder one is gainfully employed while the last has just completed the senior high school.

Georgina loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her source of livelihood. She has been selling tubers of yam for six years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities like Afram Plains in the eastern region of Ghana to buy her stocks of yam. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices.

With this loan, she wants to buy a bulk supply of yams to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her child, who just finishes the senior high, to the university level. Georgina belongs to a village bank called ‘Emmanuel’.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Progreso Y Conciliacion #2` Group

texts.en:
Maria is married and has five children. She lives in a small town in Consuelo, Barrio 15. Consuelo has many green fields, sugar plantations, narrow dirt roads, and tin houses that are constructed one next to another. Maria has lived there her whole life and operates a small women’s clothing shop from her home.

Maria has been in business for about eight years, selling clothes, intimate apparel, and custom jewelry. With this loan she will particularly buy women’s panties, bras, socks, bracelets, rings, earrings, and other accessories. She is also looking into buying a glass stand where she can display and protect her accessories.

This is Maria’s third loan with Esperanza. She states that business is not always good, it has its ups and downs, like everything else. She hopes that one day her business will reach a healthy size. 

Please help Maria become a successful businesswoman in her community. Thank you.

loans.use: To purchase women's intimate clothing and accesories

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married. She runs a small business selling women’s clothing in the central market in Vinogradovo, Ukraine. She has been in business for over ten years. She has an enterprising spirit and is very hard-working and persevering. The success she has achieved in her business is a direct result of her efforts and commitment to her work. Presently, Mariya has 25,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her income is about 3,000 Grivnyas each month.

Mariya would like to obtain a loan of 9,000 Grivnyas to open a new vending facility and stock it with necessary merchandise. Wide selection of clothing items will help her better present the benefits of her products and services to her customers. Mariya tries to avoid copying the inventory of other market vendors. She has built a good reputation for the quality of her products and support services. We believe that her constant quest to improve her business and services will help her achieve continued success and enable her to repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility and stock it with necessary merchandise

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 38 years old, married, and the father of one child who is currently in school. Emmanuel is very hardworking and dedicated to his work.

Emmanuel has been a professional carpenter for the past ten years now. Carpentry has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his upkeep. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of things pertaining to furniture work. He manufactures things like chairs, wardrobes, beds etc. He says that, for lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pre-finance most of the orders from his customers. This, he said, slows down his work because he necessarily has to wait for funds from his customers before any work can begin which most often causes delays.

Emmanuel requests the loan to enable him to procure useful working tools and finishing materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, wooden boards etc. to improve his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income to ensure good living. It has been his dream to be one of the best carpenters in the community where he lives.

Emmanuel belongs to the village bank called ‘Emmanuel’.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and finishing materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 34 years old, divorced, and the mother of four children who are all in school.

Regina sells at the community market of the place where she lives with her family. She sells fried yam with fish by the roadside of Adawso, a suburb of Suhum in the eastern region of Ghana. Fried yam with fish is a very tasty meal and is enjoyed by many Ghanaians. Regina has been in this business for five years now.

Regina takes delivery of yams in bulk from the farmers and the fish from the Koforidua market. She says the price of commodities in the market has increased now, making it difficult to buy more stock. She is therefore requesting loan support to enable her to meet the daily demands of her customers by buying more yams and other ingredients. She believes with that help she can realize her dream of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more yams, cooking oil, fish, etc.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.fr: fatma D. est parent beneficiaire a cmberenedepuis 1997.elle est commercante de tissus et capitalise six ans d'experience.elle sollicite ce credit de 100 000frs pour repondre a la demnde accroissante de ses clients.l'augmentation de son fond pourra engendrer la maximalisation de ses benefices.
texts.en:
Fatma D. has been a client parent in Camberene since 1997. She is a merchant of cloth and capitalizes on six years of experience. She’s requesting this loan of 100,000 francs to respond to the growing demand of her customers. Augmenting her funds will result in maximizing her profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Moru

texts.en:
Moru B. is a butcher who sells fresh meat at Abotoase near Hohoe. Moru has received no formal education. He is married and has six dependents.

Moru has been selling fresh meat for quite a while. He is responsible for looking after six children and other family expenses. His loan will be used to buy more cows, goats and sheep for slaughter and resale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more cows, goats and sheep for slaughter and resale

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.en:
Vasyl is a single dad who is raising two teenage sons. His wife left him and he was forced to find ways to feed his growing boys. This is how he ended up being a small entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov working in the sphere of recycling services. Vasyl owns two small market stalls at different marketplaces in his home town of Belaya Tserkov. He has two hired employees who help him run his small venture. People bring empty glass bottles that are to be recycled to Vasyl. He collects them in plastic boxes and takes them to a recycling company. Vasyl has been in this business for eight years so far. Presently, he gets about 19,000 Grivnyas in income each month. 

Vasyl is seeking a 5,500 Grivnya loan to re-construct and equip his garage with necessary units for glass bottle storage. Moreover, he would like to re-construct it so that he could keep his car there as well. Vasyl believes he could use his spacious garage facility much more efficiently if he reorganizes everything inside. People who know Vasyl always characterize him as a determined, focused individual who never stops when faced with challenges. He is a fighter and always makes sure his family has all they need. We believe Vasyl’s responsibility and perseverance will help him repay the current loan as well.

loans.use: To re-construct and re-equip his garage that serves as a storage facility

loans.name: Osuman

texts.en: Osuman S. is married and has 6 dependants. He has received no formal education. Osuman sells cattle and parts of animals which are of interest to tourists at Abotoase, a town near Hohoe, Ghana. He has been in this business for a long time. Osuman uses his income to pay for housekeeping expenses. Osuman will use the loan to purchase more cattle. With the resulting profits, Osuman plans to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: Osuman will use the loan to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati O. sells provisions and cosmetics at Abotoase, near Hohoe. Fati has received no formal education. She is married and has 4 dependants. Her husband is a trader. Fati has been selling provisions and cosmetics since for quite sometime now. She is responsible for paying school fees and other domestic expenses for her children. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions and cosmetics for resale. He hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest to increase her capital.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more provisions and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Edisa's Group

texts.en: N. Edisa is a friendly and hard working lady with a business of selling fresh produce, like cabbages, tomatoes, onions, carrots and spices, from her home in Kisoga. She is a widow with 5 children aged 2-14 years. She pays their school fees herself with the help of loans. She buys her goods from farmers in the villages (in addition to the vegetable she gets from her farm) and she sells from her stall. With her portion of the loan, she intends to buy more cabbages, pineapples, carrots, onions, and tomatoes to sell. She has been able to develop herself and her home with the loans by buying more household items. With this share of the loan, Edisa needs to buy more fresh produce for sale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. started her smoked fish sales nine years ago at Suhum, in the eastern region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty, good quality fish and because of that, many customers buy from her stand in the market center. She has a cunning spirit to convince her suppliers to win them for more fish when there is high demand of fish and supply is low. She buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and has them smoked at a nearby stand. She has a high customer base who will travel from surrounding villages to buy from her stand. She is 43 years old, married and mother to five children. All of her children are currently in school. It is Mary’s desire to save more to provide her children with education. She is, therefore, requesting for loan support to buy adequate fish to upgrade her inventory. She belongs to the village bank, called ‘Yehowa neme whefo’, which means God is my keeper.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Erasma

texts.en:
Erasma is from Urcos, a small community that is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, 50 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She is married and has six children. For 16 years she has worked at her juice stand near the main square. She sells all types of juices and smoothies that cost between 2 and 5 soles. Her specialty drink is carrot juice.

With this loan Erasma wants to purchase a blender and juicer, and also build up her capital in the business. She is a member of a 44-person lending group with Arariwa that receives financial training from a loan officer. She also participates in the group savings account.

loans.use: To purchase a blender and juicer

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali M. sells radio sets and footwear at Abotoase, near Hohoe. Ali has received no formal education.  He is married and has 6 dependants. Ali has been selling radio and footwear for a while now. He is responsible for paying school fees for his children and other household expenses. His loan will be used to buy more radios and footwear for resale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to invest in expanding his business and to increase his capital profits.

loans.use: To buy more radios and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en: B. Emmanuel is a friendly, hard-working man with a boda boda “motorcycle” business. With the help of loans, he has been able to own his current motorcycle and this helps to bring in more income and profits. He hopes to buy tubes and shock absorbers, once he gets a new loan, so that his customers are more comfortable on the bike. He is also a farm with banana, potato and cassava plantations. This endeavor also helps to bring in an extra income, although the farm is mostly managed by his wife and employed labor. He is the father of 5 children, of which 3 are in school while the other 2 are still young.

loans.use: Buying motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Sartawisa Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal “Alto Lima” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Sartawisa” que  tiene aproximadamente 14 años de vida, sus integrantes tienen diferentes negocios  como: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, tejido de mantas, venta de cosméticos y atención de cabinas telefónicas. Todas aseguran  que utilizarán el préstamo para la compra de materia prima o mayor mercadería.

Juana G. es una de las más antiguas integrantes, ella recuerda haber ingresado a la Asociación hace 13 años, cuando su cuñada la invitó, además tenía la necesidad  de contar con un capital para emprender un negocio, en ese entonces, ella vendía comida pero con el pasar del tiempo decidió cambiar de negocio y hoy se dedica al tejido de mantas que le permite tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
In the Alto Lima Community Center you will find the Sartawisa Community Association, which has been in existence for approximately 14 years. Its members have different businesses like selling food, neighborhood store, clothing store, weaving blankets, cosmetic sales, and tending telephone booths. They all guarantee that they will use the loan to buy raw materials or more merchandise. Juana G. is one of the oldest members. She remembers joining the association 13 years ago when her sister-in-law invited her. She needed capital to start a business. She then started selling meals. With the passage of time, she decided to changes businesses. She now weaves blankets, which allows her to have greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material and or buy more merchandise

loans.name: Juana Natividad

texts.en:
Juana Natividad is from Urcos, a small community that is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, 50 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She is 23 years old and works with a local business that sells wristbands, leather goods, and textiles. Right now their main sales are in Plaza de Armas, the main square in Cusco. They also export goods to Spain, England and Germany.

Juana Natividad will use her loan to purchase more beige, white and brown leathers to make goods. She reports that these colors are in demand for exports to England right now.

Juana is a member of a 44-person lending group with Arariwa that receives financial training from a loan officer. She also participates in the group savings account. In the future she would like to have her own store because she and her business partners are currently renting.

loans.use: To purchase leathers to make goods.

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.en:
Rosa Beatriz is from Urcos, a small community that is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, 50 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She is 37 years old and has two children. During the week she sells lunches in the market. A typical pork dish with a soft drink costs 10 soles.

To supplement her income Rosa Beatriz also works on the weekends. On Sundays she sells chickens on the main square in Urcos. It costs her 1,500 soles to buy the chickens in bulk and she can sell around 20 on an average Sunday. She wants to increase sales by purchasing more chickens in bulk with her loan.

Rosa Beatriz is a member of a 44-person lending group with Arariwa that receives financial training from a loan officer. She also participates in the group savings account. In the future she would like to have her own chicken store.

loans.use: To buy more chickens in bulk to sell on the weekends

loans.name: Barbara's Group

texts.en: B. Barbara is a hardworking and friendly lady with a strong drive succeed in business and to live the best life with her family. Barbara is a married woman with a poultry business that she has owned for 5 years, keeping both broilers and layers near her home. As a result of her hard work and actively saving, she has been able to buy cows that also provide her with milk to sell, hence increasing her daily income. She sells the eggs to her customers in Kayunga and Jinja and, like the broilers, for meat. She is also a farmer, but on a smaller scale. She hopes to increase this aspect once she finds a much bigger chunk of land for agriculture. Barbara needs a loan to help with buying more chicken feed for her birds.

loans.use: Buying more chicken feed for poultry business.

loans.name: Ronald's Group

texts.en: N. Ronald is the leader of his lending group in Kisoga. He has been a businessman, selling produce, for over 10 years. He is a farmer and also buys other produce (like beans, cabbages, onions and tomatoes) to supplement the vegetable stock from his farm. As a result of making some profits, Ronald has been able to buy 2 cows and a bicycle. This helps to transport the produce from the villages, for sale. His market area is mainly in Kayunga, Jinja and Lugazi and he is happy about the trend since he is able to supply his customers. Ronald needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for sale.

loans.use: To buying more produce for sale.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is from Urcos, a small community that is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, 50 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She is 24 years old and sells bread in the Plaza de Armas, the main square in Urcos. She makes the bread every day at home, starting at 3 AM. She makes all types of bread, such as chuta (a typical Cusco specialty), and sells it for 5 soles a bag. On a typical day she can sell a quintal of bread, which is about 46 kg. 

Luz will use the loan to purchase sugar, butter, flour and other ingredients. Her goal is to buy a bread-making machine instead of having to use her oven. She is a member of a 44-person lending group with Asociación Arariwa that receives financial training from a loan officer, and also participates in the group savings account.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Suma Sartawi Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal “Suma Sartawi” tiene aproximadamente 3 años de vida, se encuentra en el Centro Focal “Los Andes”, su presidenta es Judith Agüero, quien indica que la Asociación se conformo con amigas que vivían en la misma zona, alrededor de una escuelita. “Suma Sartawi” esta conformada por 14 integrantes que tienen diferentes negocios como ser: tejido de mantas, venta de ropa, comida, juguetes, repuestos de celulares, zapatos, tienda de barrio y costura de deportivos. Todas manifiestan necesitar el préstamo, para incrementar su capital de trabajo y poder llegar a más mercados.
texts.en:
The Suma Sartawi Community Association has been in existence for approximately three years. The Association is located in the Los Andes Community Center. Their president is Judith Agüero. Judith says that the Association was formed by friends who live in the same zone close to a small school. Suma Sartawi is made up of 14 members who have different businesses like weaving blankets, selling clothes, selling meals, selling toys, replacement parts for cell phones, shoes, neighborhood store, and sewing sportswear. All of them need a loan for working capital to be able to go to more markets.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en: M. Joyce, 50, is the chairperson of her lending group in Kisoga. She is married, has 3 grown up children and cares for 8 grandchildren at home. She has a farming business, supplying fresh beans, potatoes, and cassava to schools. Payments for her produce are usually made each week. She also sells ladies clothing, mostly underwear, to offices, hospitals, schools, and private homes, thrice in a week. Joyce needs her portion of this group loan to buy more clothes for sale and to employ manpower to help collect the produce from the villages. She is a hardworking and devoted mother with a drive to continued success.

loans.use: Buying more produce and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan resides in Urcos, a small community that is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, 50 minutes away from the city of Cusco. He 34 years old and has two children with his common-law wife, Ana Cecilia.  Juan is a musician and driver. He plays the keyboard and leads a six-member band that performs at weddings, birthday parties and other events. When he isn’t performing, Juan uses his own car to provide a transportation service to Andahuailillas, a nearby town that is 5 minutes away. 

Juan wants to purchase a new sound system for his group with this loan. This has been the best source of income for his family.

Juan and Ana Cecilia want their children to study in the university and eventually have a professional career. Juan is a member of a 44-person lending group with Arariwa that receives financial training from a loan officer, and he also participates in the group savings account.

loans.use: to purchase a new sound system

loans.name: Kuña Aty Villa Universitaria Group

texts.en:
All of the women of the committee Kuña Aty Villa Universitaria are neighbors of the same area, where they have their own small businesses. The women help each other as a consolidated group.

The participants are proud of the help they have gotten from the Fundación Paraguaya. They have been able to increase their sales and the quantity of production, and through this their daily sales. They thank the Fundación for the constant support and they promise to continue working to grow as a committee with responsibility and honesty.

1 Mirian B. - small grocery store 2 Cynthia M. - cosmetics sales 3 Digna A. - clothing sales 4 Gladys O. - milk and egg sales 5 Ana D. 6 Cristeta L. - small grocery store 7 Mirta M. 8 Maria J. - dressmaker 9 Ana M. - raising & selling chickens 10 Casilda M. - raising & selling chickens and pigs 11 Celsa L. - cook, food sales 12 Veneranda M. - plant sales 13 Zulma V. - charcoal sales 14 Juliana F. - chicken & pig sales 15 Carmen M. - convenience store 16 Petrona M. - dressmaker, general store 17 Elida M. - small grocery store 18 Gerarda M. - chipa (local bread) sales 19 Ana Maria M. - fruit and vegetable sales

loans.use: To purchase merchandise or raw materials for sale.

loans.name: 6 De Julio Group

texts.en:
This group, from the San Pedro Cucupayty neighborhood, emerged through advertising meetings in the area. All of the women have their own respective businesses. Each woman uses the credit given to her to invest in her current activities. 

1.	Jiner A. B.  -  tailor shop 
2.	Nilda O. D. G.  -  food sales 
3.	Eliodora P. D. G.  -  small grocery store 
4.	Mariela Esther P. D. G.  -  cell phone sales 
5.	Olga Isabel R. D.  -  cosmetics sales 
6.	Hilda Aidee F. A.  -  raising & sale of chickens 
7.	Ramona Isabel L. B.  -  general store 
8.	Carmen Elizabeth A. D.  -  food sales 
9.	Marcela Leopoldina P. A.  -  dressmaker 
10.	Carmen Griselda G. F. 
11.	Angelina S.  -  food sales 
12.	Ofelia M.  -  chicken sales 
13.	Virginia T. Díaz  -  food sales 
14.	Johana O. Y.  -  handicraft sales 
15.	Gerónima O. G.  -  handicraft sales 
16.	Verónica Vanesa G. O.  -  cosmetics sales

loans.use: To purchase raw materials or merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo Beatriz C. Dávila, tiene 47 años de edad actualmente separada, con cinco hijos, tres aún dependientes de ella. 
Ella participa en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD desde hace dos años y un mes, ocupa el cargo de presidenta en la alcancía comunal “Las Solidarias”. Este ALCOM está conformado por once socios, quienes se dedican a la venta de comida, ropa, productos de belleza. Consuelo trabaja como vendedora de anticuchos desde los 35 años a raíz del abandono que sufrió de parte de su pareja conyugal, con este negocio toma la responsabilidad de mantener a sus hijos a los cuales les provee de los recursos necesarios. Es así que decide obtener un crédito con nuestra institución para incrementar su expectativa económica, lo que le permitió tener otro negocio más, como es la venta de productos de belleza; a fin de mantener y educar a cinco hijos. Con este préstamo Consuelo comprará mercadería de ropa, colchas que expenderá y le permitirá a futuro mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
La señora Consuelo Beatriz C. Dávila, tiene 47 años de edad actualmente separada, con cinco hijos, tres aún dependientes de ella. Ella participa en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD desde hace dos años y un mes, ocupa el cargo de presidenta en la alcancía comunal “Las Solidarias”. Este ALCOM está conformado por once socios, quienes se dedican a la venta de comida, ropa, productos de belleza. Consuelo trabaja como vendedora de anticuchos desde los 35 años a raíz del abandono que sufrió de parte de su pareja conyugal, con este negocio toma la responsabilidad de mantener a sus hijos a los cuales les provee de los recursos necesarios. Es así que decide obtener un crédito con nuestra institución para incrementar su expectativa económica, lo que le permitió tener otro negocio más, como es la venta de productos de belleza; a fin de mantener y educar a cinco hijos. Con este préstamo Consuelo comprará mercadería de ropa, colchas que expenderá y le permitirá a futuro mejorar su vivienda.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar productos

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.en:
This group in the neighborhood Chaipé was suggested by an established client of the Fundación Paraguaya.  All of the women have their own small businesses, and invest their loans in these activities. 

1.	Lady Mabel L. R.- Food sales 
2.	Hermelinda G.- Small grocery store 
3.	María Estela M. M.- Jewelry sales 
4.	Gabriela C. D. S.- Food sales 
5.	Cornelia G. D.- Meat sales 
6.	Norma Graciela S. D. L.- Food sales 
7.	Rosa Clara R. D. Faria- Small grocery store 
8.	Eufrocina S. G.- Food sales 
9.	Silvia Esther G. Martínez- Clothing sales 
10.	Noemí Candelaria V.- Food sales 
11.	Griselda Marlene S. S.- Food sales 
12.	Laura Haydee F. D. S.- Small grocery store 
13.	Sandra B. G.- Clothing sales 
14.	Juana M. S.- Tablecloth sales 
15.	María C. S.- Food sales 
16.	Crecencia R.- Food sales 
17.	María Maxima V.- Cosmetics sales 
18.	Cristina Mabel V.- Plastic sales 
19.	Antonia C. L.- Handicraft sales

loans.use: purchase of merchandise to sell or of raw materials

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar T. A. y su esposa la señora  Eva Luna tiene un hijo para el cual quieren lo mejor.
      A la vivienda le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor de ella pero por el momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora.
     Es por eso que están solicitando un crédito, ya que están preocupados cunado el niño sale a jugar no tiene seguridad. Planea pagar el préstamo con el ingreso que genera de su trabajo como chofer de un camión.
(En la foto aparece la esposa la señora Eva Luna ya que el señor Oscar T. se encuentra se encontraba en su trabajo).
texts.en:
Oscar T. A. and his wife, Eva Luna, have a son for whom they want the best. Their house needs a wall around it. They do not currently have the money to buy the material and pay a person to make the improvement. That is why they are asking for a loan. They worry when their son goes to play and they do not have security. They plan to repay the loan with the income generated from his work as a bus driver. (Eva Luna, Oscar T.’ wife, appears in the photo because he was working at the time the photo was taken.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around their house

loans.name: Graciela Antonia

texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela L. is 26 years old and lives with her mother in the San Pedro district of Encarnación.

Graciela and her husband own a restaurant where they make and distribute food. The majority of their clients are workers from the Yacyreta area. Her husband also works for the distributor of chicken K-Sero.

Through these activities Graciela and her husband can maintain a home and cover the living expenses that present themselves. They already have small children that depend on them economically.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients and make repairs at the restaurant.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres progresando
Gladys  es conviviente, tiene 47 años tiene  3 hijos de 20, 18 y 15 años él ultimo esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Gladis empezó su negocio con un pequeño capital y luego con finca aumento su capital, ella trabaja en una cafetería en un colegio vende Sándwich de 7am hasta  3 de la  tarde, después se va a trabajar a un mercado allí tiene un puesto de bazar  y zapatería, gracias a Finca a podido  lograr muchas cosas  
Desde que Gladys esta en Finca se siente muy respaldada por el apoyo que le brinda a través de los prestamos por que ha crecido en el negocio.  
Gladys  necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles para surtir su bazar, librería-mercería zapatería.
El sueño de Gladis es tener unos carros para dar  servicio de taxi
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Progresando.” She lives with her partner, is 47 years old, and has three children ages: 20, 18, and 15. Her youngest is a student in the state school. Gladys started her business with a just a little bit of capital and increased the amount with Finca's help. She works in a high school cafeteria selling sandwiches from 7:00 am until three in the afternoon. She then works in a market where she has a variety and shoe store. She has been able to achieve much with Finca’s support. Since Gladys has been with Finca, she has felt supported by the loans they give her and has grown her business. She needs a loan of 1,400 soles to stock her combination variety-book-shoe store. Gladys dreams of having some cars to start a taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: surtir su bazar, librería-mercería zapatería

loans.name: Blanca Obdulia

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92756&_tpos=6&_tpg=1
Blanca es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Blanca empezó vendiendo abarrotes pero no había mucho movimiento y fracaso decidió vender  plátanos, ha ido creciendo hoy en día vende fruta de primera calidad. 
Blanca necesita 2400 soles, para la compra de frutas de la estación y golosinas.
Desde que está en Finca, gracias a los préstamos pudo invertir y salir de las deudas que tenia.  
El sueño de Blanca es surgir y avanzar hasta completar sus sueños, que sus hijos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92756&_tpos=6&_tpg=1 Blanca is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Progresando.” She started out selling groceries but wasn't selling much and went out of business. She then decided to sell plantains and is growing this business. Today she sells high quality fruit. Blanca needs a loan of 2,400 soles to buy fruits that are in season and sweets. Since Blanca has been with Finca, she has been able to invest and get out of debt. Her dream is to forge ahead and keep advancing until she reaches her all of her dreams and sees her children go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de frutas de la estación y golosinas

loans.name: Filiberto

texts.es:
Filiberto es casado tiene 62 años  tres hijos de 34, 32 y 17 años que esta terminando sus estudios en la escuela estatal.
Filiberto estudio tecnología educativa y aprendió hacer materiales didácticos juegos lúdicos  para los escolares, le gustaba y vio que era rentable y se dedico a  vender Juegos lúdicos y vende libros.  
Desde que Filiberto esta en Finca aprendió a ser puntual, por que el es un trabajador independiente, y no tiene horario  fijo.  
Filiberto necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de material educativo, libros de psicología y terapia
El sueño de Filiberto es poder distribuir material didáctico en el ámbito nacional.
texts.en:
Filiberto is married, 62 years old, and the father of three children ages: 34, 32, and 17. His 17 year old is finishing up his high school studies. Filiberto studied pedagogy and learned how to create fun, educational games for school children. He liked doing this and saw that it was profitable, so he began to sell diversionary games and books. Since Filiberto has been with Finca, he has learned to be on time because working for himself he does not have a regular schedule. Filiberto needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy educational materials, and books on psychology and therapy. His dream is to be able to distribute his educational materials on a national level.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ra de material educativo, libros de psicología y terapia

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Margarita Z. y su esposo el señor José Lopez tienen tres hijos para los cuales quieren lo mejor.
   A la vivienda le está haciendo falta la barda al frente de la casa pero en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para la comprar el material ya que su esposo se encargara de la construcción.
   Están solicitando el préstamo ya que están preocupados por la seguridad de los niños cuando salen a jugar. Su ingreso proviene del negocio que tiene de tapicería de muebles.
texts.en:
Ms. Sandra Margarita Z. and her husband, Mr. José Lopez, have three children to whom the want to give the best.

Their house needs a front protective wall, but at this time, they do not have the money necessary to purchase the materials for her husband to build it.

They are requesting this loan because they are worried about their children’s safety when they go out to play. Their income stems from a furniture upholstery business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a protective wall in front of her house

loans.name: Zenelia Elvira

texts.es: La Señora Zenelia Elvira B. M. tiene la edad de 45 años. Zenelia tiene la actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. La ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación. Zenelia viaja ocasionalmente a ciertos departamentos en busca de que el precio de los productos se encuentre más favorable. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios no fueron muy fáciles porque tenia que recorrer muchos lugares ofreciendo los productos que sus clientes le solicitaban, y así fue que su clientela fue creciendo por el cumplimiento de sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de electrodomésticos, perfumes, cosméticos y bolsos. El sueño de Zenelia es que logre tener el financiamiento para la compra de sus productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Zenelia Elvira B. M. is a 45-year-old woman who sells general merchandise for a living. Her business is located in her place of residence. Zenelia occasionally travels to certain departments in her country in search of goods at reasonable prices. She has been in business for over 10 years. She had difficult beginnings because she had to travel to many different places to sell the products that her customers requested. Because she followed through with the orders, her clientele grew steadily. The loan that she is currently requesting will be used to purchase home appliances, perfume, cosmetics, and handbags. Zenelia dreams of getting a loan to purchase all the products that her customers need.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La señora Cirila  G. vive en una casa prestada junto con su esposo y su hijo.
Como desea tener su propia vivienda es por eso que está tramitando una casa por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental), pero el valor de la vivienda es superior al crédito que ella pueda recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo.
   Ella trabaja como empleada en una fábrica y su esposo el señor Benigno Salvador, como ayudante de construcción estos son los Ingres de la familia. Por tal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para completar el crédito Gubernamental ya así adquirir su casa. Ya que desea tener un patrimonio seguro para su familia.
(La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposo el  señor Benigno Salvador ya que la señora Cirila G. se encontraba en su trabajo)
texts.en:
Ms. Cirila G., her husband, and son live in a rented house. Because she wishes to have her own house, she is in the process of obtaining one through Infonavit (a federal housing loan program in Mexico). However, the value of the house supersedes the amount of the loan that she qualifies for because of her low income status.

She works in a factory, and her husband, Mr. Benigno Salvador, is a construction assistant; these are the family’s two sources of income. For this reason, she is requesting this loan so that she can cover what the government loan will not, thus she can purchase the house. She would like to have a house to leave as an inheritance for her family.

(The person appearing in the photo is her husband, Mr. Benigno Salvador, because Ms. Cirila G. was working at the time the photo was taken).

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Give the remainder of the house down payment not covered by a government loan

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisca Jeronima

texts.es: Francisca Jerónima López R. tiene la edad de 36 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Tiene la actividad económica de la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. Francisca inicio este negocio por necesidad y deseos de superación, cuando empezó solamente vendía mangos, naranjas y melones todos los días se levanta temprano para ir al mercado y vender sus frutas además recorre mucho lugares para ofrecer sus productos a diferentes clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de naranjas, tomates, cebollas y aguacates. Los sueños de Francisca son de que la salud de su Mama mejore ya que para ella so es lo mas importante.
texts.en:
Francisca Jerónima López R. is 36 years old and cares for two children. For over 16 years, she has sold fruits and vegetables. Francisca started this business out of necessity and a desire to overcome adversity. When she started she only sold mangoes, oranges, and melons. She gets up early to go to the market and sell her fruit, going all over town to offer her products to different customers. Her dream is for her mother's health to improve; this is the most important thing in Francisca's life. The loan Francisca needs will go to the purchase of oranges, tomatoes, onions and avocados.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Socorro De Los Santos

texts.es: Socorro de los Santos R. P. tiene la edad de 54 años, tiene 5 hijos y solo 2 de sus hijos están a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella da inicio a este oficio por la necesidad que tenia  de ofrecerles a sus hijos el pan de cada día, Socorro ofreció sus productos a ciertos vecinos, mas tarde por medio de la recomendación de algunas amigas decide ofrecer los productos en algunas oficinas, es aquí donde se da cuenta que este negocio es muy rentable y decide salir adelante con el. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, cremas y perfumes. El sueño de Socorro es establecerse en determinado lugar para obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Socorro de los Santos R. P. is 54 years old; she has five sons, though she only cares for two of them. For over four years she has sold general merchandise. She began her business out of the need to feed her children. Socorro sold her products to certain neighbors, but later, upon the recommendation of some friends, she decided to sell her products in various offices. She then realized that her business could be very profitable and decided to continue developing it. Socorro's dream is to one day have a permanent establishment in order to gain customers. This loan will help Socorro purchase merchandise; specifically, nail polishes, lipsticks, creams and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty supplies for her business

loans.name: Carlos Emilio

texts.es: El Joven Carlos Emilio R. Cadenas tiene 29 años de edad. Es un hombre soltero. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y estudia. La actividad económica de Carlos es brindar el servicio de auto lavado. Primeramente Carlos se dedicaba a lavar furgones, en lo que trabajo por mucho tiempo aquí tenía que aguantar sol y el inmenso calor estas condiciones no hicieron que Carlos perdiera su entusiasmo, por lo que más tarde debido a un cambio en la administración de su lugar de trabajo fue entonces que se quedo sin trabajo, por lo que decidió establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda al inicio no tenia muchos clientes pero por el buen servicio de Carlos tiene muchos clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de aspiradora, barriles para almacenar agua y toallas. El sueño de Carlos es que su negocio obtenga las mejoras necesarias para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos Emilio R. Cadenas is 29 years old. He is the single father of one school-age son. Carlos runs a car wash. He used to work washing vans, spending many hours enduring the sun and the heat. These conditions did not dampen Carlos' enthusiasm, and later on he lost his job due to a change in administration. He then decided to start his own business in his home. He started off with few clients but now has many thanks to his good service. Carlos' goal is that his business improves enough to fully serve his customers. This loan will contribute to the purchase of a vacuum, towels, and barrels for storing water.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of necessary supplies for his car wash business

loans.name: Gema Daly

texts.es: La Joven Gema Daly V. Flete tiene la edad de 24 años, es una mujer casada. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada. A pesar de su corta edad Gema es la única que aporta ayuda para su hogar. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio pero es importante resaltar que su negocio nació con la idea de sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que su negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda ya que si establecía su negocio en el mercado tendría que pagar la renta y no tenia el capital suficiente, es por eso que todos los días carga su bolsa en donde contiene la ropa a ofrecer. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa usada como pantalones, camisas, faldas y calzado. El deseo de Gema es obtener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
The young Gema Daly V. Flete is 24 years old and a married woman. Her economic activity is selling used clothes. Despite her young age, Gema is the only one that provides economic help for her household. She has been dedicated to this business for three years now, but it is important to emphasize that the business was born with the idea of improving her family's lifestyle, which is why her business is located in her home, because if she established her business in the market she would have to pay rent and she didn't have sufficient capital. This is why every day she loads and carries her bag that contains clothing for sale. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital for purchasing used clothing like pants, shirts, dresses, and shoes. Gema's desire is to obtain better earnings for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Luis Enrique R. vive en una casa prestada como es soltero y pronto se casara. Desea tener su propia vivienda es por eso que decido tramitar un casa por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental), pero el valor de la vivienda es superior al crédito que el puede recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo. 
   Por ello está solicitando un préstamo para completar el valor de la vivienda y obtener así la casa que será para su futura familia.
El trabaja en una compañía de trasportes en el departamento de almacén es su ingreso y con el cual pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Enrique R. lives in a leased home as a single and he is soon going to get married. He wants to have his own home, which is why he decided to attain a home through Infonavit (Government Creditor), but the cost of a house is greater than the credit that he can receive due to his low salary. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to meet the cost of the house and obtain a home in this way that will be for his future family. Working for a transportation company in the warehouse department provides his income, which he will use to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Difference in the deposit needed to acquire a home through Infonavit

loans.name: Arlen Ydania

texts.es: Arlen Ydania C. Hernández tiene 28 años de edad. Es una mujer casada. La actividad económica de Arlen es la venta de ropa nueva. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Arlen es profesora, pero debido a su difícil situación tuvo que dedicarse a la venta de ropa, la cual ofrece en su lugar de trabajo a sus compañeros, los fines de semana Arlen sale muy temprano a recorrer muchos lugares para  vender su productos nuevos clientes, Arlen es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada en su trabajo. Es por eso que este financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa pantalones, calzado y shorts. Su  deseo es establecerse en lugar en donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Arlen Ydania C. Hernández is 28 years old. She is a married woman. Arlen's job is selling new clothes. She decided to go into this business five years ago. Arlen is a teacher, but due to her difficult situation she had to dedicate herself to clothing sales, which she sells to her co-workers at work.
