On weekends, Arlen leaves very early to travel to many places to sell her products to new clients. Arlen is a very responsible woman and dedicated to her job. This is why the loan that she is requesting is for working capital to purchase clothes like pants, shoes, and shorts. Her desire is to establish a place where she can offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rosa Adelaida

texts.es: La Señora Rosa Adelaida tiene la edad de 43 años, es madre soltera. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de costura. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Rosa dio inicio a su negocio por sus padres ya que ellos le brindaron la educación para que estudiara cursos de costura, a Rosa le gusto mucho este oficio y su Mama le compro una maquina de coser para que ella trabajara en su hogar, es así que Rosa decide establecer este medio de vida en su hogar, su primer trabajo fue elaborar un vestido a una de sus vecinas y fue por ella que consiguió la fama para au trabajo se reconociera. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de agujas, hilos, tijeras y telas para cortinas. El sueño de Rosa es que su trabajo sea el mejor y establecer una tienda con prendas elaboradas por ella misma.
texts.en:
Rosa Adelaida is 43 years old and a single mother. She earns a living as a tailor and has been doing so for 10 years. Rosa started this business with the help of her parents, who provided her with an education so that she could take sewing courses. Rosa really liked this type of a work and her mother bought her a sewing machine so that she could work at home. This is how Rosa decided to start to work in her home. Her first task was to decorate one of her neighbors' dresses and she thus became famous for her work. The loan she seeks is for working capital to buy needles, threads, scissors and materials for curtains. Rosa's dreams is for her work to be the best and to start her own store of manufactured garments.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sergio José

texts.es: El Señor Sergio José O. tiene la edad de 36 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de barbería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio surge por sugerencias de amigos porque desde la edad de 20 años Sergio sabía perfectamente cortar pelo y al ver que lo hacia muy bien decide establecer su propia barbería, esta ubicada en el sector de la terminal de buses. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de cepillo de barba, tijeras, navajas y rasuradoras. El sueño de Sergio es proporcionarle a su establecimiento mejoras de espacio para brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Señor Sergio José O. is 36 years old, married and has two children under his care. His economic activity is providing barber services. He's been engaged in this business for more than six years. His business came into being as a result of his friends' suggestions because ever since he was 20 years old, Sergio knew perfectly how to cut hair. And seeing as how he could do it very well, he decided to establish his own barbershop, which is located in the vicinity of the bus terminal. The loan is intended as working capital for the purchase of a barber's brush, scissors, razors and electric shavers. Sergio's dream is to provide himself with a more spacious establishment in order to provide his customers with better service.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: José Hedi

texts.es:
José Hedi M. V. tiene dos hijos pero una de ellas va  a cumplir quince años, la muchacha le pidió a su papa que fuera en el patio de su casa ya que es ahí donde ella creció y vivió una infancia muy bonita. José quiere darle la sorpresa a su hija arreglando el piso y alrededor de ese lugar para que la quinceañera de la muchacha quede muy bonita que en compañía de su familia como amistades se lleven una buena impresión del lugar pero sobre todo ver la felicidad de la quinceañera.
El señor es pensionado ya que por muchos años fue maestro pero ahora recibe su dinero cada mes, su esposa le ayuda en la venta de ropa usada en las pulgas de la ciudad.
El crédito lo utilizara para compra de material de construcción como cemento varilla, grava, pintura y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
José Hedi M. V. has two children. His daughter is going to turn 15 soon and asked her father to hold her birthday party in the patio of their house, since that's where she grew up and enjoyed a lovely childhood. José wants to surprise his daughter by repairing the patio floor and fixing up the walls so that his daughter's quinceañera will be a beautiful celebration. He wants his family and friends to come away with a good impression of the place but most of all wants the quinceañera to be a happy one. José is retired. He was a teacher for many years but now receives a pension every month. His wife helps him by selling secondhand clothing in the local flea markets. He will use the requested loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, rods, gravel, and paint, and to hire workers.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl Terán M. esta agradecido con el crédito que se le otorgo en esta institución a el le ayudo tanto que ahora quiere otro. El proyecto que el tiene es remodelar el interior de su casa, como pintar y resanar las paredes de las recamaras por que están tan deterioradas que no se ven bien. Esto lo quiere hacer para que sus hijos vivan en un lugar bonito y acogedor donde la familia pueda convivir. Comenta el mismo que esta tan contento de formar parte de esto por que lo esta beneficiando para la mejora de su vivienda.
El señor es chofer de una compañía que presta servicio a maquiladoras para transportar a sus empleados.
texts.en:
Raúl Terán M. is grateful for the prior loan this institution offered him. The loan was so helpful to him that he is now requesting another. He wishes to remodel the interior of his house, repairing and painting the bedroom walls because they are deteriorated and don't look good. He wants to do this so that his children will be able to live in a beautiful, comfortable place with their family. He says that he is happy to be part of this because it is helping him improve his home. Raúl is a driver for a company that is contracted by the maquiladoras to transport their employees.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita F. makes a living primarily from making and selling meals and delicacies in the market. She is 53 years old, married and has four adult children. She is from the village of Labo, Ozamiz City. Leonita has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2005, Leonita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to cook meals. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business and to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to cook meals

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita C. makes a living primarily from planting and harvesting bananas to sell. She is 56 years old, married and has five adult children. She is from the village of Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Juanita has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Juanita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business and to support her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a business raising crops

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina D. is from the village of Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Celerina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Celerina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Celerina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Celerina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celerina has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Celerina is requesting a new loan of 19500 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Celerina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. sells chicken chicharon and other fried chicken parts in the MOGCHS school canteen. Her customers are students of the school. Fried chicken parts are very tasty and that is why her products are in great demand. Marilyn is 31 years old, married and has one school-age child. She is from the village of Gusa, Cagayan de Oro City. Marilyn has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a food business

location.town: Gusa, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Giovanne

texts.en:
Giovanne T. sells soft drinks and other beverages in the MOGCHS school canteen. He is 29 years old, separated from his spouse and has two school-age children. He is from the village of Gusa, Cagayan de Oro City. Giovanne has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Giovanne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Giovanne is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of his children and provide for the needs of his family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a food business

location.town: Gusa, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena C. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Nena is married and has two school-aged children. Nena runs a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nena joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell to expand her product offering. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Nena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell to expand her product offering

loans.name: Pacencio

texts.en:
Pacencio S. wants to put up a mini variety store in his village to cater to all the needs of his fellow villagers. He is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. Pacencio is 55 years old, married and has four adult children.

In 2009, Pacencio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Pacencio is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of his family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris sells foodstuffs, cooking oil and drinks. She has been in business for the past 10 years to assist her husband with their children's upbringing. Doris has been borrowing from LAPO, a Kiva partner, for the past three years and is a faithful client. 

She goes to Cotonu once every two weeks to get goods in large quantities at a discount. She needs a loan of N160,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, which will enable her to meet customer demand. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly manages a vegetable-vending stall in her village. She is requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional working capital to make her vending more progressive. Beverly has two children, EJ and Lyra Mona. She is married to Edgar S., a simple farmer. Their major source of income comes from farming. Her dream in relation to the loan requested is to use it for the growth of her business to increase her daily income and support her children's educational needs.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Famodu

texts.en: B. styles hair and sells hair styling items. She opened her shop seven years ago after training for two years. She needs a loan of N70,000 to purchase a dryer and hair extensions to sell. B. is 31 years old. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase a dryer and hair extensions

loans.name: Sholade

texts.en: O. is a photographer. She covers events and occasions and has been in business for over ten years. She also supplies school sandals to schools on request. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more school sandals to sell. O. is 40 years old, married and has a child. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase school sandals to sell

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en: Filipina is a very patient woman who is still single at age 37. She works as a Day Care teacher in their village and her little salary comes from the village fund. To have extra income, Filipina ventured into the hog raising business. To contribute is a big help for her family, especially since she is the only child whom her parents depend on. She is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders to have enough financial support to supply the daily food for her hogs. She wants to give her parents a prosperous life and somehow be able to uplift them from their poor living situation.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. operates a general store in her village at Barangay San Jose Norte 1 in Mallig, Isabela. Her daily income in the business allows her to finance the needs of her family, especially for the education of her children. She was blessed with two children. Gloria shared that her eldest child already is studying in college and that really turns her on to work harder because sending her child to college is very costly. 

Gloria is requesting from KIVA the amount of PHP5,000 as additional business capital for her store. This will allow her to improve her business and earn a higher income to fulfill her family needs and support the education of her children. Gloria serves as both a mother and father to her children. It is really hard, she said and she really is bringing out her best to become a successful parent to them. She hopes that KIVA will be her very good partner in fulfilling all her goals in life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Oyewole

texts.en: H. is 35 years old, married and has three children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in business for five years. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is a dedicated LAPO client and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny M. is requesting PHP7,000 as additional working capital for her buy and sell slippers business. She is 29 years old and very much dedicated to her chosen business. She also manages to raise pigs aside from her buy and sell business. She hopes that the loan she plans to borrow will be a big help towards the development of her business in the future. Jenny is married to Bryan M. who works as a casual government employee in their town. They are blessed with two children: Melchie and Shaia Renzo. Jenny dreams of having her business stall someday in their town proper and becoming successful in her business endeavor.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is married to Samuel P. and they are blessed with two children: Samenly and Snyki. Samenly is a pharmacist in a mercury drug business in Roxas, Isabela while Snyki operates a gown rental business. The gowns are personally designed. Lilia on the other hand manages a general store and sells school supplies. Lilia is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP5,000 as additional working capital for her business. Her dream is to become a successful business operator someday and have a sustainable business to support her family's needs, including their health.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Sesawi A1 Group

texts.en:
Sesawi A1 is a group of eight people in Usapi Sonbai Village, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. Usapi Sonbai Village is situated about 29 Km from Kupang City. The community in this area leans on the agricultural sector to support their family lives. The main income comes from selling agricultural products such as bananas, coconuts and corn. There is no local market in this area, so the community has to get into the Inpres Market in Kupang City.

Sesawi A1 is led by Sem T., 32 years old. He is a married man. His marriage has been blessed with three children. The children are: Reman, 8 years old, in the 2nd grade of elementary school; Rali, 6 years old and Alfin, 2 months and not at school yet. 

To meet his family's needs, Sem leans on the crops (coconut and cucumber). But usually, the income generated from selling the crops cannot cover all of their needs. He also has several goats that can be sold in an emergency.  Living as a farmer in a remote area really becomes a challenge for Sem. Lack of capital becomes the main issue for him to improve his living standard. This situation motivated Sem to join the TLM cattle-fattening program with a hope for a better future. His experience in raising goats for two years has given him the self confidence to join the program. Sem is requesting a loan of IDR 3,300,000 from TLM to buy young cattle to fatten in 12 months. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his living standard. The other group members also have the same dream as Sem – a dream to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Sesawi A2 Group

texts.en:
Yosia B. is 31 years old. He leads a group of eight farmers - Sesawi A2 - in Usapi Sonbai Village, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. It takes about one and a half hours to drive from Kupang City. 

Yosia is married and has two children named Yesika, 7 years old - in the 2nd grade of Elementary School and Riksa 3 years old - not at school yet. Yosia is living his life farming in Usapi Sonbai Village. He leans on the crops to generate money in order to fulfill his family's needs. He plants corn that can be sold in the market and also can be consumed by his family. But the income generated from selling corn is unstable, depending on the season. And it usually cannot fully cover his family's needs. 
The difficulty in meeting his family's needs leads Yosia to find another way to better meet his family's needs. This is the reason for Yosia’s involvement in TLM Cattle Fattening Program. He hopes that by joining this program, he will be able to get a big profit after selling the fattened cattle. 
He is requesting a loan of IDR 3,300,000 from TLM to buy young cattle to be fattened over a 12-month period. The other members of Sesawi A2 are also requesting loans to buy cattle to be fattened.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Sesawi B1 Group

texts.en:
Oktofianus T. is a 35 year old man. He leads SESAWI B1 Group - a group of 8 farmers in Usapi Sonbai Village, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. Oktofianus has been living in this village since he was a child. His parents are only poor farmers who couldn’t afford to send him to the high school. As a result, Oktofianus only has a primary education. 

Oktofianus is a married man with one child aged 10 months. Due to the low level of education that Oktofianus has, he can not get a better permanent job in the city. This is the reason why Oktofianus works as a farmer who plants corn, peanuts and vegetables to pay for his family's needs. The biggest challenge for Oktofianus is the increasing of prices in the market that makes it difficult for him to support his family. His income generated from farming is not enough to cover all of his family's needs. 

The difficulties that Oktofianus faces have motivated him to find another way to support his family. One of the alternatives that has become his preference is to fatten cattle because of the high demand and good price for the fattened cattle. To fatten cattle Oktofianus needs capital to buy the young cattle and he can not afford it as a poor farmer. 

This is the reason why Oktofianus is interested in joining the cattle fattening program with the other group members. He is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,200,000 to buy young cattle to be fattened for 12 months. Oktofianus hopes that through the cattle fattening program he will be able to cover all of his family needs. The other group members are also requesting a loan as they want to improve their living standard. 
Note: When the group picture was taken, Erny and Fransina were replaced by their family member.

loans.use: To buy cattle to fatten

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cattle to fatten

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is helping her husband to generate income so that they can survive their battle against poverty. Her husband manages a tricycle transport business and she is seeking funds for the maintenance of their motorcycle to continue its daily transport operation. Lydia is requesting to borrow the amount of PHP 4,000 for the motorcycle parts needed and some repairs. Sometimes, Lydia also sells different goods in their village to earn income for their basic necessities. 

Lydia is married to Rodolfo M.. They has five children, some of whom are already studying. She hopes that all of them will able to acquire an education someday, and that is why Lydia and husband work very hard for the fulfillment of their dreams in life - especially for the sake of their children.

loans.use: To repair a motorcycle

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita manages a general store business in their simple village in San Rafael, in the municipality of Roxas, Isabela. She has three children.  Nenita says that she will work hard in order to give a better quality life to her family.  

Nenita is hoping for her business to grow through the support of KIVA lenders. She is borrowing the amount of PHP10,000 as additional working capital for her store. With this loan she plans to make her business more progressive by investing in different merchandise and commodities to sell in her store. With her daily profit, Nenita will then able to finance the daily expenses of her children in school. Nenita struggles a lot for the progress of her family's lives and is hoping to continue to provide for the education of her children until college so that they will have better living opportunities in the future.

loans.use: To expand the range of products sold in her store

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 34 years old. She is married to Eduardo who works as a construction worker. They both work hard to improve their standard of living for the benefit of their children. They have been blessed with three children: Norwyn, Eduardo and Darwin. Two are in their high school studies and the youngest is already in the elementary level. 

Noralyn hopes to expand her business for the growing needs of her family. This is why she asks for a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP20,000. She intends to use this to make further improvements to her business. Noralyn knows that having enough financial support will enable her to pursue her business and also strive for better livelihood opportunities through patience and hard work.

loans.use: To make improvements to her store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is the mother of four who believes that poverty is not a hindrance to success. Thus, she is doing her best in sending all her children to school, for them to have good job opportunities someday.

Because of a lack of financial resources, Rosalina is borrowing PHP 7,000 to further sustain her hog-raising business in their village at Bimonton Mallig, Isabela. She has a strong determination to become successful in all her plans in life and she did it by having three of her children graduated from their college courses so that she now only supports the education of her youngest child.

Rosalina’s husband, Warlito, is grateful for having her as his wife and they are helping each other in reaching out for their family success.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina V. is 37 years old. She lives in Barangay Bimonton of Mallig, Isabela. She is married to Villamor, who is 41 years old. In the village, she manages a general store and a hog-raising business.

Salina is asking the support of Kiva lenders to further improve her two businesses so that she is able to give her four children a prosperous living. She is requesting to borrow the amount of PHP5, 000 as additional capital. Salina says that she will utilize the loan wisely so that her business will be blessed more.

loans.use: To use as business capital for her general store and to raise hogs.

loans.name: Beveline

texts.en:
Beveline R. is from the village of San Roque, Iligan City. She is 37 years old and married with seven school-aged children. To make a living, Beveline owns and operates a specialized retail store selling variety products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste , milk, and coffee. Beveline has been engaged in her business for over three years in the local community and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Beveline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to invest in expanding the business. She is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 7th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and support her children's education.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: San Roque, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Sheryll

texts.en:
Sheryll M. operates a humble vending stall in the village of Barangay Bimonton of Mallig, Isabela. She is 29 years old and a single parent. She was blessed with a little angel named Sharie Mae, now in kindergarten. Sheryll earns a living by selling vegetables, fish, and meats in her vending stall. She also sells barbecue to earn additional income.

Her dream is to grow her business for her daughter's future. She knows that the business is the only way to support the needs of her daughter. She is glad that her parents also support her and give moral support.

Sheryll is now requesting to borrow a loan in the amount of PHP8, 000 to use as additional working capital for her vending business. She would like to expand her vending stall further and sells various kinds of vegetables.

loans.use: To expand her vending stall.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan D. G. enjoys managing her food vending and small eatery business in the village at San Jose Norte 1 of Mallig, Isabela. She is living happily with her family and continues dreaming that someday she will become a successful entrepreneur through her hard work and initiative. She also sells different snacks. She loves what she is doing because it gives her resources that her family needs to survive.

To further develop her business, Susan is requesting PHP 4,000 as an initial loan from Kiva. This is her step in developing a partnership with them.

Susan is married to Noel, who raises pigs. They were blessed with three children. Two of them are already working: one in Singapore as a domestic helper and one in Manila as a parlor shop employee. The youngest is still studying in college. Susan prays for the success of her children so that they will have a better livelihood when they will have their own families someday.

loans.use: To expand her food vending business.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa S. is a vendor of different products, such as vegetables, meat, and fish. She also sells different snacks. She sells everyday in order to generate a better income. However, she still needs financial support to further improve her vending and she hopes to have her own stall. Thus, she is requesting to borrow PHP 4,000 to use as additional business capital.

Vanessa is married to a tricycle operator in their village. They help each other save for the future of their children. They live peacefully and happily despite of the difficulty of life. Vanessa dreams of sending her two children to school for their future and improving their living situation through her proper business management.

loans.use: To expand her food vending business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M. raises hogs. She is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders for PHP 6,000 to sustain the daily feed supply of her hogs.

Virginia is married to Hilario, who is a farmer. She is already 48 years old and has three children in high school. She hopes to send them to college to earn a degree and have a decent job in the future.

Virginia tries her best to assist her husband in providing for their family's basic needs and children’s education. Virginia shared that, “Poverty is not a hindrance to success. We have many options in life and it’s up to us to choose the right one."

loans.use: To purchase hog feed.

loans.name: Divine

texts.en:
Divine E. is from the village of GK, Santiago, Iligan, City. She is 33 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Divine owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Divine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the food she sells. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make the food she sells.

location.town: GK, Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha has a business vending different kinds of vegetables in her rural village of San Jose Norte 1 in Mallig, Isabela. She roams to every house in the village to sell her products. She is thankful that she can support her family and help her husband with this simple business. She has four children, who all attend either college or high school. She does her best to generate more income to meet her family's immediate needs.

Editha is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 5,000 to expand her business. She is hoping that Kiva will extend their assistance to help her improve her business and invest in hog raising as another source of income.

loans.use: To expand her business selling vegetables and invest in a new business rasing hogs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth S. is from the village of Paitan , Dalipuga , Iligan City. She is 52 years old and married and with four adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a specialized retail store in her village. She sells variety products, such as canned goods, coffee, softdrinks, biscuits, and many others items. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Paitan, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia runs a tailoring shop and a general store. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders for PHP 10,000 to use as additional working capital for both her businesses.

Her four children have already finished degree and non-degree courses. One is in Hong Kong working as domestic helper. Eufemia hopes to make her business become progressive without depending on her children’s support. She believes that she is still strong and able to do beneficial things for her family's future.

loans.use: To expand both her tailoring business and her general store.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda J. is from the village of Paitan, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 49 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Melinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, primarily selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Melinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Paitan, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Vegetable vending is the business managed by Florentina N. of Barangay San Jose Norte 1 of Mallig, Isabela. Florentina is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Her youngest child is the only one who continued her education. Her older two children are both working in Manila at the moment and assist her with some of the needs at home.

Florentina is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional working capital for her vegetable-vending business. She is thankful that she has her vending stall in front of her house so that she does not have to roam from one house to another to sell her produce. She hopes that her business will grow further and become productive in the future through patience and the financial support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Blyth

texts.en: Blyth L. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 30 years old, single, and has four school-aged children. Blyth owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Blyth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Honeylyn

texts.en: Honeylyn P. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 37 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Honeylyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, primarily selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Honeylyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Honeylyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is engaged in a gasoline and cell-phone load retailing business. Her business is very in demand in their village but she lacks enough capital in order to meet her desired income. This is the reason why she is asking to borrow PHP 4,000 from Kiva as additional capital to further improve her business.

Jovita’s husband, George, is managing a farming business that supports their major family necessities. Jovita dreams that someday, they will able to support the education of their two children till they finish college.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 29 years old and married to Bonifacio.They are blessed with three children. Ligaya is a God-fearing person and also teaches her children the words of God.

Ligaya manages a little vending stall in their village selling snacks and some vegetables. She is borrowing PHP 4,000 as additional business capital. This will make her business progressive in the coming days as she generates funds for the education of her three children. Ligaya also wants their living situation to someday be alleviated from poverty and she believes that the lenders will play a big role in achieving her dreams in life.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma M. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 39 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Alma owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, primarily selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma E. is a 48 year old woman from the village of Kiwalan.  She is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children.  Norma makes a living by operating her own food stall in the local community, selling a variety of food products.  She has been doing this for over 26 years.  It is her main source of income and she now earns approximately 3000 PHP per month in sales.

Norma joined HSPFI in 2009 in order to improve her living situation and her business capabilities.  She is requesting  a first loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI, which she intends to use for expansion of her food stall.  She plans to use future profits on improvements and the further expansion of her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao by offering them access to financial services.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Business expansion

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Elioba

texts.en:
Elioba is 29 years old and is married to a driver. She has five children who are all in school. Elioba sells charcoal, and is requesting a loan to build a store for this activity. With the profits generated from her business, Elioba hopes to buy a lorry truck for transporting charcoal to her store.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which targets returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a charcoal store

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en: Maxima M. is a widow who has been able to send her children to school with the profits she has made from her business of selling vegetables. She sells the vegetables, including beans from her own garden, in her village. She also sometimes sells "carabao" millk, "pnipig" and "soya" milk. Maxima is now asking Kiva lenders to support her most recent request for a loan of 7000 PHP to develop her business. She believes that this amount will greatly help to develop her business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Saida J. is 22 years old and is married with a husband who is a farmer. She has four children and her children go to school. Saida is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 51 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Elizabeth operates a family member's business providing a recreational place for the people of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She manages a beach resort in their village and has been engaged in her business for over a year, earning approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married to Loreto R.. They have three children: Loreto Rivea Jr., Christian and Lea.

The couple is helping each other in their vending business, selling puto (native cake) and dirty ice cream (home made ice cream that's sold by street vendors from carts) in their village at Barangay San Jose Norte 1 of Mallig, Isabela. In the morning, her husband sells hot “pandesal” (bread) and in the afternoon, they sell ice cream and puto for snacks.

Rosa wants their business grow so that, someday, they will able to save to have a better living. She hopes that she can obtain additional business capital of at least PHP 4,000 for their business to grow. Her dream someday is to have a stable business to continuously send her children to school until they finish college.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en: Sebastiana G. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 54 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Sebastiana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, primarily selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Sebastiana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Dadi

texts.en:
Dadi C. is currently in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour. Dadi is 42 years old and is married to a mechanic. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up two bakeries.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda S. is proposing to borrow PHP5,000 from KIVA as additional working capital for her vinegar-making business. She makes the product on her own and earns income from her manufacturing activity. She wants the business to grow because she believes it is a good business to develop in their village because vinegar is part of the daily commodities needed for cooking food. Her vinegar is being distributed to stores in their village and packaged in bottles. 

Rosalinda works hard for the education of her four children, and her husband Rudy is her patient supporter and helper in doing their business well. Three children deliver their finished products during weekends. The family helps each other for the success of their family life.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her vinegar-making business.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn R. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 25 years old. Jennelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jennelyn owns and operates a specialized business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling  scrap materials in their village. From the money she borrows from the organization, she will immediately procure a "trisikad" that will help her in buying scrap materials in their place. Jennelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jennelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jennelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business.

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Maria Anna

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Anna S., 33 years old, is married and is a resident of Green Valley, Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is blessed with two children: one in high school and the other one is an elementary student. Her husband is a driver.

In order to help her husband, she decided to engage in a business. In 2005 she opened up a little sari-sari store with an initial capital of only PHP 800 from the salary of her older sister. Her first customers were her neighbors.

To add to her capital, she decided to join Paglaum MPC in order to obtain a loan to be used in her business. Now, she is very thankful that it is not only the money she will get but also the benefits of being a member of Paglaum. She’s applying for PHP 6,000 as her first loan. Her only dream in life is to provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is engaged in running a typical village store in the rural village of San Jose Norte 1. She is married to Hilario D.. They were blessed with four children; three of them have successfully finished their studies and now have decent jobs. Her youngest is still in high school. Virgina is also hoping that her youngest will be able to graduate college and have her own stable job some day.

Virginia patiently maintains her village store in order to pay for the education of her youngest child through the daily income generated from the business. To further increase her income, Virginia is requesting the amount of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders to buy added merchandise to sell in the store.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda P. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 60 years old. Gilda is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Gilda owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from curtain making and upholstery service in their village. Gilda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her upholstering service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Gilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide her upholstery service

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella A., 55 years old, lives in Camanga Village, Tukuran, Zambonaga Del Sur. She is married with 4 children.  She has been doing vegetable gardening for 28 years with a present monthly income of PHP 6,000.  She joined Paglaum MPC last year, and she is on her 3rd loan in the amount of PHP 7,000.  The gains she generates from her vegetable garden will be used for expansion of her market gardening.

loans.use: Expansion of her vegetable garden

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hard-working vegetable vendor in the village of San Jose Norte 1, town of Mallig, Isabela. She is married to Melchor, a simple farmer. Farming is the major source of income in the village.

Zenaida is seeking the support of KIVA lenders who are willing to fund her loan for business improvement. She is proposing to borrow the amount of PHP 5,000 as additional working capital. Zenaida is hoping to maintain her business's good quality to able give her customers better satisfaction.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana or “Fely” as she is also called in their village is a high school graduate, happily married to Florencio. They live in the rural community of Buliwao in Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. They strive to send their three children to school up through college so that they will find a good job someday.

Despite the hardships of life, Feliciana and husband are helping one another to earn a living.  They cultivate their farm lot twice a year, planting rice and vegetables, and sometimes her husband uses their tricycle as a transport business for extra income.  

Fely, on the other hand, manages a rice vending business at home. Her desire to develop her business and progress has motivated her to seek the financial support of Kiva lenders to lend her the amount of PHP 12,000 as additional business capital. She believes that someday she will make her business grow, with her patience and the assistance of lenders.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda M., 55 years old, has 3 children. She lives in Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She has been engaged in fruit vending for 2 years now. She joined Paglaum MPC and has received three loans already.

Recently she applied for the amount of PHP 10,000 as additional capital for her fruit vending. The profit she generates from her fruit business will be used in purchasing textiles and to make into curtains for added income. Rosalinda makes use of her time in working at a hobby and at the same time making an additional income.

loans.use: expansion of her fruit vending business

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor M. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Eleonor is married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Eleonor owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Eleonor has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eleonor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleonor is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Eleonor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Mrs. B. is residing at Sinian, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old, married and blessed with 1 child. She owns and operates a business venture; her primary activity is raising livestock and pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for more than 16 years, earning presently 4,000 php per month.

Recently, she's requesting her 3rd loan in the amount of 3,000 php that will be used for purchasing feed for her pigs.Her future plan for her family is to continue to provide their basic needs and send her child to school up through college.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Mian Jurani

texts.en:
Mrs. P. is a bonafide resident of Cabgan Pta. Miray, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old, married and blessed with 1 child. She owns and operates a business venture raising livestock and pigs for sale. She earns 4,500 php per month from her business.

Recently, she's requesting her 1st loan in the amount of 2,000 php that she will use for additional capital for fishing materials for her husband. Her future plan for her family is that she would be able to pay for her child's schooling up through college so her child or children will find decent and stables job someday.

loans.use: capital for pig raising

loans.name: Ednalayn

texts.en:
Ednalayn L. is from the village of Anonang, Dumalinao. Zambo Sur. She is 30 years old. Ednalayn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ednalayn works in a family member's business venture selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products to tourists and local community members. Ednalayn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ednalayn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ednalayn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ednalayn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ednalayn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita C. is an active member of Paglaum MPC. She is 44 years old and lives in Camanga Village, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with two children.

Pacita has been involved in vegetable gardening for almost thirty years with a monthly income of PHP 3,000. She is asking for a loan to be used to expand her gardening business. She hopes to yield a very good harvest for an added income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to expand her gardening business

To make a living, Arlene runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Arlene sells vegetables , spices  and other food products. Arlene has been engaged in her business for more than 11 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. N. resides at Casul, Sapang Dalaga and has been a member of Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative since August 11, 2008. She is 39 years of age, married and is blessed with four children who are of school age.

For 4 years she has been engaged in her business selling seafood, such as fish and shrimps in the local community, earning an income of 5,000 per month. She is hoping that, with the help of microfinance, she can be able to make her business grow abundantly.

loans.use: To purchase fishing material

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro B. is 41 years old. He is married and has two children. He is a resident of Barangay Cataggaman Viejo of Tuguegarao City. He manages a tricycle transport business to support his family. Their place is near market amenities, thus Pedro chose a transport route to and from their place to the city market.

He is asking for a loan from Kiva amounting to 15,000 Philippine pesos for the maintenance of his motorcycle used in transporting passengers. Pedro can be described as a friendly type of person who works hard to give his family a better living situation. He has been in this business for five years and is still hoping to expand into some other kind of business, such vending, to further support the growing needs of his family.

loans.use: Motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Mrs. V. resides at Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Ocidental. She is 44 years of age, married, and blessed with three children.

She owns and operates a family member's business, operating a specialized retail store selling a variety of food products in her local community. She has been engaged in this business for more than twenty years. And now, she's obtaining her 16th loan in the amount of PHP 14,500 that will be used for additional capital in her existing business.

Her future plans for her family are that, together with her husband, she can continue to provide for their daily needs and can send their children to school until college.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business
